Reviews.Title: “'Origional', as they say in Spanish!”
Reviews.Author: Pelirrojo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights after Easter and liked the abundance of unusual, antique fittings and, even more, the care with which this small guest house is run. There were several thoughtful but not intrusive gestures, including a bottle of wine to mark my wife's birthday, and the management were always friendly and helpful. We paid 150 euros for a twin, en suite room which by expensive Barcelona standards seems good value. The location is excellent: very central but not too busy or noisy, and close to buses and metro. We walked there, the few blocks from the Estacion de Nord where the coach from Girona airport arrives. The breakfast-included is fine: juice, coffee/tea and croissant and toast. A carafe of drinking water is provided along with a notice to say that the tap water is not reccommended. Additional jugs of water cost 2 euros and I thought that was disappointing and that a fresh jug could be given each day of one's stay. Overall we warmly recommend this hostal and we would certainly try here first on another visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “HiddenTreasure”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: Adored this place! Sergio and Muhanned were extremely helpful and courteous. A tightly run but very accomodating ship from Check in to Check out. Very clean and comfy decor.The single rooms are small and not well lit but typical of Europe, but they have all the modern conveniences, plenty of mirrors for us gals and the biggest perk was the an en-suite bathroom for those who don't want to share private moments! Breakfast is served at your liesure and the presentation is charming. There is also a lovely shared Terrace alive with plant and flora that can be utilized during certain hours which I found to be a great place to sit with a glass of wine and unwind. This is a real find and great value for the money. And the location is perfect! Central to everything so all is within walking distance but also close to Plaza Catalunya, bus and Metro stops. There is also a Supermarket 1/2 block away for those who like to stock up on in room necessities. Also very secure and safe (esp for those traveling alone) with 24/7 thumbprint hotel access - so no key to lug around. And they offer other luxuries like in room Massage and Airport transfers, for a price of course. See below room recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: amber9999
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here, based on Trip Advisor reviews, while passing through Barcelona on the way to Valencia. We had a suite with a private balcony. This is not a hostel, it is a bed and breakfast on one floor. It is filled with antiques of all types, giving it a quirky but richly appointed aura. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I agree with the other excellent reviews and won't repeat them but just want to say that this is now "our place" in Barcelona. We are already planning our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Edelkitsch and Lovely Antiques”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: This place was spot-on from the moment we arrived. As we were coming in the downstairs door, a young man, who turned out to be the manager on duty, whisked our bags away from us and up the stairs. Our room faced a busy (but broad and pretty) street but had noise-proof doors to keep the traffic out (and also had a balcony). The "extended" breakfast was so extensive that we couldn't finish it the first day (toast, croissants, butter, jams, ham and cheese) and so we ordered one extended and one "normal" for the two of us after that. Our room had a lovely stuccoed ceiling, magnificent chandelier and beautiful antique furniture. The spacious shower had immediate (and very) hot water. But what really makes the Antica Espai especially recommended is the kind attention we received from the staff, who ensured that we had a very pleasant stay. In response to several criticisms: the water is fine, although bottled tastes better, and if you can't climb one flight of stairs from the ground floor to the next, you'd better find a place with an elevator. My only criticisms: the coffee could have been better, and the Internet signal could have been stronger.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: This looks very attractive and in many ways, it is.The double rooms are well set up, the beds and pillows are comfortable. The entry can be hard to find and once in the building, you have to walk up 4 half flights of very worn and broken marble stairs. This place is not for anyone with knee or hip problems. Next, there are signs saying not to drink the water from the taps. There is one small flask provided, and after that, it can be supplied at over 2 euros a flask. What a rip off! The water in Barcelona is high quality, and you can buy 1.5L of water for 50 euro cents. The only way to get tea or coffee is to order it, and it does come beautifully presented. However, as the desk is not manned 24/7, you can't get tea or coffee when you want and on some occasions in March, there was no-one there between 5.30pm and 7am. so no late nght or early morning tea. As well, the plumbing is suspect. My sink blocked up and was still that way in the morning, so I had to change rooms. I noticed some people like the breakfast. I was not impressed. I stayed in a monastery a week earlier and had fantastic food. What is provided here, is not great. I had pre paid, but decided to find my own after the first morning. For 10 euros, I got lukewarm coffee, cold white toast, a bit of sponge cake, half dried mandarins and strawberries, etc. The internet conection was never strong and very intermittant. I lost numerous emails when the internet cut out while I was sending and writing. The location is ok, but I think the Barri Gotic would be better. For me, the 'cuteness' factor did not make up for the deficits.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: coxeybouy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned today from Barcelona after spending 3 nights at this lovely and very unique hotel. Great location being so local to the bars & many many places to eat. We loved our time there, and found the staff more than helpful. The rooms are lovely, all modern ammenities and it was lovely sitting on the balcony at night enjoying a bottle of wine. Thanks guys for looking after us & delivering us to the airport today despite the General Strike!! Flight was on time! See you next time we visit Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Soozeequeue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days earlier this month (March/2012) This is a beautiful little place to stay. It occupies the second floor of a modernisme apt building. The room I had was one of the singles that opened up on to the common terrace. It was not large by any means but had what I needed and the antique furnishings were lovely. The terrace was beautiful and a lovely place to sit and unwind. Staff were wonderfully helpful in all regards. My room included breakfast, which is brought to you on the terrace at the time you choose. It was an enormous breakfast - fruit, yogurt, granola, toast, croissant, cake, ham, cheese, oj and coffee. I ended up making ham and cheese sandwiches for later in the day - and then finding a place to eat my dinner in the late evening on La Rambla. So my food costs were very low - as my dinner often ended up being helado (ice cream) , or meringues filled with almonds.... you only live once. One thing I should say is that if you have loud neighbors - and I did have loud neighbors, you will hear them. The terrace is supposed to close at 10 pm and my neighbors didn't respect this, they sat out with friends drinking and talking til midnight or later. So my suggestion to management would be to kindly and firmly remind people to quit the terrace at 10 when they check in. My ipod and earphones came in handy but just remember - this is an old building, it does not have modern soundproofing, and if you are very sensitive to noise it may not be for you. The character and good service made up for this for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but praise!”
Reviews.Author: sarah T
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from the hotel, it's my second time staying here (chose it based on Trip Advisor rating) and I meant to write a review last time and didn't get around to it. This place is absolutely great. The negative things people have said have to do mostly I think with what type of place they were looking for. If you want lots of amenities 24 hours a day, no, this is not necessarily the place for you. But if you want a central location, great price, and lots of character and comfort, it's perfect. Lots of character, great decoration, you feel like you're living in a baroque palace! You can enjoy cava out on the terrace, borrow from the extensive DVD collection, and most importantly, get anywhere in Barcelona quickly and easily. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hostal not a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nika16041
Reviews.Content: I booked this hostal thinking it's a hotel. It felt more like a B&B with limited reception hours . Internet was down a lot but the staff always tried to help. I stayed in a single room for 3 nights across from reception. Room is clean and comfortable. However, I can hear the Metro when it runs. Location is very central. Price is good for the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ariane h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice littel hotel for three nights as a family with two little children. It was one of the most relaxing stays with children at a hotel ever! The atmosphere was very friendly, relaxed and understanding, especially with the children, who of course were not always as calm as we would have liked and really loved the porcellaine figurines... ;-) The decoration was stunning, and very individual. The location is perfect, very central. We stayed in a room that had a little terrace, breakfast can be served there if wished. Like any other wish: fulfilled! "Jeanny in a bottle" apparantly stays and works at this super cute place!!!!!!! Thank you for a great time and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that turned out to be different to my expectation”
Reviews.Author: johandl
Reviews.Content: Initially I wanted to mark this hotel down to the lowest possible score because I felt misled by the high ranking, claims of 5 star services, and facilities. Subsequent to my visit and given some time to mull it over, my opinion of the hostel (do not consider this a hotel) has changed or at least become more balanced. We booked here at the last minute for the GSMA MWC event in Barcelona. Despite the high prices of surrounding hotels and it's central location, the hostel L Antic Espai offered us a very reasonable rate and two rooms. I arrived and chose the single room, room 110. The initial welcome was warm and friendly, and the two staff members we met during our stay, remained as warm and welcoming throughout the period. The room was an unpleasant surprise, tiny with a heavy musty smell that turned out to come from a tiny hidden location behind the only door/window. This little hidden square was where the building's water tanks were located, an internal location that offered anything but fresh air. No other windows exist to the outside, so the room filled with this stuffy smell. Finger printing allowed us free access through the doors 24 hours a day and the location was very central, minutes away from the main plaza de Catalunya and both the Red and Green lines on the Underground. My room's condition and the sense of feeling cheated continued until the very last morning when I finally ate breakfast at the hostel. The little outdoor veranda where breakfast is served blunted that disappointment a little and together with the helpfulness of the two staff members, raised my view of this place somewhat. What it is not is a business hotel, with the wireless down 75% of the time we stayed there (5 nights) and no lobby as in a traditional hotel lobby for a meeting area. If you're traveling on a tight budget, this must be your number one place to consider. Sadly we will not be back there next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Dont”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Although the people who run this hotel are very nice, standards are low and it is grossly overpriced, I have travelled all over the world and would say that this hotel should only charge half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: katharina_feuz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hostal in a very central location, excellent service, beautiful rooms, Nespresso coffee, large DVD-selection

Reviews.Title: “Location was just right for transportation, sights, and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: psgeorockclimber
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews were right on target for the location, cleanliness, and staff helpfulness. This hostal (originally was likely a very large flat/apartment that has been divided into several rooms with private shower, sink and toilet). The rooms designed for singles are small and the doubles range in size but are very nice. The patio off of three back rooms is nice but you can hear the school kids right next door. If you are in the back rooms you will feel the rumble of the subway that isn't that far away with a stop about the same distance as the airport bus stop. The one way taxi rate was approximately 12.5 euros. There are plenty of restaurants, walking boulevards, and parks within easy walking distance. The very nice airport bus (5.30 euros per person) is an easy 10 minute walk. The hostal is on the second story of the building and you have a series of stairs to navigate entering and leaving the hotel. There isn't an elevator to assist potential guests that have difficulties with stairs. If you have a day to spend outside the city, I highly recommend taking the R11 from the Barcelona Garcia train station (which is across the street from two Gaudi houses) to Figueres (1.5 hours each way and approximately 28.5 euros each way) to visit the exceptional Dali Museum and adjoining jewelry gallery. Check out the Dali beating heart on the internet just to get a taste of this amazingly gifted and talented artist. There are other lodging facilities in the immediate area but I will stay here again when in town. Even though there were only a few other guests on this very cold Jan/Feb weekend, they were very interesting and sharing breakfast with them was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: luvtocruise1993
Reviews.Content: Mahaned went out of his way for us ,picking us up from the airport, arranging taxi for cruise port. stayed 2 nights before cruise . near a good tapas bas down the street"Navanas". Did not see either Abel or Sergio. Room was adaquate, clean but small,yet fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A different kind (of Art)!!”
Reviews.Author: Jan S
Reviews.Content: Almost hidden behind a "usual" front door, you don't only enter a hostal. No, you step into a world of farytales. No stuff is accidently. Every vase, every bowl of ceramic and glass, every piece of furniture and every painting have to be at THIS place. Everything is harmonizing with each other, in lovely perfection. Warm coloured rooms support the feelgood factor. Also the cleanness makes you are impressed of! As the care of owners and the whole staff. No request stays unfulfilled! After an extensive breakfast you got much power for the new day and for the next discovery tour. Your tour could always start from THAT central point of Barcelona: Place de Catalunya! It's only a five-minute-walk away from hostal (like the famous Ramblas too!). Here you also got a Metro station and the bus stop of airport busses! To stay at L' Antic Espai doesn't feel like stay at any hostal. Here you are to visit lovely friends. And friends you visit always again! We are coming back!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “If you appreciate being cared for, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: janicedis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise and were delighted with the caring attitude of all staff. We were assisted with all our airline changes by staff who interpreted for us as our Spanish was barely passable. Directions to good tapas eateries were generously provided; our heavy luggage was carried up flights of stairs for us; the internet was free; the staff actually smiled at us and assisted in every possible way despite our linguistic incompatability. The hostal is perfectly situated for all the major sightseeing venues and particularly close to the Gaudi apartments and church; Las Ramblas,the old town and much of the incredibly beautiful architecture that constitutes inner Barcelona. But the reason I urge you to stay here is the friendliness of all the staff who show that they appreciate your custom and who understand the travellers' need for warmth and friendliness when you are far from home. The gorgeous quirky baroque decor is fun, the charming breakfast on the terrace with the plants and birds is 'other worldly' and places you a fin de siecle stage setting- Gigi would have been quite at home here. The only improvement I can suggest is that a boiled egg be offered with the breakfasts, and that the criossants and baked goods be straight from the oven -warm and crisp! We loved our stay and consider it an integral part of our delightful Barcelona experience. Cheers to our hosts! May they continue to care for us forever!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the word "hostal" put you off, it's a charming and beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: TriniCrystal
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, cousin and I stayed at the hotel in September of 2011. I have done my share of travelling and staying in different hotels, this by far has been my best experience. The owners and staff makes you feel like you are the only ones they are catering to even though there are other guests. They were friendly and very devoted to our needs. The owners (Serge and Abel) were a great delight, they made you feel like you were part of a family. They wanted your stay to be perfect and would do anything to make it possible. They truly put heart and soul into their hotel. We ABSOLUTELY loved the place. It was full of antiques and gorgeous pieces. We loved breakfast most of all, it was served right off the terrace of our room and the presentation was just beautiful. The terrace is beautifully layed out with plants and flowers surrounding it, at night, it is beautifully lit. Having breakfast was an experience by itself, all the pieces that breakfast was served on were antiques and each piece unique. We didn't even have to get dressed up to go to breakfast if we didn't want to, we would wear our robes that was provided by the hotel. Most times we were the only ones dining on the terrace (we ate early) but when there were other guests the comraderie was great because you got to meet people from different places and you could end up chatting for a long time. . Sight seeing was a breeze, the staff would make recommendations and we would go, we mostly did tours which suited us fine because my mom had a bit of trouble with walking. Everything they suggested was great. Our first night, they suggested we eat at a reasturant called the "Four Cats" it was just devine, if you go to Barcelona you have to go there at least once. If you are into wine, do the wine tour - unbelieveable. If you don't know what to do during your staff, just ask Serg, Abel or Muhannad - they are full of great ideas. The hotel is just a 5-10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas, which is the center of the town and very convenient and safe. When you leave, ask Muhannad to arrange, most times he will take you and it's much cheaper than the regular cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: talesofaturkey
Reviews.Content: This place was like taking a step back into the past (think red velvet), in a good way. Our room was small (normal size for Barcelona though) but very well-appointed, with an excellent blend of tasteful antiques and modern amenities. Apparently the owners regularly comb Barcelona's antique markets and bring home quality pieces. The staff were helpful while being unobtrusive - exactly what we were looking for. If you're looking for a full-service modernist hotel with a 24 front desk and talking bedside tables, this may not be the place for you. I'm sure they would've offered more touristy help if we'd asked (apparently they accommodate cruise-goers all the time), but with the help of a guidebook we borrowed (and later returned) from a shelf in the hallway we didn't need it. If you're looking for a unique hotel in a great location (walking distance to everything - we didn't take the metro or a cab once although, admittedly, we like to walk) for a comparatively very good price, this is your spot. We are independent travelers that were looking for essentially one step above our own apartment - this was a perfect place for us. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and romantic hostal in the heart of Passeig de gracia”
Reviews.Author: mediboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'antic espai for 5 nights and had a great time. Our room number was 105. It contained a matrimoninal bed. The room was not so big but was sufficient. The closet was good. The bathroom was tiny. It also had free wifi, a small tv in the roof with satellite channels and access to a big terrace that we shared with the neighbour room. Every morning we got continental breakfast at the terrace that was full of plants and tropical birds. And we could hear lots of kids from the school just beside of the terrace, but it wasnt annoying. We enjoyed the service from the guys in the reception and the maid that always was friendly. The hostal is more personal than other hotels we have been to, and we like the classic design. We could go back next time to this fantastic 5 star hostal!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and value”
Reviews.Author: ChattanoogaBelle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel deserves the good reviews. Super friendly staff, rooms are attractive with comfortable beds, clean bathroom and plenty of hot water. Breakfast is pleasant and plentiful (simple breakfast) either out on the terrace or inside in the salon. The keyless entry was fantastic, we never had to worry about losing a key or coming in too late after exploring the city. Free wifi worked well for all of our devices (2 laptops and 2 iPhones).

Reviews.Title: “Great location + unique charm = enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob4998
Reviews.Content: 'Hostal' is probably a misnomer for this comfortable, well-appointed lodging. Each room reflects the owners' eclectic perspective/personality, but all contain the modern-day essentials, including LCD TV (although minus CNN), the expected toiletries and comfortable furnishings. The location is exceptional - walking distance to primary points of interest as well as restaurants and tapas bars. The staff is personable and extremely helpful, clearly interested in the specific needs of each guest. Because the Hostal occupies an older building and was not constructed as a hotel, the interior walls are not sound resistant, resulting in some possible disturbance. Also, given the nature of the lodging, the reception desk has limited hours (although the Management provides 24-hour emergency telephone contacts). In sum, if you are looking for a well-equipped, unusual and uniquely-satisfying bed & breakfast, L'Antic Espai is a great choice. And, given the reasonable cost coupled with a prime location, I would not hesitate to recommend it to any traveler willing to dispense with the conveniences of the modern (and impersonal) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and full of antiques”
Reviews.Author: married35
Reviews.Content: On the border of Las Rambles and Eixample, this hotel provides a great location to access everything. The Passeig de Gracia metro station is a short 2 block walk away. The Plaza de Cataloyna is 3 blocks and you can find the tourist buses there (red and blue). If you want a modern, sleek hotel this is not the stay for you; but if you want an authentic and well preserved building with lots of antiques, you will love your stay. A digital fingerprint will give you access to the front door (which is a door within a door) and the second floor entrance to the hotel. The hallways will feel a little cramped because this a residential space and then add the antiques which are everywhere. We had a room that faced the main street, Gran Via de les Cortes Catalanes with a balcony. You will feel the passing of the metro, which mostly subsides late at night. We were not bothered by this; but light sleepers may have issues. The owners have both a desk with free computer access or a laptop, which you may take to your room. You can have a simple or larger breakfast, which will feel like a very formal English tea experience. We had breakfast on the lovely terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal L' Antic Espai - home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: jmentel97
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this wonderful little hotel. Walking distance to great places to eat and Ramblas. Muhannad and the rest of the staff took good care of us. He was able to recommend good restaurants. Breakfast was wonderful and you certainly felt pampered eating at a table with linen and good china. The hotel was more like a home than a hotel, as there were so many antiques. Beautiful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in the heart of everything!”
Reviews.Author: DianaChicago17
Reviews.Content: From the time we started planning our trip; Muhannad went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our entire stay went smoothly. We travelled from the US for almost an entire day so we opted to splurge and have him pick us up at the airport. Although he was a few minutes late it ended up being fine (and note that if he does pick you up, he holds up a picture of the hostal). If you are looking for cheap transportation to the airport, you can take the bus from the Placa de Catalunya which is not even a five minute walk from the hostal and it only costs 5 Euros. The hostal could not be better located. You are on the Gran Via, very close to Placa Catalunya, Sagrada Familia (15 minutes walking), the Barri Gothic. You can literally walk to most places, and the buses are very easy to take as well. We had breakfast one morning in our room and it was absolutely fantastic. Margarita was very nice; the only bad thing was that she had run out of milk so we could not have hot chocolate. The rest of the meal was great, some ham and cheese, bread, tea or coffee and fresh juice. All on antique plates. Each room has such character, and everything is immaculate. Our room was amazing too, we had a gorgeous balcony that overlooked Gran Via. The only downside to our stay would be the spotty WiFi. It would work in the evenings but in the morning we’d have no connection. There was a computer that we could use but sometimes that didn’t have a connection either.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: PeterSurrey2
Reviews.Content: I am an avid reader of the reviews on Tripadvisor and finding out about this lovely little hotel justifies my research. I would not have discovered L'Antic Espai by any other means. So much has been said in praise of this hotel that I can add little to it except to say that everything good is thoroughly deserved. We stayed in Room 102 and it was charming with a lovely glassed in balcony facing on the the Gran Via. Breakfasting there was a charming experience. We opted for the bottle of cava (a princely 10 Euros) and happened to mention that it was my wife's birthday to the receptionist, Mu Hannad, and when the wine was brought to the room it was accompanied by a lovely creamcake, The staff were very obliging - could not have been more helpful. They helped to make our viisit to a truly impressive city even more memorable. .

Reviews.Title: “True Hospitality with Heart”
Reviews.Author: LauraHartmark
Reviews.Content: The owners of this charming Roccocco boutique hotel truly care about their guests. This makes all of the difference: in small and large details.

Reviews.Title: “It's Different”
Reviews.Author: Robedith
Reviews.Content: Super little hotel in an ideal location for visiting Barcelona. Interior decor (diametrically opposite to the view from the street) is like nothing we have seen in any other hotel. Friendly and helpful owners who could not do enough to make our visit as enjoyable as possible. Breakfast of tea/coffee and toasted white bread and a croissant while not strictly in breach of the 'Trade Descriptions Act' was the only slight disappointment. Perhaps a little fresh fruit and a baguette?

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary14365
Reviews.Content: This is a small 10 room hotel in an excellent location in Barcelona, Spain. It is clean and friendly. The staff, especially Mohannet, was very helpful with suggestions for sightseeing, tickets, dinner and cab arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “True taste of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: This beautiful antique filled B&B is located in the heart of Barcelona within easy walking distance of many of the city's attracions. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpfull and more than accomadating, especially when our stay was unexpectantly extended by two days. Our room was very clean and comfortable with high ceilings and sliding doors that opened onto an outdoor patio where we very much enjoyed our delicious breakfast. If you wish to experience the energy of downtown Barcelona combined with a unique bed and breakfast we highly recommend that you give Hostal L'Antic Espai a try.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LeslieUK2011
Reviews.Content: This must be the friendliest hotel in all of Barcelona. The owners and staff are friendly and helpful at all times, and are so happy to ensure that their guests have a good time. The hotel is full of fine interesting antiques and the atmosphere is one of peace and calm. There is no bar, nor some other things that you find in large hotels, but this is compensated fully by the pleasing and friendly owners and staff. Breakfast and drinks on the balcony, or surrounded by the antique furniture and other pieces, is a delight -and the hotel is situated in a good location being just a few minutes away from Placa Catalunya. I have been there more than once in the past - and will go there again whenever visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: This is the real way to experience Barcelona! We spent two days in Barcelona prior to our cruise departure. We found this bed and breakfast on Trip Advisor. The owners Abel and Sergio were excellent hosts and the experience was truly authentic. The furniture and accessories were absolutely beautiful. As a precaution, it's upstairs and you enter thru a small door that's part of a huge wooden door. It's hard to explain but it adds to the experience. One more caution, the beds are short. If you're 6'2" or taller the beds are only 6' long and footboards restrict you from hanging your feet over the end of the bed. Don't let this keep you from staying here. WE ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: PatPandBobY
Reviews.Content: Don't come here if you hate antiques. The entire place is furnished with them and each room has it's own distinct style. Yet this small so-called hostal operates like a modern 5 star operation. Service couldn't be better, great location and it is good value in an expensive city. Nothing was too much trouble, even when we checked in after 2am. We'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: cubeesc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the great review it had on trip advisor. Don t be fooled, this place is just terrible. You should know that the hostal is located over a subway line, so every 3 minutes you hear a rumbling sound and you feel your bed shaking. The room is very humid and the beds are too hard and uncomfortable. All the rooms are located on the same floor and close to the main entrance so you hear all the doors closing and all the people coming in at night. On the bright side, the staff was nice and the hostal is well located but this place is not worth over 50 euros per night mainly because it does not deliver what we were looking for: A place where we could get some sleep!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: adamec39254
Reviews.Content: Had the most fantastic time at this hotel. The service was outstanding and would rate as the best service I have received anywhere in the world. Loved the room and the design features of this hotel. All staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: travelerusc
Reviews.Content: First of all, I can't say enough for the staff at Hostal L'Antic Espai. My fiancee and I were there for five nights in early August and the place was fabulous; we were treated really well. It's location, ten minutes' walk from Plaza Catalunya is perfect for exploring the Barri Gotic, walking down Las Ramblas, and even walking to the beach. I might add that it is located such that one is not surrounded by a million tourists at all times. Yet, one can even, though about a half hour's distance away on foot, reach La Sagrada Familia if one wants to. It is situated in the second floor of a building along the beautiful and expansively tree-lined Via de les Corts Catalanes. We had a room with a balcony facing the boulevard. The amenities are adequate, not fancy, but just right for the price. The rooms are large with really high ceilings and the price was just right. The private bathrooms were adequately appointed as well. I fell in love with Barcelona like I have with no other european city and will definitely return to L'Antic Espai upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful quaint hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lacey082
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located centrally in Barcelona away from the hustle of Las Ramblas, but still close enough to walk there. It is also very close to the shopping area and eating areas. Public transport was also very close and walkable. Abel and Sergio were lovely and so helpful. They also give a personal touch to the hotel - it is totally different to any other hotel we stayed at during our Europe trip. Breakfast each morning was served in the alfresco outside. The only down-side I can think of is that other guests staying in the hotel had to walk through our hotel room to get to the breakfast area each morning (there is no other access). There is internet access, laundry service and Sergio even brought in his little dog for us to play with. Overall, L'antic Espai is a bit costly but definitely worth the stay if you are looking for a beautiful and quaint hotel to stay at in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Charming, beautifully furnished rooms”
Reviews.Author: overmyal
Reviews.Content: This hostal has it all. It is located in a lovely Moderniste apartment building and within walking distance to many attractions. This B & B is decorated in whimsical but tasteful vintage everything. It is very, very nice. We recommend the upgraded breakfast served on the enclosed balcony. It is beautifully arranged and was the best breakfast of our 2 week trip. A fun feature was in lieu of an key to enter the B & B, they use finger imaging....quite cool.

Reviews.Title: “Something special”
Reviews.Author: LizavetaGerman
Reviews.Content: This is the place if you want to add some colors to your Barcelona tour and stay in a special place, not just a room to spend a night between rushing across the city. Hospitality of the owners and cozy charm of this little hotel space made a very good impression on us. We enjoyed the decoration of our room and hotel in general, all made with love. The rooms are well equipped, bathroom is modern and clean. There's a lot of nice touches from the owners like umbrellas in every room (it helped us much once) and welcome-drink, tasty sangria. Abel and Sergio were really friendly and gave us many useful tips (thank you for that, guys!) One should definitely follow their advice and try Cuidad Condal, a tapas-bar two block away from the hotel. The place is always crowded at night, but is not so obviously touristic. You might wait for a table for a while or try to get a place at "bar area", actually, in front of glass case with all those delicious tapases and fresh seafood. You can order anything by simply pointing the piece you like the most to the barman (and don't even try to figure out how it's called in Spanish or Catalana), while he easily pours your glass with wine, reasonable priced, by the way. It's really comfortable to have such place within some 8 min walking from the hotel, so you don't have to grab a taxi or walk far. And the location of the hotel is perfect, especially for those who came to BCN for the first time. Breakfast (toast, butter, jam, croissant, milk, really strong coffee and a jar of orange juice) was served with charming classical tableware at terrace, full of flowers and plants, with birds in vintage cages. Don't hesitate to use the terrace in the evening as well. One evening we didn't go anywhere for a dinner, got a bottle of cava and some jamon in a supermarket, Abel gave us glasses, plates, lightened the candles, so we felt ourselves like in old-fashioned village garden, which was heeling after the hot day of intense sightseeing. I would highly recommend the place. We spent a lot of time searching for the best hotel option and are highly satisfied with our final choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Squrlgurl71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on other Tripadvisor reviews and were pleasantly rewarded. The tiny Hostal is located on the 2nd floor of a very old building so there is no elevator, only narrow steps. The owner, Abel, was gracious with helping us heave our bags up and down the steps. When we arrived there was a freshly made pitcher of cold sangria on our bedside stand. Abel, his partner, and staff went way out of their way to make us feel welcome. He even drove us to a flea market one day and to our cruise ship terminal when we checked out. The rooms are uniquely decorated with eclectic antiques and very clean. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street below which was nice. The glass doors to the balcony are new and block out street noise quite well.The heavy drapes muffled any noise or ambient light and we both slept well. The Hostal is located within walking distance of Playa Cataluyna , the central point for getting around in this part of town. My mother and I felt safe enough in the area even when we walked at night. There was free internet access as well. If you are looking for a reasonably priced and quiet place in BCN, this is it!!! Truly a hidden gem made possible by the awesome owners and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like queens”
Reviews.Author: bbaeteman
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we experienced the reception to be overall welcoming. We had our fingerprints taken, our ID cards numbers copied and our Visa cards swiped. The information provided was complete, helpful and comforting. Our salute goes out to the hotel owners for decorating the hotel the way they did. When claiming to have an antique theme hotel, one should be pretty self-assured. Our expectations in this respect were met. Every detail of the hotel accomodation complied with the theme without ever making the guests feel dusty. The total experience was gay and pleaseant. The rooms were clean and the supplies were satisfactory. However, the room airconditioning didn't seem to be able to cope with the hot weather outside, even though the latter can hardly be considered exceptional. Although a lovely hair dryer was put at my disposition in the single room, it failed to accomplish its single task. Honesty dictates to add that my friends in the double room had a different experience. For me, this is not much of a consolation, as I get really anal about my hair. At night, the single room proved to be decent. The double room however appeared to be above a subway line. This is acceptable per se, unless a subway actually runs through it. The hotel is located in the heart of Barcelona, which is practical and rather exceptional for a hotel in this price range. Although Sergio tried his best to advise us on where to go, we couldn't help but notice his taste being rather cliché. Upon asking where to buy jamon iberico, he sent us to el corte inglès while we expected a somewhat more local and authentic delicatessee store. He did however advise us a cocktailbar that was more than satisfactory. The continental breakfast was a bit disappointing. The croissants and the pain au chocolat gave a rather industrial impression and were not crispy at all. Indeed, everything on the table was compliant with the antique theme, including the baked goods. After embarking upon a discovery trip in the city, ones legs tend to be rather exhausted. We felt this to be an exquisite opportunity to enjoy the hotel massage service. Unfortunately, it appeared our visit to Barcelona coincided with the passing of the masseuse's mother. Consequent to this, the masseuse flew back to an undisclosed country. Regardless of the nuissances mentioned above, we are happy to have chosen l'Antic Espai for our city-trip in Barcelona. The quality offered outweighed what we had expected considering the favourable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great value-would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nromero
Reviews.Content: The Pros: Awesome location - they are near La Rambla and other tourist spots. Lots of restaurants nearby. Convenient supermarket (Opencor?) a few blocks away. It was easy to get to from airport. It's near a couple of metro stops. Friendly and helpful staff. Sergio greeted us warmly when we came in. Our room was ready so we got to check in early (on a red eye from NYC). He mapped out all the tourist and must see sights close-by. Suggested a tapas bar that we liked. Abel was quite friendly as well. And they both spoke English quite well. The rooms were clean. Antiques were beautiful. Toiletries were adequate. Nice movie selection for relaxation after a long day of being out and about. Breakfast was decent and they wait for you all morning (even early afternoon). Coffee was delicious and strong! The area is safe. They've got a great fingerprint reader security system. No kidding around there! The Cons: Our room was small, but was expected.  We didn't have tissue (Kleenex) in room which didn't help my cold. (But we stayed at another place, a four star hotel in Barcelona, and they didn't have Kleenex either. ???) The walls are paper thin, so you can sometimes hear your neighbors, but that wasn't really a big deal.  There was no safe in our room, but there was a common safe available. We used it once then felt that we really didn't even need to. If we decide to take the whole family to Barcelona, we'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Niall1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth staying in: centrally located, reasonably priced and decorated and equipped in style! The owners were extremely welcoming and friendly and were of great help in dealing with the parking of our hire car, as well as recommending good places to visit, eat and drink. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LondonSusanV
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely amazing stay at this place in July. I stayed here for 2 weeks. It was my first trip o Barcelona and I was travelling alone. But staying here made the whole difference to my whole trip!! The place is very clean, elegant and classy...it has some amazing antique pieces each painstakingly handpicked by the owners. I stayed in a few different rooms during my stay....each room is uniquely decorated, and rooms with both the balcony view and terrace view were amazing. The wholesome breakfast is served on the beautiful terrace, and it's such a good start to the day and I met so many amazing people here. The owners Abel & Sergio made sure I felt welcomed and I felt like it was 'home away from home'. They both were very friendly, and extremely helpful with suggestions of places to visit, eat and things to do. They arranged a Boleros night for the guests one night....home-cooked Cuban food, live music and dancing...had an amazing night. You can see that Abel & Sergio have taken so much effort to maintain this place o a very high standard and to cater to the needs of all their guests. The staff are very helpful and pleasant....and it's all the small touches that made my stay truly special. The central location of the place also made it very easy for me travel everywhere on my own. I would definitely recommend this place to stay and I hope to go back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelcdn
Reviews.Content: We spent just over a month in Spain and Portugal, and of all of the places we stayed this is the only one that disappointed us. If we had just stayed one night we likely would have been happy, but after three nights we found that there were too many issues to really call our stay enjoyable. First, the good news. The location is great, just a few blocks from Las Ramblas, within easy walking distance of Sagrada Familia and many other attractions, and relatively easy to find, even in a large city like Barcelona. Now for the bad news. The hotel was way too over-decorated. This isn't just a matter of personal taste - we found that it was so cluttered that it was difficult to find room for our own stuff. At first it was quaint, but then it just became irritating. Toiletries were not replaced. Several of our bath towels had holes in them. Cleanliness of the floors was not great - we ran our foot towel over the floor in the bathroom after a shower, and it came up dirty. The bathroom is too small for any of your own toiletries (ie shaver, makeup) to be stored. We had a room that adjoined the outside terrace. That was ok as long as your neighbours were quiet when they used it, but that wasn't always the case and several times we were awoken by groups having an early breakfast on the terrace. If the neighbours don't wake you up, then the birds in the cages likely will. I love birds, and don't mind waking up to bird song, but one of the caged birds had a metallic screech that sounded like some of the toys that the street vendors on Las Ramblas were hawking. Overall, we were definitely expecting better. I would not recommend this hotel for a stay greater than one night.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy little hotel with friendly and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: palandri
Reviews.Content: Whoever decorated this hotel obviously had a lot of fun doing so. Wherever you turned there was a display of interesting knick-knacks to look at. We also particularly enjoyed the breakfasts on the patio with the doilies covering the milk and orange juice. Everyone we interacted with was super friendly and attentive, and the rooms were clean and relatively spacious. Definitely better than its two stars would suggest. There were plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from for lunch and dinner if you didn't want to stray to far for a meal. The next time we're in Barcelona we will likely stay there again. The only negatives would be that the hotel isn't really close to any of the main sights. Getting to those sights will require very long walks or the use of public transportation. We exclusively used taxis to get around and a 5-6 euro fare pretty much got you anywhere in the city. We also made the mistake of driving our car into Barcelona. The average rate for parking in a public parking garage is around 45 euros a night. With notice, the hotel will provide garage parking for your car for "only" 35 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “A hostel which deserves 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Jc0000988
Reviews.Content: Exceptional place. Great looking, real professional, clean, perfect located and quiet. Only minus is limited breakfast (coffee/tea, juice, bread, croissant, fruit, yoghurt, muesli, cheese/ham for extended breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: fluffystella2004
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this boutique hotel! The owners Abel and Sergio and their dedicated staff went out of their way to make my stay an enjoyable one. The hotel is filled with wonderful antiques from Brazil and Cuba. It's almost like going back in time. I almost expected a matriarch of the hotel to join me for breakfast on the patio and regal me with her past loves. I had a single room. It was small but perfect for me. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and the water hot. When I arrived they were able to accommodate me since I arrived early in the morning (check-in is usually in the afternoon) and I was exhausted. So when I go to my room, I went straight to bed and slept very well. One of my favorite things was their "Cubano" night. Drinks, food, live music and dancing. I met some really nice people and really enjoyed myself that evening. Also, you could borrow DVDs from their collection to watch in your room. That made it very homey for me. Wrapped up in bed, watching a movie...just like home.

Reviews.Title: “Kept looking for my Grandma, surely she decorated this place”
Reviews.Author: MBZBOY
Reviews.Content: Good location, 2 blocks from major tourist destinations, next to the subway line and several good restaurants. The entrance is a door in a door, the kind you normally see in French movies. You have to ring a bell to be let in, then its up a floor (2 sets of stairs) before you get to the hotel. It's actually the 2nd floor of a multi-story building. I read that others had problems checking in and I can understand. I was let in by the housekeeper about 1:00 in the afternoon. The manager is there in the morning and late afternoon. Left my bag and headed out. Returned later and manager was there to give me a key. My room looked out over the street, but there was insulating balcony with a double pane door to block the sound. But, I could feel the rumble of the subway every now and then. Not a bad thing, sort of comforting. Did I mention my Grandmother had to have decorated this place. It had every art deco, ceramic, dust collector, bric-a-brac every made. All of the furniture was from the distant past, but not a bad thing. It is probably romantic in a couples sort of way. Breakfast was included in room, I opted for coffee, juice and bread. Lovely. Again, very old fashioned, took me back to yesteryear. Wifi worked once password given, never had a problem with it. I'd go back to hotel if ever in Barca. But, unless for business probably wouldn't go back. Loved Madrid and Pomplona, but didn't like attitude of majority of folks in Barca. Let me say staff at hotel didn't have attitudes other than what can they do to help.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure and a treat!”
Reviews.Author: LostNationTraveler
Reviews.Content: Small, warm and eclectic - like being in Grandma's house surrounded with her antiques. The staff is very kind and attentive - much more than a hotel - like a home away from home. The terrace outside our rooms (we went with another couple) was garlanded with vines and flowers, the birds in their cages provided a sweet backdrop to our breakfast, and the space proved to be a wonderful spot to wind down the evening with a nice bottle of wine and soft breezes. Hard to believe we were in the middle of a vibrant and exciting city. Ask for rooms 105 and 107. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Kris132
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautifully and lovingly decorated, The location was perfect; everything in Barcelona was within walking distance. The owners were delightful and extrememly helpful with wonderful recommendations for restaurants, transportation and events.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Owners”
Reviews.Author: FreighttrainToronto
Reviews.Content: On our first day, we arrived at 2:00 p.m. in the afternoon, pressed the buzzer to the 2nd floor hotel and no one answered. We used our cell phone to contact them with no success, so we opted to roll our bags to the nearby 4-star hotel and fortunately, the reception staff offered to store our bags so that we could go for a stroll or a coffee. They also called L'Antic Espai and there was no answer. Eventually, the chamber maid let us in and offered us an ice cold sangria, which was very thoughtful. My recommendation is to call in advance from the airport or train station to ensure that someone will be there to greet you and assist you with your bags. It's awkward to depend on alternate hotel staff. We spent 8 days with Abel and Sergio, who are amazing hosts. These two and their auxiliary staff go out of their way to provide assistance with luggage, laundry, transportation, and they gave us excellent advice about restaurants as well as sightseeing suggestions. Do pay heed to Abel's invaluable tips to foil pickpockets––a serious problem in Barcelona. My husband's wallet disappeared in the nearby Passeig de Gracia Metro station as he was walking down the stairs (he ignored Abel's sage advice). We stayed in terrace room 104, which was lovely. The only drawback is that the large, 12' high armoire lacks storage drawers, which meant that we had to live out of our bags. This place is fun and quirky, clean, well-located, and the owners are kind; however, it's not ideal for a long-term stay. They could also improve their breakfasts by providing fresh bakery products such as whole grain breads rather than white wonder bread, croissants, and little cakes in cellophane, which remind me of airplane food. It would also be nice if they would vary the breakfast menu occasionally by providing some different fresh fruit, rather than cut up apples, bananas and grapes each and every morning. I have a concern about their air freshening system that emits a chemical-perfume odour every hour during the day. I am not keen on breathing volatile organic compounds. I brought this matter to their attention and I'm certain that they'll work on it as I believe that they are genuinely concerned and caring. The space is lovely and the owners are kind and attentive, but improvements need to be made.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY TERRIFIC!”
Reviews.Author: LFA
Reviews.Content: I do not want to waste your time repeating all the wonderful reviews you'll see below. They are true. The level of personalized service is outstanding, including even pick-up and drop-off at the airport at very nominal rates by a member of the staff. The name translates as "The Old Space" and it fulfills this beautifully. Everything is tastefully accomplished. Yet, the hotel is technologically advanced with Hi-Speed Internet, and fingerprint recognition for keying of entries. I would cerainly put this on the top of my list for a stay in Barcelona. I found the rooms perfectly adequate in size, and the breakfasts on the terrace a lovely way to start the mornings. Why stay in a standard hotel when you can experience the difference here?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: NatsDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights before a Med cruise. Is the place quirky? Yes. Would I recommend to a friend or stay again. Absolutely on both counts. We had room 104 which had terrace access and we loved it. The service provided by Segio, Abel (thank you for your help with voluminous luggage) and the lovely Carla were exemplary. I just wish we had booked earlier for our cruise return somthat we could have enjoyed even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Froufrou64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hostal L'Antic Espai for 11 days during June. There is not enough space on this posting to note all the positive things we can say about this establishment. The fantastic hosts/owners - Abel and Sergio - were ever attentive, knowledgeable, and courteous. They knew the local area well and gave many recommendations for restaurants and shopping venues - all to our liking. They helped with language and cultural issues. This Boutique Hotel is comfortable, extremely well decorated with tasteful antiques, knick-knacks, and pieces of art. Both hosts are very knowledgeable about their antiques and furniture. Rooms are decorated in-line with certain time periods. Particularly appreciated was their laundry service, high speed internet access, the breakfasts, the beautiful maid Carla, the antiques, the authentic floor tiles, the security of the building (fingerprint technology), the frilly shower caps and overall value for money. The location is ideal - 3 mins to La Ramblas or the Cathedral. Taxi stand at the door stop. Metro train 2 mins. Chain Hotels are a dime a dozen and meet a certain need within the travel market - but Hostal L'Antic Espai is unique. We have no hesitation in recommending this Boutique Hotel to visitors to Barcelona. I am confident that Abel and Sergio will ensure that your stay is as memorable as ours was. If we could - we would be back there tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Not onlhy will we be back but will recommend it to any of our family/friends going to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Patgos
Reviews.Content: We checked in on July 24 and checked out on July 26 at L’antic Espai. I have to say thois was a flawless experience, from the booking with Muhannad (sorry we didn’t get to meet you) to the service given by all Hotel staff going from hosts Sergio and Abel to the maid booking our taxi to go to the cruise terminal. Sergio and Abel could not have given a better, more personalized service. Those guys know how to make you feel valued (something so many hotels do not see as that important!). We followed their recommendations for tapas (if you don’t mind the wait, it’s worth it) to a Flamenco show at Poble Espanyol ( a once in a life time experience, meaning I would not do it more than once: Flamenco is just not my thing, I realized). As previously mentioned by so many reviewers, the rooms as so charming. Due to last minute bookings on our part, we had to change rooms for the 2nd night. If you can, definitely request a room with the terrace (we had 104), the experience of having breakfast there, in porcelain cups and plates was great. Another example of great service: we had organized for 8 am breakfast. Being jet-lagged from our trip from Australia, we woke up quite early. It was no trouble for Abel to get us breakfast at 6:30. Free Wifi internet available and fast! A terrific experience which made our short stay in Barcelona all the more memorable. Patrick, Sharon and Jaydn

Reviews.Title: “6/5 rating - if that was available!!”
Reviews.Author: sharks_r_ok
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Australia. If you want flat screen TV's and mod cons, this is not the place for you. If you want somewhere which is tastefully and classically furnished, owners provide exceptional guest care and is centrally located - L'Antic Espai is highly recommended. Each room is individually decorated - all with furniture, paintings, light fittings, tiled floors, (even fancy shower caps)and a range of statues and ornaments from a set time period. The hallways are packed with interesting and historical artifacts imaculately displayed and maintained. The terrace has ornate ceramic birdcages, chirping birds and again, a range of antique planters. The owners - Abel and Sergio were ever attentive - they helped with phone calls, recommendations to restaurants and directions and were a delight to spend time with. Each morning, breakfast is served with exceptional care - a different crockery setting - antique again. Nothing was too much trouble. We rate this Boutique Hotel as THE highight of our trip to Barcelona. We will certainly return. Can strongly recommend. L 'Antic Espai's high TripAdvisor rating is certainly warranted.

Reviews.Title: “Soft Landing in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: yjg21
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a well-priced delightful and charming Old World style B&B in the heart of Barcelona, this is your place! We arrived after a lengthy flight from the US to be greeted by Carla, the housekeeper, who promptly toted our heavy bags upstairs to the 2nd floor where this B&B is located. Hosts Sergio and Abel have gone to great lengths to create charm and comfort. Rooms are lovingly decorated with antiques, beds are comfy with a water carafe at bedside, bathrooms are modern, pristine and fully stocked (including a hairdryer ), there's even a free computer for guests in the reception area. Breakfast is ample and served on fine china. Sergio and Abel provided very useful tips for sightseeing and were even kind enough to book us tickets in advance so that we could skip the long lines at Sagrada Familia. We can't wait to return in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rebmac
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-week stay in Spain. After a week playing golf at Costa del Sol we spent 5 days in Barcelona and stayed at this boutique hotel. Unfortunately we were not able to book one of the larger rooms so my husband and I stayed in one of the smaller twin rooms. The operative word here is "small." You have to book months in advance to get a room really big enough for two if you're staying more than a day or so. We were not able to unpack. However, we did see the bigger rooms and would would have no problem returning to a bigger room. The hotel consists of 10 rooms on one floor in a residential building and is quite charming; decorated with antiques. The rooms were clean, and the service terrific. The location is excellent, just two blocks away from Plaza Catalunya. This hotel is a great value for the money. We got great recommendations to restaurants and events from both Muhamet and Abel. Hi speed internet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and recommend it to others”
Reviews.Author: VASAAMI
Reviews.Content: Sergio & Abel are wonderful hosts, and I hope to be able to stay at their hotel again. The location is perfect for getting around the city, the rooms are comfortable, the breakfasts are lavish and well-presented. I would definitely recommend this small, boutique hotel to friends. If you rent patio rooms, breakfast is served on the patio, otherwise in rooms or in lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Boutique Hotel and Regal Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MattandLynda
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to many different countries and this quaint boutique hotel now ranks as one of our favourite places to stay. The location was excellent and our hotel stay gave us what we always hope for in a vacation -- a cultural experience, good memories and stories to share. A sincere passion and appreciation for the opulence and artistry of a forgotten past is poured into every detail of its beautifully restored antique rooms (as fellow renovators, we know how much time and effort went into this place!). This hotel has so much character and everywhere you look, there is another surprise. We felt like royalty every morning we awoke to the ornate chandelier and rich, red curtains in our room and this feeling continued right through our continental breakfast. Not only was it delicious and satisfying, but they staged it using their antique china and silverware so that we felt like we were transported back in time -- a true delight. They were also able to accommodate a gluten-free breakfast, which was truly appreciated, especially since we know this requires special arrangements. In addition, we felt Abel went out of his way for us during our stay in little ways which made the experience more personal and he was such a pleasure to deal with. We were also glad we purchased the additional transfer service he offered to the airport as it made our morning departure stress-free. We have already recommended this hotel to friends. -- Mathew and Lynda

Reviews.Title: “Very restful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bunstonuk
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly agree with all the positive comments made by previous reviewers - this is a real gem of a small hotel, with wonderful owners and staff, in a fantastic location. They have managed to achieve a blend of old-fashioned charm and antiques with modern luxuries and technology. The beds had excellent quality mattresses, the room was spotlessly clean, it was surprisingly quiet at night, and we felt we could have asked for anything extra we needed. We thought it was a real bonus to come back after a long day's sightseeing and sit on the beautiful terrace with an evening cup of tea (for a very reasonable 2 euros for a really big pot of tea)! And our son appreciated the drawers of DVDs to choose from to watch in bed. On our first evening we were recommended the tapas restaurant Ciudad Condal, about 10 minutes' walk away, which was a great tip, and we returned there several times to eat early-mid evening, as we didn't want a late night dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: claudette
Reviews.Content: I loved my 13 day stay at this charming hotel. I felt at home immediately. I stayed in Room 106, a single room, that opened on to the terrace where breakfast was served. I highly recommend a room opening onto the terrace because you can also enjoy the terrace in the evening after a long day of walking. The terrace has lovely plants and small birds in nice cages. The room was very comfortable. The bed was larger than an American single bed, just a little smaller than an American double bed. The room was very clean. The bathroom had a nice shower with good water pressure. There was a very good hair dryer. The location was ideal. It is only a few blocks from Plaza de Catalunya and two blocks from Passeig de Gracia. The hotel is within walking distance of most tourist sites and also near two metro stations. The AeroBus from the airport stops at Plaza de Catalunya and it is a five minute walk to the hotel. It could not be more ideally located and yet it is also very quiet. One of the things I really liked about the hotel was the personal commitment of the owners. They made sure that you felt at home. You could request breakfast the night before for the time that suited your schedule and it was ready for you at the appointed time. I had the simple breakfast each day, which was orange juice, croissant, toast and coffee. It was a very good start to the day. I also enjoyed chatting with the other guests on the terrace both at breakfast and frequently at the end of the day. It was a good way to share information and get feedback about museums and other tourist sites. There was a large DVD selection and you could either watch the DVDs in your room or in the parlor on a large screen TV. The free wifi was very good. There is also a computer for the use of the guests. Abel, Sergio, and Muhannad were all very helpful with any questions about transit, restaurants, or museums. I arrived mid-day and I was greeted by the maid. She graciously helped me with my luggage and gave me a key to my room. She spoke very little English, but made me feel welcome and at home. My stay in Barcelona was wonderful and I plan to return. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, romantic boutique hotel with tremendous charm and super nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: JasonGeiger
Reviews.Content: Please do not be confused or upset when you arrive and find that you must buzz the hotel to get in the fancy wooden door within a door. Just hit the buzzer and say buenas dias, tardes, or noches and state your last name. They will come down and help you with your luggage. After checking in, you will be able to open the doors yourself. The people working at L'Antic Espai were super friendly and spoke perfect English even though we used our best Spenglish. The hotel is full of antique furniture, decorations, and dishes. After checking in, we were able to buy tour bus tickets and multi-museum tickets at a discounted price. This made our vacation so much easier! The room was cozy and comfortable and the welcome glass of sangria was a nice touch! L'Antic Espai is located very close to La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya which makes getting around the city very easy. There are tons of cafe's, restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance. The best tour buses have stops close by also. The only think that made us a little nervous at first was the subway train that sounded and felt like an earthquake every 15 minutes when it passed underneath us. Fortunately this did not bother us one bit the entire visit. I highly recommend this hotel for the experienced traveler. If you are looking for the big hotel with the bell boy, concierge, and lobby bars, this is not for you. The icing on the cake was the breakfast. We chose the simple breakfast which was croissants, toast, orange juice, and coffee. What really made this a wonderful, romantic experience was that they brought the breakfast to our room (at a time we requested) and set the antique dishes up on the little coffee table on our balcony. It made us feel very special. The people at L'Antic Espai really made this one of my favorite places to stay in the whole world!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dkwalsh80
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at L'Antic Espai in May 2011. The guys running it are great. I was actually quite sick, and so they kindly gave us a late check out at no extra charge so that I could rest more before our next destination. Great location, very friendly staff, great service. Do yourself a favour and stay here next time you're in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “* * * * *”
Reviews.Author: M4RLEY85
Reviews.Content: The purpose of the stay was a leisurely weekend away with my mother. I thought she would enjoy the uniqueness of this hotel, quite different from the contemporary (and stale) hotels. I loved it from first sight, but my mother was not overly impressed with it - it seems she prefers the modern look However by the end of the stay, she came to love the quirkiness of it. Abel and Sergio, the owners, made our stay particularly enjoyable stay. Pros Abel and Sergio Breakfast on the patio Exceedingly comfy beds Lovely all round unconventional ambiance Cons - not really cons, just things to be mindful of Access by stairs only Space is at a premium but the hostel is a converted apartment and so to be expected No English language channels on bedroom TVs but compensated by the range of dvds that you are free to pick and choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Funky in a good way”
Reviews.Author: HowdoSarasota
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The proprietors were great hosts and most helpful in every respect. The place is uniquely decorated which adds to the charm. The rooms are comfortable. The location is perfect for touring the sites and attractions in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: RamblingShirley
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hostal L'Antic Espai for our last night of a 10-day trip to Catalonia and Basque Country. We wanted some of the "old Barcelona" flavor, which this boutique property offers in the Eixample area of the City. Sergio and Abel provided excellent service including arranging a 4 am airport transfer that was exactly on time. The hotel is on one floor of an old Eixample Building on the main drag of Gran Via and features lots of antiques and old world fixtures but also flat screen TV's. It was excellent value and a lovely way to end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Appeal”
Reviews.Author: atravels2
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before a cruise. I was traveling alone, don't speak Spanish, and had never before been to Barcelona. Based on other reviews, I chose L'Antic Espai. I'm glad I did. It has a great location for a first time tourist. I was able to take the airport bus to Catalunya Square. The bus was convenient, easy, and cheap. From Catalunya Square is was an easy walk of a few blocks, even with my big suitcase. The entrance to the hotel is easy to miss and you have to look for the sign above the door. I was buzzed in and was helped to carry my suitcase up a long flight of marble stairs. I arrived early in the day and was able to check in early. The owners were not home when I checked in, but a very friendly maid was expecting me. There was a language barrier, but everything worked out fine. The interior of the hotel is exactly as pictured on the hotel website. I had a small single bedroom. It looked exactly as advertised. It was small, but very clean and charming. It had everything I needed. It had a small, but very functional marble bathroom that was modern and clean. The air conditioner worked surprisingly well. The bed was a bit bigger than a standard American single bed. It was comfortable enough, but had an unusual European shaped pillow. The one drawback was also part of its charm: a floor to ceiling French door to a terrace. The terrace was shared by three other rooms, so there was no privacy and I didn't feel comfortable keeping my window or drapes open. However, the terrace was lovely! That's where my lovely and delicious breakfast was served the next morning. I met my hosts and they were very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The price was right, it was a great location, the room was nice, the owners were helpful, and the breakfast was excellent. The only complaint I had was unavoidable: the noise. My room on the terrace faced a playing field that was very noisy from morning 'til evening. Also, the hotel is small, and the rooms are just off the common area and some noise from comings and goings are unavoidable. I would still stay there again. The good far outweighed the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and beautiful! An exquisite experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ramses4ever
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this hotel and Sergio and Abel give friendly, personal service and really care about their guests. The attention to detail here is second to none. The place is clean and the antiques are a feast for the senses, everytime I looked around I saw something new. The atmosphere was like stepping back in time but the bathroom had modern facilities such as a hair dryer and there is free wi-fi and computer access. Breakfast was lovely and beautifully served, with good coffee! I slept like a log and felt like a princess. I'll be back. If you don't like antiques or small rooms, then don't come here. But I can't recommend it enough. Gorgeous! Thanks Sergio and Abel. Your hotel was a highlight of my trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: KimKito
Reviews.Content: If you´re looking for a home away from home, this is it! It is a gorgeous and homely boutique hotel and the owners Sergio and Abel actually treat you like their house guests / friends! Sergio even served us breakfast and when we were having difficulty booking tickets for a football (soccer) match, Abel even offered for us to borrow his credit card! Breakfast on the terrace was a delightful start to the morning. The rooms are comfortable (especially the velvety, soft red blanket!) and the bathroom is very clean. Instead of generic soaps, what they give you are these precious little bottles of goodies and even perfumed water! A very nice touch! You can really feel that the owners want everything to be perfect and for you to feel at home! I have no hesitation in recommending Hotel Lántic Espai looking for an inexpensive and delightful place to stay! We will definitely, definately, definiately come back if we´re ever in Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Gloriously Magnificently Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: The government sign outside shows this as a 2 star hotel. Really it is a 5 star B&B. What were called "Pensiones" used to abound in Spanish cities, and generally occupied one or two floors in a large city centre building. Often you could come across two or 3 pensiones in one building. L'Antic Espai has 9 or 10 rooms occupying half the First Floor of an enormous c1900 building in a superb location on the Gran Via within a few minutes walk of the Plaza de Catalunya, and offers B&B services (no staff after 21h00). They like to know what time you are arriving to ensure that someone will be there to let you in. You enter through carved hardwood doors around 4-5 metres high and the interior is almost indescribable.....a veritable jungle of baroque and Catalan modernist furniture with more nick-nacks than a Victorian parlour . You have to be careful going down the narrow corridors with your suitcase, as you could easily knock over an ornament or picture; you look up from your breakfast to find yourself staring into the eyes of a collection of porcelain dolls! The bedrooms are amazing as well, only slightly less cluttered than the public area, but featuring 3 metre high wardrobes, loopy lamps with glass rose petal shades operated by porcelain "clock" switches last seen in provincial France circa 1937 and German telephones from the same era. Magnificent! Four of the bedrooms give onto a shared terrace with chairs and tables (for breakfast), a profusion of plants and three Victorian porcelain and wire birdcages, each populated by finches and budgerigars. The one drawback is the floor to ceiling sliding doors between the rooms and the terrace affording a clear view into each room; emerging naked from the bathroom is not recommended! Breakfast is included (nothing special but quite adequate) and can be served on the terrace or in the Salon amid the collections. This place is so unusual that I brought two colleagues to see it (they were staying in an extremely bland "corporate" hotel)...they could not believe it! L'Antic Espai offers very good value for money, if the website packages (some room rates continue the eccentric theme by including Ayuvedic massage) do not appeal, a phone call to the hotel secured for me very favourable rates. I shall definitely choose to stay here again for the location, good value and the sheer personality of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Once you stay here, you won't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: chasiubaau
Reviews.Content: Without doubt one of the most memorable and charming little places I've stayed on all my trips, a place where you're unlikely to encounter anywhere else... I only stayed here for 2 nights but that was enough to make a huge impression on me and wanting me to stay here again next time I visit Barcelona. It's a small, hip, antique themed B&B run by a couple on a quiet and safe location but only a 5 mins walk to La Rambla and also the nearest subway station. The place is filled with so much decorative little antique collections, you end up treading carefully around the place so that you don't bump into or break anything. It's a sight to behold and you never get tired looking at them. The twin room we had was well decked out, had a gorgeous view overlooking the street, comfy single beds and clean bathroom. During my stay I dealt with Sergio, and I couldn't have asked for a better host. Helpful, friendly, excellent English, great knowledge of the local area, full of recommendations of nearby restaurants, he sets the standard of how a professional host should carry out their job. He also helped me purchase my Sagrada Familia tickets online so I could skip the long queues via he's credit card, which I greatly appreciated. Also arranged for a taxi for airport transfer in the early hours of the morning. Can't speak highly of him, a superstar!
