I highly recommend this place and I'm echoing a lot of what other people have already said. The photos you see on Tripadvisor and on their website are true and accurate and just add to the anticipation once you arrive. Simply superb.

Reviews.Title: “Can't add much to other reviews”
Reviews.Author: westmotraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Room 103. The room was very small, with little storage other than a small closet, but very clean. It was decorated in reds and golds. The room has two twin beds, which were very comfortable. The blankets provided were extremely thick and snugglely The bathroom was a decent size and shower was very spacious, but didn't have great water pressure. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, there were plenty of choices for a quick breakfast around the hotel for similar pricing. However complementary coffee would have been nice. The staff carried our bags up the one flight of steps to the hotel and provided us with numerous suggestions for meals and sightseeing. There is a computer available for guest use in the common area - great for checking into flights. Distractions: The entrance is difficult to locate the first time. The building entry area, which it shares with other apartments is somewhat drab. The subway runs under the street in front of the hotel, so there is some rumbling noise that works it way into the rooms. The bad: I encountered was what I perceived to be a negative reaction to American tourists by one of the guest. He made me quite uncomfortable, although I could not understand all that he said it was clear he was making disparaging remarks. Obviously this is out of the control of the management. If you want something different, quaint, away from La Rambla and all the tourist, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we found L'Antic Easpai”
Reviews.Author: ponstad
Reviews.Content: My only complaint about our stay is that it was too short! We throroughly enjoyed the room, the location, tehe breakfast, the attentional to detail, the exquisite furnishings - all memorable in a good way. Our proprietors had great recommendations about shopping, resataurants, a flamenco show - would highly recommend this place to others. (Although there are lots of stairs, there was also assistance with luggage.)

Reviews.Title: “Such a treat!”
Reviews.Author: SeekSunUsa
Reviews.Content: A quiet, charming hotel - in a great location within walking distance to all of the sights, yet not overwhelmed by tourists. The place is full of antiques, which create a feeling of old-time elegance, but with wireless internet and all the amenities. Sitting on the terrace surrounded by plants and chirping birds was a perfect way to relax in the midst of a bustling city. The staff were absolutely wonderful, warm, kind, and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice antique feeling, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Venkatesht
Reviews.Content: I am a regular tourist traveller around Europe and have also been contributing to Tripadvisor. I selected the hotel based on positive reviews in Tripadvisor. The location is really good and the antique pieces give a nice different feeling. However, the service level was the the poorest I have experienced among hotels getting reasonably good reviews on trip advisor. One example - I was made to wait for breakfast on 2 of the 3 days I was there. This may have even been acceptable, but after making me wait for half an hour for the breakfast, the person even had the audacity to tell me after the breakfast that he did not have time to wait 10 minutes for me to pack my bags before I payed the bill. I exchanged emails with Abel later about the above and other issues, but unfortunately his explanations were very poor as well and based on wrong facts even.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regsport
Reviews.Content: It's like staying in a museum, this intimate little hotel is filled with paintings, artefacts and ornaments. The guys who run it, Abel and Sergio, are really friendly, smiling and thoughtful but not obtrusive. They genuinely want you to have a good time. My wife and I stayed at Easter 2011, Easter Saturday is St Jordi's Day when traditionally men give red roses to their partners. We were delighted when Sergio presented my wife with a red rose and were also grateful to receive some minature Easter eggs the following day. Breakfast was served at a time of our choosing on a terrace, filled with colourful plants, outside our room. The hotel is in a great location, close to Placa la Catalunya where the bus from the airport drops you off, and a short stroll from the Ramlas, a number of metro stations and numerous good restaurants and bars (try the nearby El Glop for hearty, reasonably priced Catalan fare and eccentric, charming waiters). The only improvement I could suggest is tea making facilities in the room, apart from that keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifil, peaceful paradise in the middle of an equally beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: Richhbr
Reviews.Content: Brilliant staff and owners, lovely charm and character in every aspect of this little place. I couldn't recommend it highly enough. I wouldn't stay anywhere else the next time i return to Barca!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Sarah201113
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 fabulous nights. The attention to detail was amazing. The decoration with all of the antiques was beautiful. The owners went out of their way to make sure that every thing was perfect. Concerns were taken care of immediately. I have recommended this hotel to all of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: de_anda_martha
Reviews.Content: Is a unique place! All the decoration, the atention, details, services are made for you. The managers are so gentle and the localization is ideal for local transportation and turistic places. Simply, the greates in Barcelona for the best price!!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: BCFC69
Reviews.Content: if you want a special place to stay when you visit Barcelona,the Antic Espai is the place for you.Idealy located this boutique hotel is full of charming paintings ,ornamental figures and china pieces giving it a very different feel to the traditional modern hotels we have become accustomed to.The owners Abel and Sergio go that extra mile to ensure you make the most of your visit including a welcoming glass of sangria,a substantial and varied breakfast and the offer to drive you back to the airport at the end of your visit !!Nothing was too much for them.We stayed in Room 107 that had direct access onto a balcony where breakfast was served;a balcony covered by colourful plants and flowers. We will be in Barcelona for a day next year and we will certainly call in to say hello to the Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “An intimate, gracious hotel with a truly European feel.”
Reviews.Author: Cheboygangal
Reviews.Content: This tiny hotel in the heart of old Barcelona has tons of ambiance, and the owners are such gracious hosts. Our room opened onto a terrace, where we had sangria with our friends one evening, and our friends room had a balcony where we also shared evening drinks. The rooms were comfortable, and the bathrooms were clean, and well appointed. The owners provide maps and recommendations for sights and restaurants, as well as cautions regarding pickpockets, and areas to avoid. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect Spanish experience.

Reviews.Title: “A dream find, fantastic antique furnishings and attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: l_may65
Reviews.Content: Sergoi and Abel run this 'boutique' hotel, with a passion for excellence. do not let the title 'hostel 'deter you at all. My friend and I arrived at lunchtime, a buzzer at the front door was answered quickly, Abel came and took our cases, up a flight of stairs, to a delightful hotel, the pictures of the hotel and all the rooms on the site are exactly as they are. Abel and Sergio advised us which areas to shop and eat and gave good tips on areas to visit locally. It is a centraly located hotel, just 2 mins to the shops and 10 mins walk to Les Ramblas. The breakfast was served either in a ornately decorated room next to the reception area, full of wonderful pictures, plants and ornaments or on the terrace which was equally enchanting. The first night after walking for miles and catching as much as possible of Barelona, we decided to have a night in, Abel gave us a selection of dvds to watch in our room, he provided a jug of Sangria and some refreshments at a very reasonable rate. All the tablewear and drinking glasses are either china or fine glasswear. Guys to impress your lady, take her here, and ladies you will love it. The undeground railway runs under the hotel and occasionally you fell the vibrations, it did not disturb any sleep and it does not deter from the charm of this delightful hotel. On my next visit to Barcelona, I will go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: joanne72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend, the prime reason being for a concert rather than sightseeing. The location is fantastic - great for all the sights, so we managed to squeeze some of them in. I have stayed in alot of hotels. You name the chain, I've been in it. This hotel is SO refreshing. The entrance is old-style, up one flight of marble stairs (no lift, but it is only one flight), and the welcome is something else! The hall/reception is packed full of antiques and kitsch style done in a good way. The room was lovely - balcony to the front, high ceiling, lovely chandeler (sp?) in the room. The light fittings, ornate lamps...all lovingly restored by Abel and Sergio. Good shower, and some really cute touches - I loved the 50's style glasses in the bathroom, and the tile flooring. Bathrobes, good towels, dvd player...really, a wonderful combination of old and new. Talking of our hosts, they could not have been more helpful! Abel recommended 2 great restaurants for dinner, paella and tapas, and they (rightly) are very proud of their hotel and their city. If you want bland, soul-less, just a bed for your head, then pick a chain. If you want a unique hotel to enhance your stay, then choose this! Wonderful find, I cannot recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: GoranGoran
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel first for 7 days and ended up extending my stay for another 3. I payed silly little money for the 10 days stay, something like €500 and this was with the "big breakfast" included throughout ALL of the days. ...and now I haven't even began to tell you about all the extra treatment that you get, which you maybe would be able to get at the more expensier hotels too...but then you would have to pay big money for that too I guess.. ...yeah...did I tell you the hotel itself is located as central as it can be in Barcelona?...yeah...well then..that too is worth a extra euro or two. As one reviewer wrote; “The rooms are decked out with antiques and that the windows are open to a duct. Yes, some beds are small, but that is what I asked and paid for and not a room with a king or queen bed, but in the end of the day, you choose this hotel if you want something "different". The room that I lived in was cleaned every day and the cleaning personal is very flexible with the cleaning times. In most other hotels the cleaning personal has a certain time frame often not more then a couple of hours when it comes to cleaning a room. But here the cleaning personal could be available from early morning to late in the afternoon! This was incredible! Another thing is that you simply could talk to the hotel manager or the cleaning personal and tell then at what time you wish to have your room cleaned at. Also another great thing is that they ask when YOU would like to eat your breakfast! (for the next day to come) I never had a problem with the bathroom, always clean and the water that came from the shower was hot, I never did had to wait for the water to heat up or anything like that, hot water in an instant. Also I took the liberty in taking a shower for 30 minutes during one time because I simply could not seem to leave from there, and I can vouch for the constant hot water. Staff was incredible friendly and helpful, this is an understatement at best... My stay at the hotel had one aim, to find a job, I didn't come there for a romantic weekend or anything like that, but still, every time I opened the door to the hotel and stepped in, you can't miss the love in the air that the hotel atmosphere has. Like I said, it's not the world's best hotel, but the service that you get there from the hotel managers is priceless. All the tips, all the help, around the clock! Just call if you need anything or if you are in any kind trouble....priceless service. There is so much more to write about because my 10 days were really filled with a lot of things happening but, I'll save this for another time =) Saludos!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel - Glad I Stayed There”
Reviews.Author: Falafel9
Reviews.Content: After numerous emails back and forth between me and the proprietors (because I had a variety of questions which they quickly answered), I stayed at the Hostal for 2.5 nights, and was glad that I did. The location is wonderful - in the middle of everything that I wanted to see during my two-day visit, my friends in Barcelona who had been worried about where I was staying were extremely satisfied upon seeing the place, my room was upgraded for the last night (which was particularly lovely since I had to leave at 3 AM to make a bus to the airport), I was given suggestions about where to eat and how to get around, the other tourists were very friendly and we had located the hostal via TripAdvisor, the free internet access was wonderful as I could keep in touch with friends in the next country I was traveling to for a wedding. All in all, a very satisfying and fun stay. if you want a unique, not run of the mill hotel, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant if you like quirky”
Reviews.Author: paranoid-android76
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a lot for work, which usually involves overpriced hotel chains, where the hotels simply don't live up to the prices they charge. When I travel privately, I tend to look for cheaper hotels, as I in general don't intend to spend a lot of time there, but would rather go exploring. I found a good rate for l'Antic Espai for the weekend I was going, nothing like the aforementioned. I think my whole 2 night stay didn't go over 100 euros total... For that money I got a great location (5 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya, which is great for the airport bus and close to the metro), friendly staff and just a generally quirky experience. Yes, the rooms are decked out with antiques. Yes, the windows open to a duct. Yes, the (free!) internet is not 100% reliable. Yes, the beds are small (or at least the one in 109 was), but in the end of the day, you choose this hotel if you want something "different" instead of your average IKEA hotel. I'd rather stay in this hotel then waking up in the morning trying to figure out which city I am in, because the furniture looks exactly the same (yes, that did happen!) Bathroom was clean and shower was hot, breakfast was nothing special (toast, croissant, coffee & orange), but made special by the way it's laid out. There's free DVDs to watch, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful, no issues at all... I think you may get disappointed if you expect to find a Hilton-esque hotel to stay in, or if you're quite tall. Having said that, the hotel could probably improve by trying to find some bigger beds...

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guy293982
Reviews.Content: When I planned my stay in Barcelona, My wife and I decided to spoil our selves with a really nice hotel, we looked at several 4-5 stars hotels, but then noticed this "unique" hotel with all these great reviews. The hotel is rated #5 in Barcelona! We looked at the hotel website and decided on booking for 3 nights, the price was high (135 euro I think) but we didn't mind, we exchanged several emails with the staff of the hotel and booked our stay. We should have been alerted when they told us that they charge the entire stay up front and it's non-refundable, but we didn't notice it back then. The guy from the emails promised us the suite, with queen-size bed and a terrace. After a few days in Spain we finally arrived to Barcelona, and when entered the hotel we were shocked. The hotel looks like an old run down house, with several rooms, no elevator, our "suite" was a small room with no windows at all, dirty old rugs, no hot water and the air conditioning didn't work (it was above 30C that day) and the solution they offered me and my pregnant wife was to move to a single bed room! The "queen-size" bed was tiny, something like one and a half single bed, and the mattress was very uncomfortable. The "terrace" is a shared balcony between 3 rooms with a view to a wall. We decided in that moment we are not going to stay there a minute more than we have to. After a night with little sleep, we went first thing in the morning and found another hotel for the rest of our stay, which was in a better location, with far better room and cheaper price. At first the staff wouldn't refund anything, but evantually, and this is the only good thing I have to say about this place, they refunded all our money except for the first night. Bottom line is: Stay away from this hotel, Antiqu is another word for a dirty, old and neglected place.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, charming, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: MECindylou
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2010. Because I was traveling alone I wanted something in a safe location with a bit of charm. Sergio, Abel, and staff were unfailingly helpful and warm to me, always there to answer questions and recommend restaurants, sightseeing options, etc. When some people I had met came by to rendezvous for dinner, they were invited to have a glass of wine while they waited for me. My room was tiny, but I expected it to be so. There was an armoire and a stand for my small suitcase, so I had no problems fitting everything in the room. It was immaculately clean, bathroom included, with thoughtful amenities. Yes, water after the initial carafe is not free, but I just got my own large bottle at the nearby el Corte Inglese. The location is very central, close to the metro, within walking distance of Casa Battlo and la Pedrera, Placa de Catalunya, las Ramblas, Bari Gotic, etc. There is free high-speed internet in the lobby and I hardly ever had to wait to use it. There is no elevator, but it is only one floor up a spacious stairway, so that didn't bother me at all. With my room package, I had one continental breakfast included, but some other guests were having one that looked great and had meat, cheese, etc., so I upgraded to that one. The terrace for breakfast is really cheery and cozy, too. One night, I got take-out at a nearby Chinese/Japanese restaurant, brought it back, and watched a DVD from their extensive collection. I think the web site gives an accurate picture of this property; I really enjoyed my stay here. It's a great value and you will be made to feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but dark rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rickspear
Reviews.Content: The staff were very nice. However, our room was always dark as little light entered through the window. The location is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: nicholeg_walis
Reviews.Content: This place is truly special. The rooms are super cozy, beautifully decorated and clean. The staff were very kind and the owners Abel and Sergio are AMAZING..they really went out of their way to make my stay in Barcelona special. I couldn't have asked for more in a hotel and the next time I am in Barcelona I will definitely be staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Stuncy
Reviews.Content: Having been to 56 countries over the last 9 years we have stayed at our fair share of hotels around the world, Hostal L'Antic Espai rates amongst our top experiences. The uniqueness of the property, the location, the service..but most of all the hosts. Abel and Sergio could not have been more helpful. Great tips on locals only hot spots, help with finding the basics around the corner at the local pharmacy, assistance with international shipping...but most of all saving us when our trip plans changed due to a general strike in Portugal. Abel...aka my secretary ;), went out of his way spending hours on the phone with the airlines to help rebook our flights. You will never find this at a brand name hotel. When travelling to a new city or country due yourself a favour and seek out a place like Hostal L'Antic Espai. Abel made it possible for us to feel like we were temporary residents of Barcelona instead of just tourists. Thanks so much guys!! Hope to see you in Detroit this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, funky boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutti57
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 3 nights. Our taxi driver was nonplussed about the address we gave him. There was just a big wooden door with a tiny sign saying it was a "hostel". We walked in and there was a big old marble staircase. We walked up the first flight and luckily a women coming down told us that we have to buzz the only door on that first landing. Inside was a small reception desk and narrow corridors leading to the rooms. To say the place was packed with antiques is an understatement. One could hardly move for all the antiques. Our room had high ceilings, and was fairly large. The bathroom was modern and clean. We had a balcony. There were potted plants and antiques even on the balcony. The 2 men that run it live next door and were very friendly and helpful. They spoke English, made strong coffee and toast for breakfast and provided us with free internet. The location was close to Las Ramblas so it was great. The only complaint my husband had was that the bed was hard. It was a very unusual place to stay and memorable for sure. If you are tired of generic hotels, and better still, like antiques, this is the place for you. If you don't care for a different experience with funky vibes, don't go. So we liked it, but probably would go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in the heart of the city with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BBBokomaru
Reviews.Content: At the first glance of it this hotel shocked us (my wife and me); loads of old curiosities in a quite small space BUT: Then we realized how close the hotel to the heart of the city is. The staff's attitude is excellent and as it has to be everything is clean and tidy. The free WIFI and the DVD player in the rooms with a small local DVD collection makes cosy this hotel. The breakfast was served always sharp on time as we asked it in never the same 'old curiosities' (old cups, spoons, juice jugs etc.). So we realized that we like this hotel even though our room is quite small. I can reccommend it to those who find standard hotels boring and who like the grace of unique small hotels that can make a visit to different cities really distinguishable.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience!”
Reviews.Author: BKK939
Reviews.Content: Thanks very much to the very nice, friendly and hospitable hotel's owner, Abel & Sergio who took very good care of me and my mother during our stay at their hotel. In fact, we booked our room at another hotel for the first 2 nights, but we eventually moved back to stay with them as we prefered their hotel because of their friendliness, more beautiful hotel, closer to the shopping area and airport bus, etc. They were so kind to let us leave our big luggage with them while we were staying at the first hotel. I personally felt happy to have a chance to meet them. Hopefully one day I will see them again either in Barcelona or in my hometown, Bangkok. I'd very much like to recommend this lovely hotel to anyone who wants to visit Barcelona. You will love this place as much as I and my mom did.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: sgizzy
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Hostal L’antic Espai to anyone visiting Barcelona, it really will add to your experience. Staying here is more like being in a gorgeous home decorated with many Baroque style antiques rather than a cold impersonal hotel, it is the most welcomed and independent I have ever felt on holiday. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of the Metro and many of the main attractions, yet just far enough away to get a quiet night sleep. On arrival we were greeted by Sergio who provided us with helpful information on the best places to go, showed us around then left us to settle in. The hotel provides a small collection of dvds and books including a variety of travel guides and two computers with internet access. Each room is individually decorated. We stayed in room 107 which had access to the terrace, the bed was large and comfortable and the room was cleaned daily. Only thing missing was hair conditioner. Timing of breakfast is flexible, each morning we had the basic breakfast consisting of toast, pastries, juice and hot drink, which we found sufficient to fuel us for a day’s sightseeing. The two owners Abel and Sergio were absolutely delightful hosts! They are warm welcoming and show great dedication to customer service. I don’t know what we would have done without their help when we were stranded a couple of extra days due to flight cancellations. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at Hostal L’antic Espai and when we return to Barcelona will definitely stay with here again. The owners and their delightful hotel definitely made our trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Shortydishman
Reviews.Content: There are so many reasons to love Hostal L'Antic Espai and I should know because I just finished my third stay there in three years. The management (from Abel and Sergio to the Carla, the housekeeper) is very helpful and personable. They know the city intimately and are quick to make suggestions or arrange for tickets to Barcelona's many attractions. All my requests for service, information or help were met quickly and cordially. I'm not an antique collecter but I still enjoy seeing the many antiques in the hotel--from the furniture and knickknacks to the chanlediers. I've stayed in two singles and a double (the room overlooking Gran Via has the added attraction of a glassed-in balcony with a table and seating), and all were very comfortable. And the hotel's location is superb! It's 2-3 blocks from the most useful underground stations and bus routes, including the tourist bus. And there are always taxis (they are so inexpensive in Barcelona) waiting just a few feet from the front door. But Barcelona is a wonderful city for walking and most of the best sites and shopping areas are within walking distance: La Rambla, several Gaudi sites, the Gothic Quarter, Passeig de Gracia and Rambla de Catalunya for shopping, a market within a block, and many very good restaurants and bars. I hope to return to Barcelona many more times, and I know I'll always be welcome and comfortable at Hostal L'Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel breathes life from a different place in time”
Reviews.Author: anzoid5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, off Paseo de Gracia and near the Metro. The rooms were so unique and decorated lavishly with antiques from centuries past. The two owners Abel and Sergio were very friendly...and even put us up in their apartment when we were stuck in Barcelona for the air traffic controller strike. Carla the made was gracious and attentive. Several rooms shared a private terrace and the main suite has its own private terrace. We have stayed their twice and would recommend it to anyone who loves an intimate hotel environment that feels more like being at home than at a cold, impersonal hotel. You do hear a low grumble from the metro underground, so earplugs may be necessary if you are sensitive to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: BoardmanMijas_Spain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Antic Espai at the end of November for three nights. The hotel is very well situated, just a five minute walk from Plaza de Catalunya, the main square in Barcelona, where there are airport and city bus connections, metro and Tour Buses. There is also a taxi rank right outside. The hotel is on the first floor of a beautiful old building and once inside, you are met with an array of antique furnishings and decorative figures (baroque style), which extend throughout the hotel, which is all on one level. It has a very intimate feel. Our room was artistically and comfoartably decorated and was a good size. There are lots of little touches e.g. 'proper' hairdryer, fluffy white bathrobes, breakfast and drinks served in sympathetic crockery/glasses etc. (The doileys are indeed gorgeous). We stayed in 107, which lets out through a separate private sitting room to a shared terrace (with Patio Heater), where breakfast was served (well worth upgrading breakfast for 3 euro) and where you can have drinks or just relax by candlelight. The owners Sergio and Abel are a joy! Although the hotel itself is a fascinating place to stay, these guys really make the difference with their hands on, personal approach. It's clear they care very much about their hotel and their guests' experience in it. We have travelled the world and it's always good to encounter a combination of character and dedicated customer service, both of which L'Antic Espai has in abundance. We will surely go back to Barcelona it's a wonderful city but part of that return experience now would have to be the L'Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “You should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ms9
Reviews.Content: Very worthwhile stay. Rich in decor and kindness, the owners take great pride and this place is meticulous. Secure building, 2 blocks from 2 metro stations, great ease of walking around anywhere. Breakfast every morning on the terrace. Beds are so comfy. Clean rooms. Safe available. Transport service avaialble. Wifi available. I would def return and I think you deserve to stay here! The owners are amazingly kind and deserve your patronage.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to remember”
Reviews.Author: mrocket
Reviews.Content: Very special hotel, ideally located in central Barcelona. Small comfortable rooms with an old world style. Abel & Sergio were fantastic hosts, catering to our every need. A welcome drink, full breakfast on our balcony, transport to the airport, and top advice to local attractions. A stay we will always remember. Mucha gracias!

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: kk626
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. The staff, Muhannad, was very helpful and nice. I can't complaint anything about the room. It is a hostal that one will never forget regards of its classic decoration and service. I totally disagreed with boomor020. What I experienced was completely different. The owner tried his best to accommodate our request and the single bed can fit me (5'2") and my husband too. Sure, we will stay here again if we come back to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, friendly, comfortable & central location”
Reviews.Author: AussieKC03
Reviews.Content: This charming and centrally located hotel, has exceptional and attentive hosts, making the stay more like a B&B experience than a hotel. Sergio & Abel were very helpful and went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed the best of Barcelona over a short 2 day weekend stay. Even helping to carry the suitcases upon arrival (at midnight) and departure. The hotel is charming as every room and area is furnished with antics, figures, fine china, art - it is simply gorgeous. Most hotels provide maps and suggestions, these guys provide guide books and assist with making any arrangement (such as dinner reservations). We elected to have the the full b/fast both mornings as it was so good - yoghurt & granola, toast, croissants, muffins, fruit, tea/coffee, juice. Whilst it was not a buffet, it was certainly plentiful! And served on beautiful and elegant crockery on the terrace. Our stay was in single rooms, which again were furnished beautifully - usual small European size with a single bed, but complete with own clean ensuite and toiletries. Shower had good hot water service, and adequate pressure. My only suggestion would be for bigger towels! You can hear and feel the rumble of the metro as the hotel is very conveniently located between 3 metro stops. However, it only lasts a few seconds and of course stops late into the night so not an issue if you are out and about and making the most of the gorgeous city. Overall, this was a great choice and would definitely recommend to anyone who appreciates great service, fine things, central spot for ease of getting around, and a clean and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious & Self Indulgent”
Reviews.Author: Boomer020
Reviews.Content: I love antiques but this place was full of stuff &clutter. Not a space was spared. My credit card was debited in AUG for my stay in Oct! When I needed to change my dates they responded with a curt reply "no more changes allowed" So I had to pay for 2 nights although I only required one so I ensured I didn't vacate the room untilt he last minute. The room was tiny! I couldn't leave my suitcase open! I'm 5' 2" and barely fitted in the bed. You receive one free carafe of minera water then you have to pay if you require more. It was a 15 minute walk to the location from their directions. Oh and the rumbling every 20 minutes is the Metro. I hated it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quirky, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Famiilytrav
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in October. The hosts, Abel and Sergio, were away at the time, but Axel, who was there in the afternoons and evenings, couldn't have been nicer. The rooms are filled with ornate collections of antiques. The rooms are basic and well kept. My only complaint was the lack of an elevator; going up and down those marble stairways got old pretty quickly. Barcelona is a wonderful city to visit-there is so much to see and do and this hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of many activities.

Reviews.Title: “Fab quirky small hotel, friendly helpful staff, central for Gaudi et al.”
Reviews.Author: janinglis589
Reviews.Content: My twin and I spent 5 days here, service was excellent, room quite small but very comfortable and clean, staff so kind and helpful. The hotel is stuffed full of antiques, absolutely fascinating, I couldn't stop taking photos! It was also very central for sightseeing, we walked almost everywhere, otherwise took the bus or metro. Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy about this place! Book it!!”
Reviews.Author: lightfeather
Reviews.Content: From the moment we booked this little retreat hotel on line, the two guys who run this antique hotel couldn't have been more friendly and informative. The hotel is located in the best part of Barcelona, in walking distance to lots of cultural sites, great restaurants and stylish shops. Our room 107 was superb, comfortable, delightful, inspiring and relaxing. It boasted a stylish bathroom and access to a beautiful terrace where we relaxed and had breakfast each morning while we discussed our plan for the day. Complinmenty Sangria on our first day was lovely, presented to us on a pretty little tray. Bathroom goodies were a bonus, just pack hair conditioner. The communal areas are truly delightful with real antiques from the Catalonian area, Spain and South American region. Barcelona has so much to offer. Multiple trips to this amazing city is a must. And I would definitely recommend this wonderfull hotel. We will be back ! Thank you so much to the guys who run this hotel and also to the maids who treated us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona's Best kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: TheJellies
Reviews.Content: What more can I say other than we absolutely loved this place. A very Spanish entrance up the steps and into a very well decorated hotel. The personal touch and friendliness of the staff makes you feel so welcome. Our room was lovely with plenty of space. A good ensuite bathroom with good shower. Our breakfast was served to us each morning on the terrace right outside our room, such a treat. A perfect nights sleep every night. The location could not have been better. Close enough to everything but far away enough for peace ant tranquility. Less than 2 minutes to Place de Catalunya yet we couldn't hear a thing during the night. Bliss. Breakfast was simple, tea or coffee with croissants and toast and home made jams and orange juice, just enough to start you on your day served in the most elegant of cups etc. Internet service was available and the guys in reception were more than helpful with any information in the area wether it was for buses, restaurants or just directions. I can't believe we found this place and with such a good price too. As I've said it's Barcelona's best kept secret, but sshhhh, don't tell everybody, keep it for yourself!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the hotel, staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: noonsky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start of October with friends and really enjoyed it! Extremely reasonable considering the quality of the hotel and it's location. The staff were very welcoming and helpful! Hoping to return to Barcelona within the next year and will hopefully be able to book a stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very special experience with some disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: Aquarius74
Reviews.Content: The Antic Espai is a very special hotel with a kitsch (fake art) interior. It is well situated in the neighbourhood of the Gaudi houses and exclusive shops of Passeig Gràcia. It is a small hotel and every room has its own character (special furniture). I booked two single rooms and the rooms were very small and some things needed to be repaired. Unfortunately the (antic) beds are very small (1.90 m) and therefore not always very comfortable for tall people. Breakfast is very simple with tea, bread and marmelade and is served on the terrace (outside). Personnel is very friendly. The Antic Espai is a nice hotel but I would not recommend it for a long stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Rafagonz
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice find thanks to Tripadvisor. The hotel was quaint and really well located. close to Plaza Catalunya and about a 5 minute walk to La Rambla. You can feel the metro line underneath, but it did not affect my sleep. The best in the hotel was the service from Axel. He is a gem and was always ready to give directions, offer his assistance and recommend nice places. Also, they did some washing for us and it was not too expensive and gets delivered back to your room in an antique suitcases all folded....... I would recommend it for its value and friendliness. Ahhh...the free WIFI didnot work that well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: darlinbeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at L'Antic upon returning from a cruise. First, it is an apartment that has been divided up into rooms. Our room #105 was quite large and had patio access. The patio was shared with 3 other rooms but was large and had two tables. We had breakfast outside which consisted of coffee/tea, toast/croissant, jelly and juice. The place is filled with antiques and what-nots that I believe are for sale. The bed was a double, very firm. The bath was updated with a shower. Tea was served in the afternoon and wake-up calls were available. There was also free Internet. The place was clean and the service was very good. The only down-side is that there is no elevator and you have to haul your luggage up 3 flights. The attendant helped thank goodness. The patio can be somewhat noisy but there was no problem sleeping at night. There was air conditioning which was iffy at times. I'm not sure I would want to be there in Julyl! The location is wonderful, within walking distance of fabulous high-end shops and the Batllo Gaudi house. Take the time to go into the wonderful house;/museum next door, Casa Amatller. It is more splendid that the Gaudi. And don't pass up the opportunity to go into the neatest store, Vincon. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Our decision to stay at L'Antic Espai made our trip better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: oxymoeron
Reviews.Content: My husband found out about L’Antic Espai on-line. We wanted a unique experience in Barcelona, and we definitely got it. The ambience, created by Abel & Sergio, is amazing! They collect antiques and really cool objects d’art from all over the world. The hotel is in a really nice section of Barcelona, that is partially residential, but also has easy access to all of the wonderful things Barcelona has to offer; great restaurants, shops, Museums & galleries and beautiful beaches. You access the hotel through gorgeous, large ornate wooden doors. They get your fingerprint, and that becomes your key. Its a great mixture of old world charm & new technology! Then it’s up a couple flights of stairs, and there is a small lobby area. There are several private rooms, all with their own bathrooms, and all decorated beautifully & differently. We were traveling with our 2 teenage daughters, who also loved both guys & the hotel! We got 2 rooms next to each other. They loved having their own private room with bathroom. Both rooms had really cool balconies that looked out on the front street. Ours was enclosed and had beautiful sitting area with really nice furniture with lovely plants & orchids. They have a central courtyard in the back, which is where they serve a beautifully presented continental breakfast. There is a separate charge for this, and I don’t think it’s necessary every day that you’re there, but I would recommend it at least once. Be sure you check with Abel or Sergio about this. We had reserved the deluxe breakfast for each day, and when we tried to opt out of breakfast altogether for our last morning there they said that was not allowed. The only negative is that the breakfast courtyard area is right next door to a school. We were there in the summer, and were only there 1 weekday, so we only heard the loud noises one day, but people sensitive to excess noise while eating should take note. It IS happy noises, though; kids laughing & playing, but it can bug some people. Abel & Sergio are wonderful guys! They had so many great suggestions of hip, “less obvious” choices of places to see or restaurants to check out. They spent a lot of time with us helping to plan our sight seeing so that we made the most of our limited time in Barcelona and Spain. When I complimented Abel on the fabulous ceramic urns he had, he offered to take me to the Antique sale that he goes to once a week. Unfortunately, I could not go due to time constraints, but I would have loved to have done this with him. I felt an instant rapport with both guys, and can definitely see staying friends. I have read some complaints on TripAdvisor, but it seems these are from people who come home and complain after the trip. I am sure that if an issue is brought up directly to the hotel staff, they would address it immediately. That was our experience. Thanks again Abel and Sergio!! Ellyn and Steve B

Reviews.Title: “In the mood for retro”
Reviews.Author: Elena_november
Reviews.Content: upon entering the heavy wooden doors of this hotel you will be amazed by the beautiful mirrors, statues, porcellain, fabrics and potraits which fill all the corners of every wall and every room creating a charming retro atmosphere! The exquisite taste of the owners for antique is out of doubts. You will find yourself lost in admiring all the small details of the baroque furniture. Also breakfast, which you can enjoy out in the terrace, is served in finely decorated cups, glasses and silver spoons. I have only one concern: please, free the birds from the cages in the terrace, they will be beautiful and decorative even if empty or with flowering climbing plants in them. It will be a compassionate way to re-invent their use! Thank you, I really loved my days in Barcelona! Elena

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Hotel with a Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelAbout64
Reviews.Content: Our 5 day stay in Barcelona was a wonderful experience and memory thanks to our good fortune in staying at the Hostal L'Antic Espai. The location is perfect, the staff is extremely helpful in suggesting the best places to visit and dine, and the small hotel's attention to detail and incredible sevice is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful- Immaculate.. A step back in time !”
Reviews.Author: ilovecarl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I, along with another couple stayed one night pre- cruise..wish it had been more! Upon arriving after a long overnight flight, we were met by Abel who cheerfully brought our bags up to the second floor where the hotel is located. Charming, immaculate and comfortable. The care and attention we were given, made us feel as if we were with family. Abel & Sergio were helpful with our plans for visiting Barcelona. This is a very unique and wonderful place to stay and was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. We will be returning for a couple nights next September.

Reviews.Title: “This Hostel is worth the Trip to Barcelona on its own”
Reviews.Author: Bilali
Reviews.Content: This Hostel should be one of the tourist attractions of Barcelona ! It is small and overflowing with period furniture and porcelain that absolutely reflects the personality of the two managers - beautiful and welcoming. Get a Terrace room and have breakfast with the riot of plants and song birds or eat in the lounge in another era. The staff are delightful and helpful and know their town. The Hostel is a walk from the center of town but close to the Metro for visiting the other sights of Barcelona. Try the Bar (FOC) just around the corner for drinks and food and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, but worth the effort.”
Reviews.Author: Candonjan
Reviews.Content: We had no previous experiencewith this hotel, personally or through friends. But after doing some TA searching for Barcelona, the combination of character, location and price seemed worth the gamble. We were not disappointed. Hidden away on the second floor of a typical block of apartments on the Gran Via Corts Catalines, it took our taxi driver a couple of tries before he found it, but once we buzzed in and clambered up the stairs, we were welcomed warmly by Axel (who had already been helpful in assisting me to select the best room for our needs and providing an e-mailed map prior to our arrival). We were given a personal tour of the small hotel (10 rooms), recently created from two homes, and given good advice on local dining. (Weirdly, I also had my middle finger printed to electronically access the lower and upper doors). By European standards, the room was large, with a small balcony looking out onto the Gran Vias Corts Catalanes, which is insanely busy and noisy, but, when we shut the double doors, the room was remarkably quiet. The floor was a lovely mosaic left over from the hotel's previous incarnation as a private home. A chandelier hung from the high ceiling, and a very spacious bathroom with an arching window was separated from the main room by a sliding door. Everything was clean and comfortable (though I do prefer a softer mattress). A simple breakfast of toast, croissant and coffee or tea comes with the room. Kind of. When paying the bill, I found I was charged for the second day's breakfast. When I enquired, I was told breakfast wasprovided for the first night only; after that you had to pay. I explained that this was not made clear to me when I booked, and the charge was quickly dropped. Suggestion: either include breakfast for each night of a guest's stay, or don't. Just make the arrangement clear. The first morning we had our breakfast on a lovely terrace adjacent to three rooms (though I wondered how quiet they would be as people in the rooms were separated from diners by only a sliding glass door); the second morning, because the terrace rooms were taken and we didn't have access, we ate in the sitting room. Decor of the small lobby and shared space might not be for everyone -- cluttered European eclectic, I guess I'd call it -- but it's fun and unpretentious. Best of all, perhaps, is the hotel's location. Just a few blocks from the Place Catalunya and the start of the Ramblas, you are within walking distance of the most fascinating parts of the city, from the astonishing Sagrada Familia to La Ribera.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, newly renovated hotel with superior attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: jmiko
Reviews.Content: The owners of this hotel make you feel like family. Everywhere you look you find another decorating detail. Spotless, comfortable, divinely decorated and English china breakfast service. The location is near walking distance to most parts of the central city. We plan to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Special, individual boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosieCrowhurst
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this very individual boutique hotel. We found Abel and Sergio, and all the staff, very obliging and attentive. Our room, 105 looked out onto the shared terrace where we had breakfast, and enjoyed a bottle of house Cava before going out for dinner at one of the bars/restaurants recommended by Abel or Sergio. Altogether a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep amongst antiques”
Reviews.Author: FromOz_10
Reviews.Content: Arriving after an exhausting flight, the guys at the hotel took my huge suitcase and lugged it up the marble staircase for me. (There is no lift up to the first floor where the hotel starts.) The hotel is hidden away in a fantastic location, within walking distance of Placa Catalunya and along a main thoroughfare; the Gran Via. Every square inch is taken up with antiques and knick knacks, giving the place an unusual ambience for a hotel. It is small which made me anxious whenever I had to navigate my suitcase through the corridor. Fortunately, with only a few rooms to let, the corridors and the threat of knocking down small statues were short journeys. The rooms also have antiques. Ours had an enormous double door cupboard for our clothes. It did make the room a little tight for getting around. Everything was clean and the guys running the hotel were most helpful and obliging. The room and bathroom was climate controlled. Breakfasts could be early or late. There's a small patio on which you can take breakfast in the morning. Or you could just wander down the road to one of the many cafes. We walked to many different restaurants, tapas bars and cafes during our week there.

Reviews.Title: “A place to return to and recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: bizikleta
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hostal L'Antic Espai. I stayed there in August 2010. It combined modern convenience (remodeled bathrooms, excellent air conditioning, free and speedy internet access) with beautiful and unique accommodations (antiques in all rooms and common areas, attention to detail). When I travel alone, I look for safety, intelligent management, internet, and a location that is convenient for transit. In addition, I want something unique when I travel for pleasure. Hostal L'Antic Espai supplied all of that. A safe, 24 hour desk, small, discrete location with modern security and central Barcelona site. I will come back whenever I'm in Barcelona. Abel was awesome - many thanks for helping make my stay in Barcelona memorable (and my apologies for reviewing so late...I've been doing a lot of traveling this year).

Reviews.Title: “Truly Unique and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: slimsdahl
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my daughter and upon arrival at L'Antic Espai it was like being transported to another era. If you like antiques and turn of the century architecture, this is the place to be. The fabulous array of antiques were not just on display, but an integral part of the decor. The beds and pillows are comfortable, and after a good nights sleep, breakfast at Hostal L'Antic Espai was a pure delight. The table is set with antique cups & saucers, plates and all. Hot cocoa, tea, coffee, juice and a plethora of delicious delectables with service fit for royalty. Abel, Sergio and staff treated us like queens and we soon began to feel at home. We had originally planned to stay here for the first few days before our cruise and when we returned we would stay at a four star hotel to complete our trip. After the first day at Hostal L'Antic Espai, we cancelled our return hotel and booked a room for our return to Barcelona at the Hostal L'Antic Espai. Coming back from the cruise to L'Antic Espai was like coming back to a good friend's home. When the airline lost my luggage at the beginning, Sergio was a big help in getting it sent to the ship. We also received excellent restaurant suggestions and the location couldn't be better. Thank you all, and especially Sergio, Abel, and Muhannad for the warmth and kindness you showered us with right from the start. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Different!!”
Reviews.Author: ALorraine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 17th September - we arrived far later than expected as our flight had been re-directed to another airport due to a terrible storm! It did not matter our rooms were ready as was our sangria, although it was 1am. We had the single rooms - which were lovely but you did not know what time of day it was as there was not an outside window! Something I did not like - however that is my only real negative comment. It is a real quirky place to stay - the guys are lovely and quite clearly work hard to make their venture work. It is within walking distance of everywhere - and boy did we walk!! If you want somewhere that is fairly central and don't mind walking and love personal service - this is the place for you. However, you can pick up the metro, bus or cab from right outside the door if you prefer to use transport. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like walkin into a different world-A TRUE GEM-excellent service”
Reviews.Author: makelly4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in L`antic Espai for 2 nights in august before and after our med cruise as we celebrated our anniversary,we always look up tripadvisor before we go away and i must agree with 99% of reviews,the 1% i dont agree with are reviewers who complained about lack of services-ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS ASK,and Abel,Sergio.Axel & all the staff will do all they can to help.This is a real find and such a lovely quaint place in a great location in Barcelona.We arrived on a really warm summers day & were greeted with a pleasant smile and a cool glass of sangria(what a lovely welcome),we stayed in a triple room and also had our breakfast on the patio surrounded by lovely plants & singin birds(in the heart of Barcelona this is one of the things that makes this unique) on the sunday we arrived we sat out on the patio with a bottle of wine and celebrated our anniversary & the start of our cruise.Abel,Sergio have also a great knowledge of this city and were so helpfull to us with all our questions.This is a perfect place to stay if you want something really different with a great location,the hotel also runs a taxi service to the airport and to the cruise port which we availed of & was very convienenient.Our daughter who is 17 also enjoyed her stay and the free use of the internet meant she could keep in touch with her friends,I would not hesitate to recommend this gem to anyone & would like to thank Abel,Sergio & all the staff for a lovely stay and a great experiance,when we return to Barcelona we look very much forward to our next stay in L`antic Espai.Mike, Anne,& Niamh from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “L'Antic Espai -- beautiful hotel, great location, incredible personal service.”
Reviews.Author: comet3615
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at L'Antic Espai based on favorable comments on Trip Advisor and are delighted to report that the hotel deserves all the praise. Great location in L'Eixample on the Gran Via, a very short walk to Passeig La Gracia metro, beautiful shops, great restaurants. From our first minutes there, when we were served delicious sangria in our room as a welcome refreshment, we knew we were going to feel at home. Abel and Sergio bent over backwards to be helpful, both before (in helping us plan) and during our stay in booking reservations, making recommendations, etc. The hotel is beautiful, overflowing with beautiful antiques -- everywhere you look there is something to delight the eye. We had a lovely room opening onto a plant filled terrace with beautiful caged birds, where we were served breakfast every morning -- a wonderful way to start the day. L'Antic Espai will be our "home" when we return to Barcelona. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A really great experience.”
Reviews.Author: nolaneve
Reviews.Content: I live in Catalunya but had an early flight and needed somewhere to stay the night before. In the past I've tried various hotels and hostals in the city, but from now on I need look no further. The whole stay was a delight - from the fantastic period decor to the care and attention shown by both Sergio and Abel. My room was perfect, with a wonderful bed and every facility, and the welcoming glass of sangria set my stay off to a good start. I particularly enjoyed breakfast on the lovely terrace surrounded by plants , flowers and birds. Many thanks, guys, for making me feel so relaxed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: paolo4918
Reviews.Content: The Hostal L'Antic Espai is in a word, "WONDERFUL". This antique and curio filled small hotel felt more like a Bed and Breakfast than a hotel. It is well located near the transportation hub at Plaza Cataluna in the Modernisme filled Eixample neighborhood. Sergio and Alex are great hosts who what to insure that you enjoy your stay at their hotel and in Barcelona. Seek them out for suggestions. We had a lovely room with a private balcony where we enjoyed our breakfast in the morning and a glass of cava in the evening. There is no elevator, but you get immediate assistance with your luggage, so getting the the first floor (2nd floor in the US) hotel is no problem unless you cannot climb a long flight of steps. I would not recommend this for young kids unless they are well controlled and can keep their hands off all the curios. We really enjoyed our three night stay at L'Antic Espai and will stay there again if we have the opportunity to visit Barcelona in the future. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: dallas_sky10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I unfortunatly only stayed one night here but if we came back to barcelona we would love to stay here again. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The decor is charming and beautiful. The location is perfect. The room are very clean and the beds are comfortable and cozy. They have a collecton of dvd's which were great for us after a very long day walking around exploring the city we came back and whatched a movie (in english) and drank a bottle of wine. They also have a very cool finger printitng system which allows you into the builing and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Clint_Trooper
Reviews.Content: Visited over the August Bank Holiday Reunion Weekend with five other couples as an unannounced group. We have nothing but praise for this unique oasis. Very individual, eclectic, comfortable, accommodating, friendly- a unique experience and far far better than your average hotel. The two owners are committed to this venture and provide excellent breakfasts, suggestions for itineraries as well as recommendations for restaurants - based on their own experience. Hasta la Vista - we will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection.......”
Reviews.Author: alana2408
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I thought it looked like the perfect "authentic" place to stay whilst in Barcelona with my partner and I couldn't have got it more right. Walking through the old reception door and being greeted by the most beautiful antiques I felt like I had been transported back to a time where "Ikea" and other cheap looking furniture that most hotels deck their rooms out in had never existed. First person we met was Sergio who is such a breath of fresh air and so helpful. Went out of his way to get us a different room when I had made an error on the booking and gave us a map with everything circled so it was easy to find our way to the tourist spots ( although we still got lost nearly every night! Barcelona is a maze of back lanes and alleys ) Breakfast in the morning was an absolute treat! Sitting out on the balcony with all the old porcelain and cutlery I felt this was the way to visit Barcelona ( although I must admit I was so happy when I saw the British tea bags! ) I honestly cannot fault a single minute of my time at this hotel, it is the perfect place to stay in Barcelona and I will never stay anywhere else when I visit again ( which will be very soon if my boyfriend has anything to do with it as he fell in love with the place even more than I did! ) Top marks to the owners for doing it their way and not bowing to any pressures of becoming a "cheap modern hotel" like the thousands that are out there.......this is the way to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and memorable!”
Reviews.Author: Janzer
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous little gem in the Eixample area of Barcelona. If you're interested in a hotel with character and quirkiness, look no further! We had access to the terrace area for our breakfasts. The owners were extremely helpful in suggesting retaurants and a fantastic local tapas bar. Loved it. Will be reccommending to friends for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts that really made it special”
Reviews.Author: Notjustanyhotel
Reviews.Content: Thank you Sergio and Abel... who welcomed me, my girlfriend, and my daughter... as though we were family. Although they were having air conditioning problems, they did everything they could to make our stay comfortable -- sangria, fans, a portable air-con unit (!!!), and lots of personal interaction. Their restaurant recommendations were inventive, they helped us with airport and train information, and they just generally made our stay fun. We stayed in a triple room--which was just large enough for the 3 of us. Everything was clean and the courtyard with lovebirds outside our sliding glass door was a lovely respite after shopping and touring. The room had a beautiful wardrobe for our clothes... the beds were very firm (and very low to the ground!), the shower was pretty tight (don't drop the soap; you'll have trouble retrieving it!), but worked great. We loved it here and would come back again. Make sure you watch carefully when you first arrive--the place is hard to recognize... just a door, a flag, and a small sign. And... if you can't handle stairs, this would not be a good option for you. If you can, you will want to take Sergio and Abel home with you. We are very chatty people and we struck up lots of great converstations with them -- lots of hugs when we left! Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Like a film set”
Reviews.Author: AntibesAdam
Reviews.Content: Different and unusual, I'd imagine not to everyones taste if you like ultra modern places. Its small but extremely well designed space. I had a small room with a large double bed, full of art deco objects and oil paintings, a seperate lounging/dressing area leading out onto the plant and flower filled terrace. Beautiful, even down to the gold embroidered quilt on the bed! Don't let the word Hostel put you off. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nicf32
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in early April to celebrate his 40th birthday. The staff were a delight, especially the ?Argentinian receptionist that was very attentive when I was struck down with food poisoning on the final day, (nothing at all to do with the hotel). Breakfast on the terrace was delicious and the sangria on arrival was a lovely touch. Many thanks to all the staff for a wonderful holiday and apologies again for the noise that the boys made on partner's birthday - luckily I slept through this but unfortunately, other guests didn't. Very sorry and when we return, it will be just the two of us heading to Barcelona for a "quiet" getaway!

Reviews.Title: “The antidote to IKEA hotels”
Reviews.Author: WanderingGerbil
Reviews.Content: In an ideal world all Hotels/Hostels etc would be like this and have there own character and charm. We travel for a variety of reasons but one of them is go and experience something we cant get at home. All too often the good hotels cater for the majority with inevitable results. Quality yes, but tinged with a general sense of 'sameness'. The danger of daring to be different is that you cant please everyone which means that some people just wont appreciate this charming little gem. Which is a shame but a price worth paying. The owners of this hostel have dared to be different. From the outset its obvious they have trusted their own tastes and created a place they would like to stay. I must say they do have a certain style in abundance, i never knew you could cram so much in to one place. I was apprehensive when i arrived but sad to leave (Barcelona its self may have played a part in that). As said above this is a cracking little gem of a hostel. First things first. Its a hostel but not in the sense that many from the uk would understand a hostel. If you now have pictures of sweaty backpackers in some bunk bed ridden hostels you are so far off base. Its just a small hotel, most of the rooms do open out onto a small shared terrace, where breakfast is served. It is 'cosy' in so many ways. It is actually set on the first floor of an old fashioned apartment block so don't expect a big grand entrance. Second, the antiques. As the title says this is the antidote to IKEA. They once ran an add in the UK that said chuck out your chintz, well the better stuff ended up here. Don't get me wrong I like IKEA, in fact the other hotel we stayed at on our trip was extremely tastefully furnished from IKEA. This is just the other end of the taste range. When you first arrive its a bit over powering but it has a charm all of its own, you just need to go with it. Third, as this is a small hotel don't expect the kind of staff you will find in the chains or larger (i.e. fluent in 5 languages, appearing like magic ready to serve your every whim and with an encyclopedic knowledge of any subject you might want to know about). If, like us, you arrive when the owners are not there you may have to deal with someone who only speaks Spanish, and my Spanish was severely tested - it paid to arrive in Spain with basic phrases; I have a room reservation in the name of...., what time is breakfast? and can you record my finger print so i can get back in - you know the basics (if you go you will soon understand the last bit - that was a conversation i never practiced before hand). However, the owners English was so much better than my Spanish and once he arrived all confusion was gone. He provided us with several very good recommendations for eating out and i really got the feeling they were recommendations of places 'he' would eat. The general feeling you get with this place is that they have created somewhere they would want to stay. The feeling you get with this place is personal, not cooperate. Its not a big supper smooth hotel, and on the downside i did find it a little bit too noisy, but on the whole i'm really glad we choose to stay here. The hotel and its staff will be as much a part of my memories of Barcelona as the Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located with good service”
Reviews.Author: Bornfreenowexpensive
Reviews.Content: This is a charming inn well located near the Placa Catalunya, making it easy to walk around the city. The young men who run it speak very good English and are very helpful. This is a good inn for people who want something other than a sterile hotel room. We had breakfast in the room once, and then got our bearings and wandered about the city for breakfast. They have good reccommendations for restaurants and go themselves to eat at the places they reccommend. For a small fee, they provide transportation back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: skydoc
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights here on a short visit to Barcelona.I found the hotel on Tripadvisor after doing lots of research on the internet to find somewhere to stay. I wanted somewhere that had character and was in a central location and L'Antic Espai turned out to be perfect. It is a small hotel created from a first floor apartment in a classical building on the C/Gran Via de la Corts.It took less than 10 minutes to walk from the Aerobus stop at Pl de Catalunya and it is in a great location to walk to many of the main attractions in Barcelona. Inside it is a treasure trove of antique furniture,ceramics and curios.It fels like you are staying in a private house and the charming welcome given by the hosts feels the same. We were welcomed with a glass of sangria and given helpful advice on where to visit, how best to get tickets to galleries and museums and nothing seemed too much trouble. The rooms are elegant,comfortable and beautifully presented. Breakfast is served on a terrace by your room. Again attention to detail is immaculate with delightful antique china and table wear. It's a perfect place for an elegant,quiet stay in Barcelona with impeccable service.We will definitely tell all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating our Silver Wedding Anniversay - a very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: MollyWorcester
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff whose restaurant recommendations were very good. Lovely breakfast served on pretty patio outside your room. The patio is shared by 4 rooms, which means if you are a couple you may find you share the table with other guests.. Spotlessly clean. Extremely comfortable bed (and pillows). Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Co_CorkIrelandBilbo
Reviews.Content: What do you look for in a city hotel. For me it's quite simple. Clean, comfortable, and pleasant rooms, a sleep promoting bed, good vibes surrounding the place, and, perhaps above all, hosts who are there because they seem to want to be and who pass this feeling on to you and make you feel welcome, rather then a revenue source. Well, if you share any of the above priorities, be sure to stay at this wonderful small hotel. Not only that, but it is wonderfully located, making it easy to get to any central location. Lots more good stuff could be written, but just go there and experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel With Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RedSonya
Reviews.Content: In August of 2009, I eagerly set out, along with six other girls, to explore the land of bullfighting, flamenco, olives, and paella. Our first stop on the journey was Barcelona. As such, our time there set the tone for the rest of our adventure. Largely due to the quality experience we had at Hotel L'Antic Espai, our Barcelona immersion was amazing, and we were set to have a great continued adventure. From the Sangria greeting, to the antiques decorating each room, to the charming patio wherein guests can receive a deluxe breakfast to start each day, L'Antic Espai reeks of character. Comprised of only a handful of guest rooms, it also offers a quaint, intimate ambiance. Because of the small number of guests at any time, the owners and employees are able to provide guests with extensive one-on-one attention. One of the owners, Abel, gave us a restaurant recommendation that led to the best meal we had during our entire 3 weeks in Spain. He also sent us to an authentic Flamenco show we otherwise would not have chosen. I arrived with 4 other girls and we were initially placed in two rooms. However, because one of the rooms was small, the owners gave us a third room on the house. This was an exceptionally rare and kind act of customer service that really made our stay more enjoyable. We felt very at home very quickly in our stay (probably too much at home!). Abel and others answered all of our questions and really just embraced our presence. We actually felt like they were our friends by the time we left. The hotel is just a few blocks from many different things, including the metro. Yet, it is secluded enough that there is no noise and you don't feel overwhelmed by locals or tourists. Overall a great location. Quality of experience is often about level and type of expectation. Thus, I think it's important to clarify that Hotel L'Antic Espai is not the W or the Four Seasons. Other than great atmosphere, fabulous pricing, and superb customer service, there are few amenities. It is a boutique hotel with a very interesting and unique feel. For me, that makes the place amazing. But for those looking for a cookie-cutter, upscale hotel this is not the place for you. Note: There is no elevator. If you come armed with heavy luggage, beware: you will have to carry it up a long, winding staircase. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Memory-loved it”
Reviews.Author: MotherDaughter1
Reviews.Content: As we approached the address the cab driver couldn't quite find the hotel and then I remembered reading on Trip Advisor that it is on the second floor so the entrance is not that noticeable. We were buzzed in and then I remembered reading on Trip Advisor that you need to walk up the first flight, (no elevator). About now I was keeping my fingers crossed that this wasn't a mistake. And it wasn't. We stayed in four cities during our mother-daughter trip and this hotel was hands down such a find. While the location was really perfection--very centrally located to the major sites and metro--the magic of this place is the ambiance and hospitality. The owners have invested in creating a little of oasis of beauty and serenity. There are about 10 rooms and the ones in the front have double paned windows to ensure a peaceful night sleep. Each room is appointed with lovely detail and antiques from around the world. I even loved the scent of the bath soap, which gives you the sense that every detail was considered. The rooms in the back, have access to a patio. Had the hotel been fully booked, we may not have known this, but because it wasn't, the owner invited to enjoy it and treated us to a bottle of champagne since I was celebrating a birthday. It was just lovely and while I will try other hotels in other cities we visited next time, I will try to return to Barcelona, just to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This place is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lindshenderson
Reviews.Content: I came here with my best friend (we are in our early twenties) and we had a wonderful time. I've never stayed at a place like this before. It is very personal and friendly. There is a staff of 4 young guys and housekeepers. Everyone is extremely nice and helped us with anything we needed. They gave us advice on where to go and not to go, and helped us with cultural differences and language. The boys are also from different areas in the world, they had alot of interesting things to tell us. This place is quiet and has beautiful, unique pieces in every room. They offer free breakfast, and we got to eat on the terrace which is so pretty and nice. We had toast and jam and hot chocolate, which was different than what we are used to, but very yummy. Our room (101) faced the street, and I was amazed at how quiet it was, because we had a balcony and a big door, but no noise came through from the cars and the action. Everything was clean and functional of course. The rooms are not as big as many U.S. hotel rooms, but that was no problem for us, it was definitely comfortable. Also, people who have problem climbing stairs, there are 25 steps to get to the hotel. It isn't far, but if you have bad knees, be careful. The surrounding area is pretty safe, we had no problems at all. There are lots of small grocery stores and restaurants. We went out dancing one night. That was a different experience. The clubs didn't really open till 2am, so keep that in mind. They let us use their internet for free. They were having some issues with their internet company, if you are absolutely dependent on internet, be cautious. But we were just updating family on our adventure, and not being charged was a major plus. It's centrally located, we were in between Gaudi and the beach and Las Ramblas. I would definitely recommend this hotel, we stayed for 3 or 4 nights I think, and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great Location, & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: SYOUNG13
Reviews.Content: As a single woman traveler I was looking for a smaller hotel that I would not feel like just another number -- and L'Antic Espai met all my expectations. During my four night stay -- I felt that someone was always looking out for my best interest/comfort - from having coffee and breakfast offered to me when I arrived -- even when it was past breakfast time- to help/comfort with a small personal matter. Also good dinning recommendations and great general knowledge of Barcelona (which I fell in love with) Don't be put off by outside of building (it looks like a plain office/residential building). If possible ask for a room with access to the terrace - the rooms are bigger and eating breakfast on the terrace is divine. The bed was really comfortable and the rooms and bathrooms are kept very clean--- The location is really great - as you can walk to a lot of sights/metro - but away from a lot of the city noises. Some minor issues -- It's a small b &b - some don't expect fancy ammenities - there is one computer for guest use/ towels are not big & fluffy and small TVs - Also, the rooms are pretty close to one another so you might hear noises from other rooms/common rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEF_9
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated boutique hotel. My room faced onto a central service shaft, so was quite dark, but the room itself was extremely comfortable and blissfully quiet - had the best sleep I'd had in weeks the two nights I stayed. In a good location, short walk from Las Ramblas and easy access to the subway, buses, restaurants and everything you need. Very friendly staff, overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small and artistic”
Reviews.Author: svegor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only a few minutes' walk away from Placa de Catalunya, Barcelona's central square, so many sights, including the famous La Rambla, are easily within walking distance from it. I had a difficulty finding it when I arrived, though - it appeared that this small hotel was on the second floor of an apartment building, and its sign is not very easy to find unless you know what you are looking for. In addition, the building has no elevator, so I had to drag my bag upstairs because a roommaid was the only person present there when I arrived. My single room was small but air-conditioned and very cozy, full of antique-looking furniture.
