The wardrobe door cracked when opened or closed, but somehow did not feel this sound irritating because it looked so antique that you hardly expected it to open noiselessly. The elegant desk was a real period piece, with some old china decorating it. On the whole, the hotel definitely has an atmosphere - it is packed with antique furniture, china and chandeliers. The bathroom with a shower was quite a good size, but the toilet was too close to the shower cabin, so if I was taller and my legs were an inch longer, I might have had a problem fitting them into this small space. Breakfast is not included, but you can have it for an extra charge, and they will serve it either in the sitting room or on the veranda at any time you want to have it. I only had it on one day, and it was very good and served by the owner of the hotel. The owners are very helpful - they gave me some useful advice on how to see the most of Barcelona in the time that I had, and how to take some safety precautions in public places. On the day of my departure, after I checked out, I store my bag at the owner's desk as my flight was later in the evening. The owner helped me carry my bag downstairs and wished me to have a good trip back home, which was another nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: mcmastar
Reviews.Content: This was by far our best experience in Barcelona, let alone any hotel we have ever stayed in! The staff were amazing people and overly friendly. They were always willing to help, and gave us a very personal experience. The service was outstanding, from our folded laundry in brief cases, to the breakfast served to us on the terrace. Located in central Barcelona, we were always a walk away from the most amazing sights. This was definitely the best place we stayed in through our month-long stay in Europe. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: karenb284
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights with friends. I booked it based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. People had mentioned that it was upstairs,and had no lift-maybe a problem with3 large cases and 2 sets of golf clubs(we were going on somewhere else). But when we arrived we were told to leave our cases and a lovely young man brought them all upstairs for us,checked us in quickly and bought us a glass of wine as a welcome on the terrace - lovely! We were in Room 7 and our friends were in Room 2. Both lovely rooms,exactly as pictured. Neither were massive but perfectly adequate for somewhere like Barcelona,where you are out all day sightseeing anyway. The shared terrace that led off our room was absolutely delightful- a quiet haven from the hustle and bustle of the city. Another reviewer said the bed in Room 7 was exceptionally tiny which was a concern. We have a 6' bed at home, and while this bed wasnt as big,it was perfectly comfortable- we had a good nights sleep. There was a little noise from the tv area when we first went to bed,but it didnt last long,and is more the fault of inconsiderate guests rather than the hotel. The only time we felt or heard the subway was on the terrace,and that was just a vibration. I believe our friends heard it more in their room, but they had such a good nights sleep they overslept by 2 hours,and only woke when I texted them to see if they were ok. The bathrooms were small, but good showers, complimentary toiletries and clean! Every single member of staff fell over themselves to make sure our stay was a good one. We were given an excellent restaurant reccommendation, Mohanned was extremely helpful and always smiling. Abel helped us make a car hire booking for nearly an hour when I'm sure he had more things he could have been doing, and we had a quiet drink on the terrace at midnight one night,coffee again on the terrace the next night. All with a big smile. The hotel was spotless,and our bed linen was lovely -the kind I have in my own home. We also liked that you were only admitted via intercom at the main door and that there was always someone on duty- it felt very secure. We would definitely stay here again,and wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone we know. The only people I would say it isnt suitable for is younger people who want to go out til the early hours then continue the party back at their hotel. And of course the lack of a lift would cause a problem for people with mobilty problems. But for us - superb!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Liked It!”
Reviews.Author: Where2Next37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Antic Espai for three nights after our cruise ended in Barcelona. The hotel is conveniently located within easy walking distance of La Rambla, La Boqueria, and other city landmarks. We were in room 102, which is the room with the private little balcony overlooking the Gran Via. We enjoyed that balcony every evening--loved sitting out there with a glass of wine watching the people pass by, etc. The room and the hotel in general were clean and well-maintained. The owners, Sergio and Able, are both very friendly and very helpful. They made reservations for our group from the cruise for dinner one night at Los Caracoles (excellent!) and the following night at El Tablao de Carmen (tapas & wine followed by a flamenco show that was simply amazing!) We would certainly stay here again on a future visit in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Original”
Reviews.Author: grisuccio
Reviews.Content: Nice hostal, excellent location ,with original and fascinating mobilia. Very, very, very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this little Hostal in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KimHaynes
Reviews.Content: Chose this hostal for the location - perfect for walking to the great market, La Rambla, and all the major works of Gaudi. Loved the coziness of the rooms, free internet, and the owners, Sergio and Able, were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler7
Reviews.Content: The staff trys but this is a good place to skip. It is hard to find. You must climb two long flights of stairs to get to reception. The rooms are small, bathrooms clean but very small. But the worst part is getting waken at 6:15 am with clinks and clomps. The secnd morning the noise started about 7:30. In Spain this is way too early.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Peckisher
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. A nice small friendly Hostel BUT First impressions are very important and here, they are not good. The apartment block is shabby and the dusty Hotel sign gives a poor impression. You enter into a dark unwelcoming Hallway and have to climb 25 steps to reach the Hotel. There is no lift and so it is totally unsuitable for anyone with mobility problems although this is not advertised prominently on the website. When you reach the Hotel, you enter into another world..filled with treasures. There are some beautiful pieces and it is tastefully decorated. The owners are friendly. It has a fantastic location. Our bedroom was nicely decorated, but I do feel that the love the owner has for his antiques is detrimental to the comfort of the guests. The bed was uncomfortable, the pillow more so, the blanket was grubby. We had to wrestle with the beautiful wardrobe door to open it. There were no chairs, only beds, a wardrobe and a stool and an elegant cabinet between the beds which was already cluttered. A TV on the wall worked intermittantly. The fantastic chandelier gives off a very bright and harsh light as do the bedside lamps not making for a restful atmosphere. It was not a room you would want to spend much time in! No complaints about the shower room, it was clean and functional. Quite noisy with the rumble of the underground and traffic, not to mention the paper thin walls where every sound could be heard. No respite either in the communal TV room. Again, the love for antiques overshadows comfort. The beautiful antique chairs are uncomfortable, you are looking over a sea of distracting antiques and people coming and going if you want to watch TV. This room is right in the middle of the main thoroughfare of the Hotel so again, no peace and quiet after the bustle of the city. It would have been a better idea to utilise one of the terrace rooms as a quiet communal area. Breakfast. One has to reach the terrace by walking through someones bedroom! Again, the breakfast is beautifully presented with china crockery and silver antique cutlery, but it makes the breakfast look far better than it actually is. Quite an expensive breakfast, but certainly not a quality one with poor ingredients used and coffee served from nice little pots, but usually lukewarm. Also, other guests share a table. To sum up...this is a quirky unusual and perfectly located Hotel with pleasant staff, but for me the cons outnumbered the pros. I do realise that it is not a 5* but it is quite a pricey 2* Hostal I know the owners hate critisism, and always try to justify their stratagy, but I feel that based on my experience there, my review is a fair one.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay, well-located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gafan2
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a three night stay in room one (twin beds) in May 2010. The customer service was excellent. The room was clean and comfortable, with a cute balcony. This is a very well-located hotel. A light breakfast was included, and I was glad to have the free internet service. On my next trip to Barcelona I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, nice & well located hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jojo42660
Reviews.Content: Good service, breakfast on the terrace is very nice. Local hotel team is very helpful. To recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The reason I will return to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Pennina
Reviews.Content: I selected the hotel from Trip Adviser and was not disappointed. We loved it. It is full of charm being crammed with antiques and collectables- just my type of place. It could be considered quirky, but I feel it has so much more character than the usual places in which you can stay. There was so much to look at. The 2 owners and staff were all charming, friendly and helpful and it felt like being welcomed into a home. The location was excellent. Many of the museums, Gaudi buildings, cafes and shops were in walking distance and there was a metro station very near. The fingerprint key system was fun - a place using up-to-the- minute technology. The breakfasts were beautifully presented. I could continue with the praise, but will end by saying that we will return to Barcelona so that we can stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great Choice, Great value for your Money and Amazing ownners!”
Reviews.Author: Inbal2
Reviews.Content: The reason for the delay in my review is the hope of finding the memory card with (great) pictures taken from the place. sorry. In any case, My Husbansd and I stayed in Hostal L'Antic Espai last Summer for about a week and absolutly LOVED IT. The place is nothing short of at least a 3 Star Hotel. Its location is great, It is Beutifuly designd and furnished, very clean, and very much affordable. The 2 man running the place: Abel and Serjio (I hope I spelled their names correctly) are the sweetest people! I have to mention that we arrived at Barcelona During a big Conference (one of many which take place in the city), and reserved only one night in a different hotel. We searched for a place to sleep for hours and were very upset to find that every place we went prices were so expensive, as Hostals and Hotels took advantage of of the situation, except for Abel and Serjio, who run L'Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: FCman
Reviews.Content: Small 2 star hotel , centrally located , ideal for visting Barcelona. Very comfortable , staff couldn't help you enough. No issues withe anything.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, wonderful hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Vietvet70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days in mid-February at this great small hotel. It is decidedly NOT a business-class hotel. No fitness center, elevator or restaurant/lounge, precisely why I would not hesitate to return or recommend. Abel, Sergio and the staff are as pleasant and accomodating as one could imagine. We were in room 102, with a delightful enclosed balcony from which we viewed the bustle of the city awakening each morning while enjoying our terrific, filling and lovingly presented breakfast. Character, and charm abound in this welcome retreat. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I truly enjoyed my stay at this perfectly located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slustberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and quaint. I loved the antique furnishings and rooms with high ceilings. The staff couldn't have been more accomodating. Note: If you have trouble with stairs, this is not the place for you. there is no elevator. But I think the atmosphere and location were worth the climb. Try to get one of the rooms with the patio outside. It's wonderful with a fountain and birds in antique cages; it's also a great place to eat and relax after a day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect relief from the stereotype chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: Sihans
Reviews.Content: I booked this at the internett after having read a lot of good comments. Although I have travelled extensively for over 20 years in my work as export manager (before retirement), visiting over 45 countries in four continents, the L´Antic Espai is one of e select few that will stay in my memory as one of the really good experiences. Personal touch, friendliness, great trust shown guests in thet they both show and use their antiques and other collectors items. Add perfect location and readlily shared knowledge of Barcelona. (I see a visitor complaining about lack of english TV channels. If you spend a few days in such a beautiful city, why vaste them by watching TV?) I arrived 15th and left on the 18th and had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay. Temperature just permitting the pleasure of the lush balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation system does not work - beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: RobinHood1
Reviews.Content: I am sure that this is a very nice hotel and just the sort of place we like to stay - unfortunately we won't be! I booked on line for 4 nights and received a full confirmation from the hotel's booking system. However it appears that this system does not actually reserve you a room. So do not be seduced by official looking confirmations and airline style confirmation numbers. When I contacted the hotel to let them know our rather late arrival time, I was told that we had no booking, although later in the e mail , was told that it was in the "online" system but had never been noticed! Oh dear, only small rooms available and not for all nights! Offered two different rooms and then on one night to go elsewhere! Not good...so had to find somewhere else and at this late stage the weekend particularly is very expensive. So if you have booked on their online system - and have only an online confirmation I suggest you contact the hotel quickly to confirm again. Would have thought in this internet age this is a problem that should not have arisen.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Recommend - small, friendly & bursting with character”
Reviews.Author: LBuzzard
Reviews.Content: Surprise weekend for my husband's birthday : this was just the type of place we love - small, individual and full of character. Excellent location for exploring the city & everything on hand that we could have needed.Our hosts were charming & couldn't have been more helpful. The hostal was beautiful - each room different and thoughtfully put together, exceptionally clean & cared for. Had a chilled bottle of cava by candlelight on the terrace to celebrate & breakfast there too,with the sounds of the water feature & bird song. Slightly more soundproofing would add to the perfection but wouldn't hestitate to recommend and look forward to our return visit to both the city & L'Antic. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in superb location of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AAABookworm
Reviews.Content: Near metro, shopping restaurants, Barri Gotic, Ruta Modernista. Clean rooms with character. Excellent, friendly, helpful service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: kerrieann2
Reviews.Content: I can't think of a single negative thing to say about this hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat. The balcony is amazing,

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled, this is a ** Hostal”
Reviews.Author: Barryiom_47
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe Hostal L'Antic Aspai could be rated as one of the top places to stay in Barcelona. The place is quaint and well located. However, the rooms are very small and basic (no working telly and nobody who tried to fix it - but all channels I was told were in Spannish anyway) only three staff, who rotate / man the place - one of which speaks no English whatsoever, beds were very uncomfortable and the constant rumble of the metro that runs beneath the building. The hostal is on one floor of an appartment block and charges way above its value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ahoff
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Hostal L'Antic Espai. My mother, my sister, and I traveled for a week in Spain and the last stop was Barcelona. It's a small hotel with uniquely decorated rooms. Ours lead out of sliding glass doors onto a semi-private patio with beautiful birds and plants. They served breakfast out here. I would say the entire experience was serene. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were spotless. The location could not have been better. I will stay here again if I am ever in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly service, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Bufje
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for one night upon recommendation of TripAdvisor members. And the hostal just lived up to my expectation. The chamber maid, the night porter and Sergio have taken a really good care of me. I have indulged myself with Ayuverdic massage from well experienced Gabriela. The breakfast was simple but tasty, presented in such a charming way. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: EmelarLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Hostal L'Antic Espai was everything we wanted. It was comfortable, clean, quirky and interesting. It is close to the centre of the city and all its forms of transport. And all this is on top of the Hostal being run by truly excellent people. I would love to go back and will recommend it to everyone I know. If you stay here, and you really should, let them guide your stay in lovely Barcelona. They will make your time in this amazing city even better.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay really enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Nicola033
Reviews.Content: A great welcome and good recommendations for restaurants close by. We had a choice of rooms too. This boutique hotel is full of beautiful antiques and really made our stay that more personal and enjoyable, would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit - was even better!”
Reviews.Author: MF2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited last year and had a fabulous time. This year was even better – welcomed back like one of the family, we were delighted to find that many beautiful improvements had been made to the hotel. Breakfast on the veranda was sublime and all the restaurants suggested were fantastic; we particularly enjoyed the urban secret restaurant nearby ‘Don’t Tell’ disguised to look like a laundrette. Truly excellent value, we look forward to returning very soon. Thank you for a wonderful and relaxing break!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: runnerCatania
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice, confortable and well positioned . Staff is truly kind and helpful. An excellent massage service is available. I was really satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “good value, pleasant stay, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Philly2Ireland
Reviews.Content: We really loved it for value. In an area that is convenient for walking wherever you want, subways nearby, restaurants and so on. The room was smallish in size but with us we don't care. Everything else made up for it. The price was right and the boys who ran it were great. This just isn't a room for people looking to hang around and lounge in the room. We had a room on the front of the building and didn't find anything with the noise any bother at all. they had dvds to borrow as well

Reviews.Title: “Charming and elegant with luxurious antique touch”
Reviews.Author: mandola
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer. I thought Sergio and Abel did an excellent job. The extensive effort they put into decorating and running this hotel is evident. This hotel is a labor of love for them. They clearly love taking care of people. felt like being at "home" while staying there. thanks guys. Get a terrace room and have breakfast on antique plateware on the terrace with the birds. A very nice experience. Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “The height of charm and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: joiussance33
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a place that exudes character, class, individuality, interest, hospitality and comfort then go to L'Antic Espai. I found this place on the net after a week in an over-priced, production line hotel with morose staff, saccharine decor and a generally soulless environment. The reason I chose to elope to L'Antic Espai initially was because I was on a budget and there was an offer on rooms as a result of it being low season, and by crikey I was glad of my economic choice. Normally prices are much higher but still very reasonable compared to the other hotels on the same strip including the Ritz next door. Reviews boasted a world of antique ridden splendour which I thought I would be indifferent to but it really is enchanting when you’re there- figurines, floral adornments, mosaic floors, marble staircases, ornate furniture, stained-glass lanterns, hand carved keys, classic rotary dial telephones, etc. And it also caters for the 21st century traveller- internet, digital TV, DVD, secret service key cards to get in, hairdryers! It’s in a great location too, right in the centre equidistant from all the nicest areas (El Born, Barri Gotic, Eixample) and 1 min off the main high street shopping drag (not too close to La Rambla either so you won’t get infected by its tacky over-touristified poison). And the owners and staff are super hospitable, catering to your every whim. I ended up staying for 3 weeks and it’s the only hotel in Barcelona for me now, and the rest of my family who came and loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: catmagpie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night (unfortunately) and booked based on the previous reviews. The room (101) was spotless, beaufiful and perfect. Some noise from the avenue outside but this is to be expected in a busy town like Barcelona. Breakfast on the terrace was great although the orange juice could have been made from the real thing rather than come from a carton? But overall - we highly recommend and will definitively come back if we happen to be in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming; well-located; friendly service”
Reviews.Author: knoxtgrav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located for someone who is trying to take in as much of Barcelona as they can in a relatively short period of time. It is in easy walking distance of many major sites and is located close to the subway to go further abroad. What sets this hotel apart, however, is the service. The hotel is clearly the owner's passion, and he works very hard to make sure that you are well cared for. When we overslept and were about to miss our plane, he dropped everything and took us to the airport. Our room was comfortable and clean. Very nice room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: anniecat1242
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our short stay at L'Antic Espai, the owner/staff were very helpful and gracious. They made fantastic recommendations for local restaurants, and had a laptop for use in the room, as well as internet access. Since it was holiday season the public room were decorated for the season. Our room was 101, small but adequate for two, with a tiny balcony facing onto the busy street below. It was very quiet with the french door closed. If possible I'd try the rooms in the back with a patio (shared with 2-3 rooms). Of concern to some might be the tiny shower (drop the soap and you need to get out (or use your toes) to retrieve it). We'd stay again and heartily recommend. Very convenient location, near the Gothic area, metro and walkable to nearly all Gaudi sites.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, wonderful, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Charlene459
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after arriving in Barcelona on a cruise, then another night a week later after spending some time in France. From the efficiency with which they handled our booking of the rooms, to the personal transportation to the airport, and everything in between, Abel and Sergio went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and to make our stay easy and enjoyable. On our first visit, we arrived at 10 am and were allowed to check in, which we appreciated as I had a miserable cold and needed to rest for a bit. Our room (107) was filled with lovely antiques, had a little sitting room and opened to a large terrace that's accessible from several rooms (one of our neighbors was out there smoking, which was fine; she & my husband had a nice chat. We ran into her again in Collioure!). Abel made dinner reservations for us, arranged for breakfast and offered to take us to the airport early the next morning. We spent the afternoon walking to Sagrada Familia and exploring the area around the hotel. It has a great location. The room was spotlessly clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was modern and spotless. On our second visit, we were given room 102, which was even better. A very large room, it has a spectacular ceiling and a private balcony overlooking the street. This could be one of our favorite hotel rooms ever. Absolutely lovely. The whole hotel has been recently, painstakingly renovated and is filled with antiques -- everything from the furniture to the teapot at morning breakfast. Absolutely exquisite. One of our favorite moments was when we came back to the hotel with some pastries from a bakery down the street. We asked Sergio if we could have two forks to eat them with. Moments later, there he was with a footed silver tray topped with a paper doily, upon which were two antique china plates, forks and linen napkins. This small gesture is an example of how they care for their guests. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a peaceful, personal hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional, Friendly and Warm”
Reviews.Author: jryan911
Reviews.Content: Abel Gonzalez (a trained physician) and Sergio de Carvalbo have poured their hearts, souls, and sweat (it took a year to renovate and create this unique hostal, with only 12 rooms, in the centrally-located l'Eixample section of Barcelona) into L'Antic Espai, and it shows. I travel a lot. And one hotel seems like another after awhile. But at the L'Antic Espai you are surrounded by a single guiding intelligence that is rare -- it is no wonder this hotel is on lots of "best" lists (like Time Out Barcelona) and has such a high Trip Advisor rating. Get the breakfast (they go to great lengths to make it a wonderful experience, and you'll meet other guests), pet the incredibly friendly dog (reminds me of Matilda the cat at the Algonquin Hotel in New York), soak in the wonderfully dramatic (yes, very Almodovar) decor, and chat it up with Abel or Sergio (they are genuinely interested in others), they have great recommendations on what to do , where to eat, and how to relax in Barcelona. These guys have found themselves with this hotel, and their blossoming fills them with a joy and gentle passion for life that is catching. The joint is one of a kind, and I plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: rhealey
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, located on the second floor of a large building a few blocks from La Rambla. The two owners have done an amazing job in making this a beautiful little spot. Our room was clean, comfortable and cozy, with a great sun room attached (if not quite heated enough for our needs). We were able to have a good breakfast there (at a small additional charge) and one of the owners drove us to the airport (also at a reasonable charge, and very helpful and convenient).

Reviews.Title: “A unique and very friendly hotel, would return without hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: An_Irishman_abroad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a long weekend in Barcelona and made the decision to stay at the Antic Espai for four nights based on the reviews here. I am glad we did. This is a charming hotel with friendly and helpful staff. From the welcome Cava to our departure, no effort was spared to make guests feel comfortable and at home. Firstly this is quite a difficult hotel to find. The taxi driver who drove us there had never heard of it and missed it first time round. The sign is discreet to say the least. The best way to find it is probably to head for the Patagonia Restaurant at 660 Gran Vía Cortes Catalanes- the door to the hotel can then easily be found. Entry is up a flight of marble stairs to the first-floor, which would possibly make the hotel unsuitable for travellers with limited mobility as there is no lift. It looks to me as if the hotel takes up a floor of an old apartment building. This is a charming hotel, ideally located with most of the main tourist attractions within easy walking distance. The owners were happy to offer assistance and local advice and would ring ahead to make reservations at restaurants as well as recommend some very good ones. Our room was a decent size and comprised a balcony, bedroom, dressing room and bathroom. Standards are very high here and the room was kept spotless. There was no "Do not disturb" sign but we never were- despite making a couple of late starts to the day. The balcony was shared with two other rooms, which may raise privacy issues for some but wasn't a problem for us as we went during low season and kept the curtains drawn when changing. The bed was just to my liking- nice and firm- and meant that I got a good night's sleep right from the start. Breakfast is ordered the night before and served on the balcony. We didn't take advantage of this as there are a number of coffee shops in the immediate area where we preferred to take breakfast. There is a safe in the reception area where guests can store valuables rather than in the room. This isn't a large chain hotel, so does not possess some of the facilities that would normally be associated with one of those- there's no bar, restaurant, health spa or swimming pool; the rooms don't have mini-bars or tea/coffee making facilities, however L'Antic Espai more than makes up for such minor shortcomings with charm. Wi-fi internet is available as is free access to a computer. I cannot imagine a major chain hotel decorated like this. There is beautiful period furniture in the rooms, collections and display cabinets all over the hotel. I noticed that the marquetry on our bed matched that on the bedside table and the wardrobe- someone has gone to a lot of trouble furnishing the rooms to their taste. There is barely a space in the whole hotel that is not taken up by a china figurine or other collectible. It could be said that the overall effect verges on kitsch, however this is no bad thing and gives the hotel a unique character. I have never stayed in a hotel quite like this and am very glad I chose L'Antic Espai. Both of us agree that we would happily stay there again. I was sad to leave Barcelona and L'Antic Espai and hope to return to both soon.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience; would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Culturalbaby
Reviews.Content: Eight of us (seniors) were at the hostal for three nights. We hated to leave our charming, intelligent hosts, Abel and Sergio, the good conversation and travel advice, the lovely antiques, cava and breakfast on the porch. Not for people who want brandname hotels, but rather for those who like the charm of boutique and personalized experiences. Centrally located; we walked everywhere with additional recommendations from our hosts. They know the city and appreciate its many offerings. We felt like we had a good picture of Catalonia Their is ample privacy despite its size.so group members can come and go as they wish, congregate in the comfortable 'parlor', or read in a quiet place. Do not be scared by the flight of stairs. Your baggage is carried for you, and safety is not an issue. Pickpockets do inhabit the Barcelona streets

Reviews.Title: “Great Hosts in a Great Space”
Reviews.Author: HaveCasesWillTravel
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hostal sets the bar very high. The interior is gorgeous; the rooms sparkle. The owners pay tremendous attention to detail. They are very friendly, very helpful. We had a complimentary welcome glass of sangria plus a complimentary bottle of water on arrival. We could get soft drinks or hot drinks or sangria at any other time for a small fee. We were able to leave our laundry and for a small fee it was cleaned and folded by the end of the day. We stayed in two different rooms. Both were of a very high standard. One opened onto a terrace where we had breakfast (a small additional fee for breakfast). The bathrooms were shiny and well equipped. There is only one small thing to be improved - sound travels easily from inside and outside the rooms. A little weatherstripping might solve this. Hostal L'Antic Espai is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place, great owners”
Reviews.Author: GillesThi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and more wonderful. Sergio and Abal are the best, best location, great collections, great breakfast, we loved every moment and fell in love with them. I can not imagine a better place to discover the soul of such a beautiful city. S&G Cape Cod Oct 31,Nov 1 and 2

Reviews.Title: “Central location & fine accommodations”
Reviews.Author: VandCWpg_
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only 1 day, but found this location well-suited for our needs, i.e. walking to Plaza Catalunya, Palau de la Musica Catalana, the magnificent fountain at park citadella, the waterfront, along the ramblas, etc. , even to Sagrada Familia. The room 103 was sufficient in size and nicely decorated with a splendid enclosed balcony sitting area. Good Bathroom facilities, but the shower was small. The stairs were a challenge with 2 suit-cases and 2 carry-ons, but someone on their way out (associated with the management?) gave us a hand. The maid brought us a small welcome pitcher of sangria. Because we don't speak more than a few words of greeting, etc. in Spanish, we did not discover until leaving the following day that the management has a tourist bus pass for use by the guests. We expect that would have been useful in, for example, getting to & from Guell park. We left early in the morning, so had only coffee brought to our room, but the breakfast offered for a reasonable price looked appealing. If we were to return to Barcelona, would give L'Antic Espai serious consideration again. For new-comers, restaurants for evening meals typically open at 8:00; grazing at tapas bars in the afternoon is a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvl_68
Reviews.Content: It was nice to be so close to everything, but also feel sheltered from the busy city. They were so helpful with recommending restaurants that the locals go to dine. Breakfast was very hearty. The place is very warm and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Different, unusal, not for eveyone but very good”
Reviews.Author: TravelPad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend for a friends surprise 40th birthday celebration. This isn’t your typical sort of hotel that you notice from walking past it in the street. I only found it by doing a search on the internet and now having stayed there, thought it was such a good choice. The owners were really attentive to all the needs of the guests. The ‘surpisee’ and his wife arrived the night before and we arrived in the morning at breakfast albeit little late. They (the owners) managed to stall the couple at the breakfast table while four of us arrived and sprung the surprise element. This worked really well and they even laid breakfast on for us even though our stay hadn’t officially started. 2 bottles of Cava were also provided to ensure the surprise and breakfast went off smoothly and in a celebratory mode. This hotel might not be for everyone, but if you’re the sort of person that enjoys something different, quirky and unusual then you will really take to this place. It definitely has a distinctive feel with its mixture of antique furniture, fixtures, fittings and interior design. The place is kept spotlessly clean and I found the place very relaxing and comfortable. There were 6 of us in our group and we occupied 3 of the rooms. There are four rooms that lead onto the main balcony and there was no one in the 4th room, so we more or less had the large dining room/balcony to ourselves. Overall, I think this is the sort of place that makes a stay memorable. The owners take great care to ensure everyone is happy and will help to book and recommend restaurants in the city if you’re unsure of where to eat. It’s also in a good location for visiting the main attractions of Barcelona. Worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very small, friendly, central, quirky”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer111
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel mainly based on reviews I read here. The entrance is unobtrusive and you walk up to the first floor. I assume there are apartments above the hotel. I did find the room, a 'superior single' very small and dark. Several rooms, including mine, opened onto a large balcony. This means that if you have your curtains/door open, other guests on the balcony can see into your room, which is a bit intrusive. If you then close the curtains for privacy, the room is very dark. If i were to go again, i would pay more for a larger room i think. Also, some one was smoking on the balcony and the smoke and stench filled my room so i had to shut the door. Something you will find here which i greatly value is: cleanliness and friendly staff. The toilet and shower were squeaky clean and the sheets were crisp and clean.This is where so many hotels (even so-called top of the range hotels) get it wrong, as nothing is more off putting than detritus from the previous guest. Comfortable bed, great pillow- where can i get one of those? I met 3 different staff members, including the Spanish maid referred to by another reviewer. All were charming,smiling and attentive. So what if the maid speaks no English; this is Spain! Many hotels give solo travellers a raw deal, and many hotels don't want one-nighters. This hotel treats everybody like family and values all guests and that is probably why it is so popular. I may only have stayed for 1 night, but i will certainly return and i have also told all my friends about it. It feels more like staying in a friend's apartment than a hotel. Agree with the other poster that the balcony is noisy, sounds like a playground nearby. There are no views off it - i personally would have preferred a window onto the street, but i now know better for next time. My only less than positive comment is that i ordered coffee for 7 am. It was half an hour late and luke warm, so you are better off going out and buying your own. The entire place, including the balcony is crammed with antique knick-knacks. It certainly is different to any place i have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler31
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The staff was kind and extremely helpful! Muhannad was awesome. The location is perfect, the room was very clean, the breakfast was special -- either on the balcony or in the sitting room. Everything was served on special china. The place has all kinds of interesting items--paintings and antiques--as an artist it was special. My room was #9 and was furnished with old antiques. The bed was very comfortable. Traveling by myself I felt very safe. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: sammy1999
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the good reviews but our experiences seemed somewhat different to most people's. I think those well regarded owners must have been away during our visit! The entrance to the hotel is dark and off putting and we were greeted by a maid who spoke no English, although English speaking staff were there later. The rooms are dark and small, although ours did have the terrace which was located next to some kind of community playground - very noisy. We had no cold water for the shower which I didn't discover until I had shampoo all over my head. At the same time the maid with no English was knocking on the door for breakfast. She has to come through the room to put the breakfast on the terrace - a bit intrusive? The evening before we left we were asked to pay which we did , although rather puzzled. When we came to leave we realised that it was because the maid was again in charge. This resulted in confusion as to whether we had paid and I had to speak to someone on a mobile phone. However, the hotel has it's good points, mainly location - which is convenient for the airport bus and is within walking distance of all the main sights. It was quiet, except for the terrace, and the bed was very comfortable. The air con was good as was the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a super location”
Reviews.Author: XtineB
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the reviews here and we were not disappointed. My husband is a bit of bull in a china closet and with all of the lovely things out in the open we thought we would certainly break something. It is filled with antiques and beautiful knic-knacs but we were extra careful with backpacks and managed not to have to pay for anything other than our hotel room. I might think twice about bring kiddos here though. We had room #6 - one of the rooms off of the terrace. Luckily it had a double bed and a single bed in the room because we found the bed to be too short for both of us to lie in it comfortably. My husband is 6'3 and I am 5'10 and my feet were almost off the end. So if you are tall, you might want to double check the size of the bed....the way this room was laid out, a longer bed would not have fit but I don't know if the beds aren't bigger in other rooms. This is really a fantastic find in Barcelona. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Standard in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandJake
Reviews.Content: I can only reiterate all the other positvie views on this hotel. Everything about is just perfect for a short break in Barcelona. Top Class service, fantastic quaint rooms, brilliant location and excellent value. Dont look any further, just book this hotel for your stay. Absolutely splendid

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: colleentaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last month and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Abel and Sergio were so helpful. It was like visiting a friend's home. The location was good. Close enough to La Ramblas to walk but far enough away to be quiet. If I am lucky enough to go back to Barcelona I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyEachSeason
Reviews.Content: The location in the Eixample was fantastic, and was walking distance to everything. In hindsight, a hotel on Las Ramblas would have probably served us better since we found ourselves walking up the Ramblas more frequently than Eixample, but the Eixample would be our second pick. Abel and the staff were amazing. Very attentive, very helpful, and very much interested in antiques! The hotel and the rooms are decorated very nicely in antiques. The rooms are smallish (the shower is pretty tiny, but has good water pressure), ours had a very nice balcony where we had breakfast each morning. They have a DVD player in each room and a selection of movies. Breakfast is quite nice and Abel takes care to customize it as much as possible to the tastes of each guest. A minor con: You can hear the rumble of the metros, since the hotel is very close to the metro station. This did not bother us, however, but might bother a very light sleeper. I think the hotel is good value in Barcelona and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal L'Antic Espai was such a comfortable hotel, with Excellent Hosts!”
Reviews.Author: spinalarchitect
Reviews.Content: The hosts Abel and Sergio (and all the hotel staff) were very friendly, extremely polite, and always helpful with any question you might have about your trip and Barcelona. The beds and pillows were high quality, so comfortable, and as good as my own at home which is the best I could get in Toronto. Computers, plus free wireless internet are available which is very handy. My single room had more than enough space, had beautiful and pleasant decor, was always thoroughly cleaned each day. The bathroom was very clean, and appeared newly renovated. The BEST part was that my room was very very quiet. This is important to me because I am a light sleeper. Service was incredible. I had breakfast most days I was there over the week stay, and it was very good quality. Nice assortment of tasty things to eat, and drink. I highly recommend breakfast to start the day off. My trip to Barcelona was amazing, and L'Antic Espai was a big part of that because it was so comfortable, and made you feel relaxed. You will not be disappointed if you choose to stay at L'Antic Espai. You also can't beat the location. I walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A case of small being beautiful........”
Reviews.Author: JNewland
Reviews.Content: There is no point repeating what has previously been reported. Suffice to say that it is all true. For Barcelona you need to look no further than Hostal L'Antic Espai. Yes, it's small but if you want a square box in a 100 bedroom hotel that's up to you. But, believe me you'll regret it. Everything from bone china tea services, to location, to cleanliness, to superb hosts, to original decor, to antiquities. This hotel has the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beuatiful room”
Reviews.Author: MTPDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ten days and were very happy with this charming little hotel. It has great location - you can walk almost anywhere in the city - we only used the metro twice in ten days. The neighbourhood, Eixample, is packed with nice restaurants and cafées, and you don't have to travel far when dinner is over, to get to your bed :-) Our room, 102, was very nice with a private balcony and beautiful furniture. You can regulate the temperature on the aircondition and there is a small TV and DVD player, and lots of film that you can lend free of charge - nice touch! The staff was very friendly and helpful and served an excellent breakfast, especially the coffee was great! The bed was better than our own, and at night it was nice and quiet. All in all, we really loved L'Antic Espai and will stay here again if (when) we return to the wonderful city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Small, highly individual hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chjames1
Reviews.Content: I certainly recommend Hostal l'Antic Espai. It is small, charmingly decorated with friendly service and is in a great location - I was able to enjoy a walk around most of the city attractions from the hotel. My single room was small and comfortable rather than luxurious. It was like staying in a friend's apartment and makes a great contrast to the large, somewhat impersonal usual city hotel. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with grace and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Diane003
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for 2 nights in September. Even though our requirements were complicated, booking was completed in accordance with our requests and were correct upon our arrival. The hotel is a first floor walkup; charming and filled with antiques. Each room is unique. We immediately felt very much at home. Staff were friendly and gracious. The breakfast is optional and cost about 8 Euros, and we would highly recommend it. It is plentiful and of high quality, with an assortment of yogurts, breads, pastries, cheese, fresh fruit, beverages, etc. Our table was beautifully appointed. If you can, have it served on the terrace! We would highly recommend this hotel, especially to adult travellers, whether on business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation with lots of character run by warm, welcoming owner and staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonKayteeDee
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in this hotel which was very clean, perfectly comfortable and conveniently located; the rooms have lots of character and style which for me ranks it much higher than the usual run of the mill decor of chain hotels. The owner and staff are clearly very hard working, personable and dedicated; this was a suprise trip for our friends 40th birthday and was made extra special by the attentive, warm and very accomodating manner of Abel, Sergio and Axel. From our room we also had access to a lovely terrace area, beautifully lit, adorned with plants and a number of ornate features, where we had breakfast and spent time in the evening. Attention to detail and genuinely lovely staff made our stay in the Hostal L'Antic Espai a particularly memorable one. Many thanks to them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: patzeric
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The decoration was, quite frankly, not to my taste, but that is a personal matter. If you like antiques you will love it. The room we had (101) was fairly small by US standards, but not inconveniently so. The room was well appointed, however. The location of the hotel can not be beaten. Although it was located on a main street, and our room faced the road, noise was not a problem; the windows did an excellent job of filtering out the road noise. The hotel is situated in the southern part of the Eixample district, which is an extremely nice area with shopping, restaurants, etc. The Barri Gotic (the old city) starts a mere two blocks or so to the south. Three Gaudi buildings are within seven or eight blocks. The location really could not be better. No breakfast was included with our room, but you can get an excellent breakfast for 8 euros each. The hosts are very nice and can give advice on places to eat, etc. They also have a car service to the airport which costs the same as a taxi but is much more pleasant. Overall, this is a great small hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenYF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hostal L'Antic Espai in August of 2009. We travelled all around Europe and this was by far the most fabulous accomadations we stayed at all trip! Hostal L'Antic Espai is absolutely gorgoeus, it is bursting with Spanish culture and is decorated immaculately with treasures from around the world. The rooms are spotless, rich in design, and luxuriously comfortable. I was so impressed with the obvious attention to every detail. I didn't even want to leave the hostal, I could have just spent my whole vacation there and been perfectly happy. The owners and staff are completely delightful, they were so helpful and went out of their way to ensure we had the best stay possible. The location is perfect, close to shopping, beaches, restaurants and all the major tourist attractions. You would never guess this very affordable hostal isn't a Five Star Hotel! We were so lucky to have been able to stay there and will definitely be returning to Barcelona and Hostal L'Antic Espai, it is simply too wonderful not to return!

Reviews.Title: “Made our Barcelona Trip. Full Stop.”
Reviews.Author: snack00
Reviews.Content: Better late than never to recommend this absolutely perfect find. I can't add anything that the other reviewers haven't already raved about --just know that we agree. Abel, Sergio and the staff are extremely attentive but never intrusive. The little things make such a difference. We stayed in Room 102, which is definitely the best room. It has an adjacent sitting room which overlooks the main street. If you can, request this room! That said, there are perhaps quieter rooms - the street is busy - but it's worth it. My wife and I agree... this hotel really made our trip...Stay here and you won't be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “It blew me away...”
Reviews.Author: Tosuke
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for 3 nights and called directly looking for a "Hostal". I had Mr. Alban on the phone and he offered me a discount price which made me think: "it'll be a simple small room with a small little window to the air-shaft, like most of the cheap hostals in Barcelona. I hope it's clean and the air conditioning is working. When I arrived and I saw the incredible care and love that these guys have put into the decoration it blew me away. But not only the outside is great, and very special, also the service and the condition of the bathrooms, the way you are taken care of and the "specialness" of just everything is unique. Even the collection of DVDs that are available have a special class. I started out with a bigger room that leads to a charming littel Patio where my breakfeast was served while I sat under exotic plants listening to the chatter of a few birds in old fashioned cages. But also the "small" single room was more then OK. The window/door led to an air-shaft.. true. But the owner made an effort to decorate even this small space in way to feel good. A green grass mat and antique lamps make you feel "special" even in an air-shaft. The air conditioning is quiet and effective. But most important is the amiable service that the "friends" there offer. Go and check it out. And stay away if you are a "Interconti" or "Hilton" kind of person. And leave this little gem to us, the "connoisseurs" Thank you guys for putting all this effort in your place to make us feel "special" Wolfgang Wimmer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night with my two daughters post a cruise. We love Hostal L'antic and Barcelona as our stay was much too short. We love staying in smaller, interesting hotels and L'antic does not disappoint. We had room 104 which sleeps 3 comfortably. It is nicely furnished with antiques and very clean. We met with Sergio, Abel and Axel who were extremely helpful. They take a lot of pride and joy in their hotel and helping their guests. With such a short time we took their advice on where to eat and what to see. We were not disappointed. Abel and Sergio's taste is impeccable. We had to leave early to go to the airport and had a nice quiet breakfast on their terrace and booked Abel to take us to the airport for a very reasonable price. It was a easy walk every where. The girls loved Las Ramblas and the exciting activity there. We will definitely come back to Barcelona and Hostal L'Antic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Isisisourcat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our two day stay. The hosts are most helpful and run a delightful antique styled hotel. We particularly enjoyed the beautifully presented breakfast on the patio. The location is but a short walk from the Ramblas. The maid kept the place quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “clean, convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: spezzer
Reviews.Content: Located just a short 5 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya, this quaint hotel offered good value and great service. The only complaint I have is that the shower is relatively small. In terms of finding a reliable, clean, reasonably-valued hotel, L'Antic Espai met all the criteria and more. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: YYZ444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in Barcelona in August and L'Antic Espai was the perfect homebase for our travels. We stayed in room 107 which had a bedroom and smallish sitting room with the most beautiful wardrobe I've ever seen. All the furniture is antique and while I enjoyed it thoroughly, it might not be to everyone's taste. Whether you like the style or not, it is certainly interesting and a nice change from the sterility of regular hotels. The rooms are small compared to North American standards but there was enough room to move around in and suited us perfectly. The room opens up to a terrace that you share with three other rooms where you can have breakfast if you so choose. The maid was kind enough to let us have a peak at the other rooms and they all looked just as lovely, unique and interesting. The two men who run the Hostal could not have been more helpful. I truly feel our trip was as fun as it was because of their recommendations. Everywhere they suggested we go was wonderful and gave us a sense of seeing more of Barcelona than just the tourist attractions. We loved it and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: brad016
Reviews.Content: Sergio and Abel are wonderful hosts at this relatively inexpensive little urban b&b, brim-full of character (and antiques), multi-lingual staff, free WiFi. Room 106 was small but practical, with a door onto the terrace, where they serve a delightful breakfast for a reasonable additional charge. All the guests are like family. 2 blocks from subway, quick walk to La Rambla. Not a lot of soundproofing, but who sleeps in Barcelona?

Reviews.Title: “an awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: gloria0
Reviews.Content: Sergio & partner made you feel like part of the family from the moment we arrived until the day we left.The hotel is deceiving from the outside but once you enter the hotel it like part ofthe heritage of the city.The rooms are all done in very unique decor.The terrace is beautiful you can have breakfast there if you like,we did and it was awesome. We sat outside in the evenings and that was peaceful.Sergio was very helpful in giving us recommendations on dining and making reservations for all of us.The recommendations were awesome.They have done as awesome job with there hotel If we are to go back to Barcelona we definitely will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: Bruno74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional for several reasons. Firstly, when you find a cheap hotel, you might not be surprised to find that it's a bit ropey or that it has seen better days. Not so the Antic Espai. It's really centrally situated. I stayed for three nights in room 109. This is a single room, quite small but perfect for a solo traveler. There wasn't much natural light, but that's probably not a bad thing as it keeps the room cool (I didn't need to turn on the air conditioning). Like all the rooms, it was full of charming and rather kitsch antiques. The en-suite bathroom with sink, shower and toilet was clean and functional. The flat screen TV with DVD player was great: I used it to play some music CDs. The staff explained that they have a supply of DVDs which guests can borrow. I was also amazed to see a room service menu, offering drinks of all kinds. I was a bit worried about having to ring the bell every time I wanted to get in, especially when I came back late. But the night staff were charming and discreet. These are the same people who serve breakfast in the mornings. For 8 euros, breakfast was plentiful. One day I had it on the terrace in the company of some pretty birds in cages. The other two mornings I was in the salon area. I read that somebody complained about noise from the kitchen. I was right next to this little kitchen/work area and I wasn't at all bothered by noise. The most striking thing about the hotel was the staff. They were attentive, polite and went out of their way to make my stay a success. I didn't catch all of their names, but Mohanet (I hope I spelt his name right) stands out for his smiling and helpful attitude. He was charming, and really made me feel at ease, which is important for single travelers, especially for those who don't speak the language. In my guide book (Time Out), the Antic Espai is listed as a budget hotel. One or two of the more dissatisfied reviewers on here should maybe bear that in mind: you can't expect a five-star experience in a hotel like this. The Antic Espai does what it does perfectly. I for one was really pleased to stay there. I have already recommended this hotel to two friends and will do so every time someone I know is visiting Barcelona. Hope I can go back one day. Bruno Auer, Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fab”
Reviews.Author: Sooz99
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this amazing Hostal. I was in room 109 which is a single room and yes, it can appear dark, but there is a window in the room which throws some light in. I have stayed in Hotels which are so bland you could be anywhere in the world, but not here. The antiques are beautiful, even down to the crockery. When we arrived, the owners were away, but we were looked after by the team, who made us very welcome. The next day the owners, Abel & Sergio arrived back and straight away made sure that we had been looked after in their absence. These guys enjoy meeting people, they seem to love their work and their Hostal. Their first day back and fresh flower arrangements adorned the communal areas. It’s touches like these that make all the difference. As an early riser, (unlike my friend I was travelling with), I was served coffee each morning on the terrace. This was a time when I had the area to myself and the owners have made this a tranquil place to be. They have 3 cages with a few small birds, a small fountain and many plants. In a busy city they have managed to provide a small tranquil haven. Everyone of the Hotel team gave us advice and directions and nothing was ever too much trouble - a big thank you to Axel who tried very hard to help (non-map readers) with directions to the best restaurants. Our stay was brief and although we managed to visit a few of the places on our list, we added several more, giving us good reason to return to this wonderful city. We will definitely be returning to the Hostal L’Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven after a hectic day in the beautiful Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCanada21
Reviews.Content: When you get to the hostal, you receive a warm welcome: all the employees want you to feel at home and are very helpful. The pictures that you see on the Antic Espai website are representative; I had the chance to see 4 rooms that are all different in style and very comfortable. I recommand the ones that open on the garden so you can enjoy a very good breakfast there. The location is great:: it is close to Plaça Catalunya and the Ramblas where you want to be at night; also nearby many outdoor cafés to eat exquisite tapas. I hope to return to Barcelona and I will definitely want to stay at the Antic Espai where I feel I have made new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Kind and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NowVoyager63
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at L'Antic Espai. I took the train from Toulouse and got off at the Passeig de Gracia station. The walk to this hotel was about three blocks. It is right in the middle of many things you'll want to see, on foot or by Metro. The staff members were always available for questions about tickets, how to get somewhere, where to eat, etc...Throughout my stay every time I met one of the hosts as I was coming and going each one asked if I was enjoying Barcelona. The rooms are very clean and entire place is always spotless. I thought is was a very good value and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: RalphMack
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in 2 different rooms, 110 and 107. Both great value and spotlessly clean. You cant compare Hostal L'antic Espai to other hotels in this price bracket because for 120 euros night you get 5 star service with the laid back feel of a guest house! The maid was friendly and understoof my spanish most of the time and the owners Sergio and Abel were accomodating and helped book the most wonderful meal in a nearby resturant. Muchos Gracias Segio y Abel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully quaint”
Reviews.Author: AggiUggi
Reviews.Content: Ground level entrance and bedding left it on the shabby side of shabby chic Great location, very welcoming, even offered the loan of a laptop in my room when I arrived. Recommended Just about 3 stars

Reviews.Title: “Wow great little hotel with wonderful breakfast on the terrace”
Reviews.Author: tezakiama
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful two days here, close to everything, breakfasts were lovely sitting on there terrace, met some wonderful travellers here and the staff were extraordinary, went out of their way to help. Nice touches with all the antiques.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: weiroff
Reviews.Content: We came across the L'Antic Espai on TripAdvisor and decided to book it up for our 10th anniversary, we weren't disappointed. The hotel is charming and comfortable, and we would recommend it to anyone that wants something a little different from the larger hotel chains. We had read about the couple who run the hotel, and were very much looking forward to experiencing their hospitality, but unfortunately they were on holiday during our trip. Luckily for us, they had a guy (Axel) covering who was very helpful, and really went out of his way to recommend local restaurants and bars. Nothing was too big an ask, and to get this kind of help in an unfamiliar city is invaluable. Our room was beautifully and tastefully decorated, and stepped out into a communal terrace where we had breakfast on a couple of mornings. The only thing I'd say against this wonderful place, is that, while romantic, it doesn't feel hugely private. The communal areas were certainly welcome, but sometimes it felt a little awkward stepping outside with others right outside your door. Small thing, and it certainly didn't affect our enjoyment of the place. The location was perfect, we walked to Sagrada Familia in less than 20mins, and the touristy areas were 5mins walk away. There is also a tube station 2mins away. We had a fabulous trip, partly due to our friends at L'Antic Espai, and would whole heartedly recommend it. We'll be back some day soon!

Reviews.Title: “underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: gdrvasc
Reviews.Content: Surprised after the 5 star reviews. Three of us in the room (one child)....very crowded with the suitcases, little spare space. Most disturbed by the noise in room 104, right next to the kitchen....not much peace or quiet early in AM. Staff, on the other hand, very welcoming and helpful, do their best to make the stay pleasant. For example, they have a laptop to loan free of charge if needed, recently upgraded wireless capability. I think had we not had our young child and were just 2 to a room (we did book for 3, so this was not a surprise to the staff), were not next to the kitchen, our impression might have been somewhat different.

Reviews.Title: “Cute B&B-Like Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cycledallas
Reviews.Content: If you want a unique experience and you're in good shape to climb 4 flights of stairs with luggage, you need to try this hotel. Don't be intimidated by heavy wooden doors and buzzer you need to push to announce your arrival. This building also contains private apartments. Just say you're a guest and they will buzz you in. The rooms are small but they provide free use of internet and good service. After our transatlantic flight we were tired and asked for breakfast at 8:30. When we awoke at 12:30pm they had breakfast still waiting for us in a cute room filled with antiques and china plates. It's on Gran Via and within a few blocks of the Las Ramblas area and a Hop A Bus stop that can take you to all the sights you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this friendly, 'victorian' style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Philippak
Reviews.Content: This hostel was a wonderful place to stay for 4 nights in Barcelona. We walked to most places from the hotel. Sergio and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. They made us feel this place was home. They helped us with directions and sightseeing. It was wonderful to find CD's and books to borrow. Although our room overlooked the main street, it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: donnabada
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice on my recent Europe trip. It was a great value, the service was wonderful and I received some good suggestions about places to eat and drink. i would stay here again when I'm in town. Since i was a single, my room was small with a single bed.

Reviews.Title: “characterful and individual hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shula13
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in room 102, which has the benefit of an enclosed balcony which is not only a charming place to relax and read in the morning but also helps to insulate the room itself from traffic noise. Fresh flowers were placed on the balcony table on the evening of our arrival, which was a really nice touch. The aircon was effective and very welcome as the city was very hot. The location is good, very near the metro station and not too far to walk to many parts of the city. We felt very safe in the neighbourhood. We found our hosts to be very friendly; we are quite self contained and didn't need much help or information but we had the sense that they would have been very willing to give us their time and advice if we asked for it. They clearly have a lot of pride in their establishment, which was spotlessly clean with a considerable collection of china and antiques. Breakfast was very charmingly served and made a change from the now near ubiquitous buffet. Everyone was very eager to please, including the maid who offered glasses of cold water when we arrived rather hot and bothered. Overall, what I liked about this place is that it is not in any sense corporate, but a reflection of the proprietors' individual taste and personality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Txbella
Reviews.Content: I have to echo the many positive reviews. Sergio, Abel and the staff were all friendly and helpful always willing to give suggestions. The location is great, near 2 metro stops and easy walking distance to Plaza Catalunya, dining, shopping and many tourist sites. A couple of reviews mention the decor has somewhat of a museum quality or that of a rich relative you are staying with. This is true, the antiques are beautiful and there is quite a bit of attention to detail which makes this a special place and they are able to balance that with a level of comfort. It's not only the decor that earns them high marks but the little things they offer above and beyond such as a laptop to check email that guests can use in their room and a collection of dvds to borrow. As mentioned some other reviews the maid is there from 10-4 however you can check in at 2 and if you get there before it's ready you can leave your luggage with her and leave your valuables in the safe so I did not find this to be a problem. I will definitely return and have already recommended L'Antic Espai to some friends that will be in Barcelona later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this charming hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Lindabelle
Reviews.Content: Husband and two friends (70+) descended (or better, ascended)on Hostel L'Antic Espai in May, 2009. Daunted at first by the stairs to floor one and the hostel, we we're readily taken by the charm of the place and its wonderful proprietors, Abel and Sergio. We had no regrets. Our rooms/baths were spotless, spacious and decorated beautifully. Breakfast , served on the patio outside our room, was plentiful and tasty (oh, the fresh orange juice!). Location was convenient to the Ramblas, the old city center, and fine restaurants. Depending on how old we are when we again return to Barcelona, we'll definitely return to this special hostel.

Reviews.Title: “If a window is important to you . . .”
Reviews.Author: Samcat1
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with such high expectations given the pages and pages of sterling reviews in Trip Advisor so was really crushed to find my room had no window. If natural sunlight is important to you, before booking a room in this hotel, confirm that your room has a window. I was aghast (and in tears) to find myself in a room that was totally dark save electric lights. The man at the desk said that before booking either of the interior rooms, the person doing the booking notifies the prospective guest that these rooms are interior (there's no way to tell on the internet pictures that 109 and 110 are windowless). Staff and I agreed (I had our e-mail correspondence with me) that somehow that information was overlooked with my booking. In previous travels before booking a room, I've asked what my room overlooked but it never entered my mind that a hotel room would have no window at all. Had I known, I would never have booked this room; I would have gladly paid more for another room in this hotel or looked elsewhere. This is not a money issue. While this is my first visit to Spain, I've traveled extensively in Europe, paid 60E and stayed in small rooms that had one window. When I travel I walk everywhere and at midday I enjoy coming back to my hotel to rest and read. I did not do this in Barcelona, as it was difficult to find comfort in a room that was forever black. I want to be fair: the men at the front desk (Axel and Sergio were on vacation) were friendly and helpful when I needed directions and they made reservations at a lovely restaurant for me the first night. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of hot water. The place was clean. I loved the thick terry robe. I saw other rooms in the hotel that had windows, those facing Grand Via and the patio, and no question about it, they were delightful. The architecture is intriguing and the decorations pleasantly quirky. I'm recommending the hotel for all the reasons I cited above. It's difficult for me to rate the service more than average because if the omission in the booking process -- a waterfall effect. I understand that for some a window is not important. For me it is, and I was very disappointed with my accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality defined”
Reviews.Author: LearningCurv
Reviews.Content: From questions during booking to getting to the airport when we left the staff at Hostal L'Antic Espai pay quite special attention to guests. Axel in particular was a host and a concierge during our visit and we really appreciated it. He listens, he ask questions, he shares his experiences about Barcelona when he makes recommendations and he very clearly has a joy for this city that makes him a resource and a genuine warm spirit. That made us feel welcome when returning home to the Hostal each day. His recommendations for things to see were very useful including a hidden Salvador Dali museum in town and also a trip to Figueres (Dali's birthplace and the site of a museum he built to house many of his large and impressive works). Axel helped make a great trip, even better. So, a few words on the Hostal: it lives up to it's reputations - the location is quite good - and it's deserved ranking here on Tripadvisor. The maid service is also terrific. The room was always cleaned and aired when we returned. There are some points worth noting. I mention these as useful notes and not as complaints. The beds in our room were quite small. I'm 6'2" and I did sleep at a diagonal. Not a big deal. I did not ask the staff to address this minor issue, but if you are my height or larger, you might make note of this particularly with room 104. The bed was comfortable, I slept as well or better than on other trips. The birds out on the patio are sweet. Their quiet peeps made for a soothing sound to fall asleep. Our bathroom had a small shower. Quite small. I get the sense that a large bathtub is not a priority for most who would stay at the Espai. One last comment - several of the rooms are on the patio and as such they share a large glass wall with the patio. If you are particularly bashful keep that in mind with your room request. Their are large heavy curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, personal, and offbeat”
Reviews.Author: RosalindNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. It's perfectly located, right on a main street, but not noisy or overcrowded. The decor is quaint and unusual with beautiful architecture and nice details. The patio, shared by three of the rooms, has pretty birds and nice tables for breakfast. But the real highlight was Axel at the desk. Young, charismatic, and super-informed, he gave us terrific recommendations for restaurants, bars, and things to do in the neighborhood (which has some great nightlife right within walking distance and is very safe late at night). He gave us a personal computer to use in our room, helped us use the hotel's extensive video collection, and was always smiling and so on top of everything. Every night we returned, it was as though we were coming back to our old friend in Barcelona. If you're looking for a big sleek hotel with a bunch of amenities, it's probably not for you. But it's a personal, unique and very clean and reliable little hideaway in the middle of the city. It's also one of the best experiences with hotel staff I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT! IDEAL CHOICE, A REAL FIND, GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: lifestooshort4
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend here with my friend and we loved the L'Antic Espai! The rooms are beautifully decorated down to every last detail, as well as spotlessly clean. We stayed one night in Room 103 which was a beautiful twin with a small 'stand-on' balcony overlooking the Gran Via. Windows are well soundproofed. On the second night, we had tiny but pretty single rooms 109 & 110, both together for the same price as the twin which was very fair. We didn't have breakfast there but were shown the balcony for next time, a peaceful antiquey Moroccan-type hideaway at the back of the building. The service was excellent, good communication both prior to and during our stay - though the only staff during the day is the maid who only speaks Spanish. We got by fine understanding the only way to get in to the building at any time is by ringing the buzzer from the Street - don't take you key with you. Axel and Muhannad were very helpful and polite hosts, they can be contacted via Carla at any time of the day should you need assistance. They will also store any valuables in their main safe. The location is spot-on, it is just of the Placa Cataluyna from where you can catch the Metro and the Airbus (4,25 Euros from or to the Airport, runs every 7 mins, don't waste your money on a taxi to the airport). It is walkable to everywhere including the Gaudi houses (eg Casa Mila) just a few blocks away. We also walked to the Sagrada Familia from the hotel.
