For shoppers, there is a large Zara just on the corner of the main road back towards Placa Cataluyna and Corte Ingles dept store, Sfera, H&M and the main shopping street all just minutes away. If you are looking for some real character, this is a small and charming residence at half of the price of the large hotels. We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jeanetteDublin
Reviews.Content: You would walk by the Hotel L'antic Espai if you were't looking for it and maybe even if you were. An unassuming, attractive, large wooden door leads you up the stairs to a beautiful boutique hotel. The staff were polite, friendly, professional and always available for directions, recomendations or a general chat. The service was also excellent, no request was too much bother. The rooms were fabulous, full of charming antiques and attentuion paid to every detail. I would recommend a room with access to the roof terrace. Location was ideal, everything was within walking distance and felt safe. Tea and breakfast were served in fabulous china crockery, couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Time Period Hotel Still Alive In 2009”
Reviews.Author: RetiredMarriedCouple
Reviews.Content: We cannot praise this Hotel enough. The location is ideal for shopping and sightseeing. The interior rooms / hallways / salons etc. are beautifully decorated. The staff (all of them, daytime and nightime staff) are extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast, we were speechless, beautifully presented, delicious and plentiful. We are moving to Spain within the year and we will definitely be regulars at Hostal L'Antic Espai when we visit Barcelona. Kindest regards, G and L

Reviews.Title: “offbeat but nice”
Reviews.Author: sospelsiri
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay is this lovely and unusual little hotel. Abel and Sergio have a passion for antiques which is reflected in every inch of the place. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Thre breakfast was very good and beautifully presented, especially nice in the pretty little courtyard area. Abel and Sergio were very charming hosts and gave us a lot of good suggestions with regard to places to visit and things to do. The location is very convenient and reletively easy to find. If or rather when I return to Barcelona I will certainly try and go there again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel with nearly everything going for it”
Reviews.Author: yrstruly
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for four nights on a trip with my mother. we each got a single room as that was all that was available at the time. the price was great given the "last minute deal" the hotel was having. we had one room on the terrace and one not. i do not think it is worth spending the extra money for a terrace room. the location of the hotel is great - only a couple of blocks from placa de catalunya and the folks working there are very helpful. only problem was that there is no staff there during the day. so if anything comes up or if you want to check in between 10 - 4, there could be some problems. that's why i gave service 3 stars. other than that, great value and great little place.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Oz98
Reviews.Content: Central location, clean, quiet, everything worked as it shoud and very good and friendly service. Couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hostal and great location”
Reviews.Author: Amatista10
Reviews.Content: The hostal is located a few blocks away from Catalunya plaza, which has the most central metro station in Barcelona. Our room was very clean, gorgeous and beautifully decorated with antiques. It also had a balcony with a view of La Gran Via. We didn't have any noise at all. The balcony has windows and the room had a french door with thick windows. Sergio and his receptionist Axel were very nice and helpful. Sergio served us the most exquisite breakfast at the terrace. We also had breakfast in the balcony of our room. The price was very reasonable for what it offers. I highly recommend this hostal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay with exellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ann1Oslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice "home" for five days from 15 - 20 april, and it was very nice. Abel and Sergio do everything to make you feel good. Everything you ask for to drink, they bring it to your room on a beatiful tray, with even more beatiful glases, very nice. And cant forget Axel, who serve us into the room at night, with elegance and a touch of humor, we can like that. It situated very close to everything, so you can walk to most of the attraction in Barcelona! Very clean and nice room, the stuff who clean the room did a very good job. We want to come back soon! Thanks to all the stuff who make this as a very plesant stay. Thanks for the glass of Cava we got Abel, very nice of you, but we are very sorry for broke one of them. Ann and Jens, Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: arjan17
Reviews.Content: We got a great value for our stay. The room was spotless and had a great balcony. The breakfast was the best we had through our travel. The staff was incredibly nice, friendly helpful and attentive. The location was also convenient; only a short walk from Plaza Catalunya. The experience was a refreshing break from the impersonal larger hotels. Highly recommend staying at L'Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Beware of breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: pmmacken
Reviews.Content: Great location. Helpful Staff. Clean rooms. Only gripe is to beware of breakfast as it is not included.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, so cute, so helpful, great location, EVERYTHING WAS GREAT”
Reviews.Author: dreabobea
Reviews.Content: This place was GREAT! I had an incredibly affordable room, fast WIFI, very helpful staff (young and hip, had great recommendations), and was in a perfect location. A 5 minute walk to the touristy Las Ramblas, and an even shorter walk to the metro stop. My room was small, but very cozy and comfortable. I really loved this hotel and would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nsiegel922
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at L’Antic during our visit to Barcelona earlier this month. To say that we were impressed was an understatement. The hotel was full of character and charm as well as plentiful amenities such as a dvd’s, travel books, hair dryers and internet. As there are only a handful of available rooms (each uniquely designed), the hotel has a “bed and breakfast” type of feel , making for a very personable experience. There is even a hotel dog! Moreno - so adorable! The friendly and warm staff, including Muhannad and Axel, did everything in their power to ensure that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. They gave us some fantastic local restaurant options such as Txapela and Danzarama which are only blocks away from the hotel. The location was absolutely perfect – centrally located and close to all major attractions and public transportation. Can’t wait to return to Barcelona and stay at L’Antic again!

Reviews.Title: “A special little treasure”
Reviews.Author: travelsaround_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 12 wonderful nights here on our first visit to Barcelona. I agree with the other extremely positive reviews I read before I came; they are true. It is a little gem of a place filled with antiques and recently updated bathrooms. Who could ask for anything more? The hotel is exceptionally lovely, comfortable, well situated, clean and safe. The care Segio and Abel have taken with the decor is suprassed only by the care they bestow on their guests. They are extremely helpful with any questions you may have. Be sure to ask for restaurant suggestions. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Memorable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kefalo
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a memorable, authentic and genuine experience in Barcelona? If so, L’Antic Espai is definitely your top choice. I stayed in a hotel for 7 days in April 2009. From the very beginning and reservation process, owners Abel and Sergio made me feel like I was at home. Prompt and clear correspondence, flexible scheduling, accurate information about (perfect) location. Upon arrival, I came to realize that this was just a beginning. Hotel interior is very unique, filled with valuable pieces of antic furniture and decoration, rooms are clean, breakfast delicious and sufficient to hold you for the entire day of sightseeing. Precious little things such as travel guides and books about Barcelona, a collection of DVD and lap-top computer with a wireless internet that are available at no cost for each guest, made my stay cozy and comfortable. Last but not least, Abel’s and Sergio’s hospitability and attention to details (fresh flowers every morning), their knowledge about hot spots and special deals for hotel’s guests (unforgettable dinner at two-star Michelin restaurant for 20 euros!!!) and authentic Barcelona experience (flamenco evening with the best table in house), made my stay memorable. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: MiddleagedCouple34
Reviews.Content: We desired a small hotel with some atmosphere and a helpful staff. We received more than we bargained for. The halls and rooms are filled with interesting antique objects. The owners are concerned with you being happy and go out of their way to do anything for you. We ended up spending time talking with them instead of going out and seeing things. Their recommendations were excellent. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was good and safe at night. The breakfast was excellent and we met and sat with other fellow travellors thus making friends. The owners could not have been more friendly and helpful! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Traveler197205
Reviews.Content: Just finished a very relaxing 4 night stay at this beautiful hotel. The hotel is immaculate. The service is fantastic and they gave great advice on where to go and local amenities. I can't comliment the service and hospitality enough. Truly perfect. It has a great location with excellent links to metro service, trains and the airport. I'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming little hostal”
Reviews.Author: jeanaltair
Reviews.Content: Pretty, tidy rooms and a very friendly service. Warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience in a perfect environment”
Reviews.Author: Screwcork
Reviews.Content: Based on the excellent reviews on this site 3 Norwegian couples booked 3 rooms for 3 nights. There are not many superlatives to add to those already given. They are all true! We had a great stay with top service and great breakfasts - and the restaurants recommended were all great. We'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Mother and daughter mini-break”
Reviews.Author: Katura09
Reviews.Content: Booked L'Antic Espai as a surprise for my daughter's 18th birthday having read excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. It met all our expectations and more! The attention to detail in all the furniture and fittings are amazing, we felt as though we had stepped back in time into the real Spain of our forbears. This was added to by the wonderful welcome from Sergio and Abel who couldn't have been more helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfasts are such a treat, absolutely charming and quaint. Sergio and Abel recommended restaurants for us within walking distance all were excellent. The location of the L'antic Espai is perfect for getting everywhere in Barcelona. It is a fabulous city with loads to see and do. We definitely want to go back to L'antic Espai it feels more like staying with friends than staying in a hotel - wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service - charming - quaint - it does not get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: NIfolk
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Barcelona at the end of a trip to France, and initially tried to book a luxury hotel, but found that most of the big hotels could not accommodate two adults and a 7-year-old in a single room (3 of them suggested that we needed to book two rooms - at 300 euro per room per night this was never going to happen!). However, this turned out to be a blessing in disguise, as it allowed us to find L'Antic Espai (via tripadvisor). I am always drawn to quirky hotels (not the main chains) and if they are family-owned, so much the better. Every experience with L'Antic has been top drawer. This included the initial communications (replies to m y emails within minutes, and I had the booking done within an hour of first coming across the hotel). On arrival, Sergio greeted us and gave us a helping hand to bring our bulky luggage upstairs. We were quickly shown to our lovely room (105, a double and single bed - large hotels take note - it can be done) which looked on to the gorgeous terrace. Abel gave us helpful instructions on returning our hire car to Sants rail station. From the moment you arrive, you are aware of the quality of the furnishing and the decor. What was particularly pleasing for me was that the owners never showed any concern about the fact that our child (a 7 year old) could potentially damage their valuable furnishings, crockery etc. (believe me the hotel is simply overflowing with wonderful things), they seemed genuinely pleased that we were staying with them, and indeed were very patient and caring with our little boy. They were not to know that our son is quite mature and very careful for his age, but I know that the staff of many other hotels can make parents feel quite uneasy in these situations. We were asked if we wanted to take breakfast (7 euro per person), and we decided ( I am pleased to say) to aval of this. The breakfast was set up on the terrace bang on time each morning at the prearranged time (unlike us!), and to have a wondeful breakfast (fruit juice, fresh fruit, yoghurt and muesli, toast, divine jams, croissant with cheese and ham, cakes, fresh coffee) all served in quality china, on a terrace surrounded by greenery, and to the backdrop of the gentle tinkle from a little fountain, is my idea of how to start a day. If you can get his for 7 euros anywhere else, let me know. (Forgot to mention that they also served up lovely hot chocolate for our son). On another evening, Axel (hope I spelt this right) the charming Argentinian night porter, was good enough to set up wine in a chiller (again with two lovely wine glasses) on the terrace. The beds are extremely comfortable, and the bathroom very clean, hot shower and nice clean soft towels - oh, and lovely fluffy dressing gowns. The original tiles and lovely light fittings all add to the experience. The guys recommended a number of restaurants but we were only able to use one (the Patagonia Restaurant directly below the hotel). This is not owned by the hotel and is entirely independant, but I can wholeheartedly recommend it. It was quite busy on a Tuesday night, with many Spanish business people there. Do yourself a favour and order the steak (it is shipped in directly from Argentina), and the crepes / toffee combination for dessert is delicious too. The hotel does have an arrangment that allows you to prepay and order from a pre-set menu at well discounted rates from the Patagonia, and It is excellent value. If you have an early start ot make the next day, it is also extremely convenient, but in no way compromises quality! The guys sorted us out with a taxi for our departure (again, right on time), as well as a very early breakfast, once again on the terrace - at 7.30! By this stage you realise that we loved our stay at the 'Espai', and we are counting the days to our inevitable return. Thank you, thank you for making our trip to Barcelona so memorable, thanks mainly to your kindness, and your incredible attention to detail!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TCARBONNEL
Reviews.Content: A good choice for turism purpose : - well located in the city - clean and very well decorated rooms - rich breakfast - welcoming tender who explains all what you need to know! - including free wireless connection

Reviews.Title: “'Practically perfect in every way'”
Reviews.Author: EvaManchester
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in this 'gem' of a hotel. We found it to be comfortable, elegant and stylish. An oasis of calm in a bustling and energetic city. Our suite , 102, was well equipped and spotlessly clean. Despite being on the front of the hotel, facing a busy road, we had no problem with noise and slept well each night. Breakfasts were more than adequate and the use of fine bone china added to the general feeling of refinement. The owners went out of their way to ensure that our stay was enjoyable. From the initial booking to the final checkout nothing was too much trouble. We could not have made a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel and hosts”
Reviews.Author: Banb_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hostal L'Antic Espai for three nights and can't recommend it highly enough. It has an excellent location, being fairly central and in the pleasant Eixample district, and only a short stroll away from a metro stop (Passeig de Gracia). The Placa de Catalunya (where the aerobus drops off) is also only a 10 minute stroll away, and la Ramblas isn't much further. The hosts themselves are very welcoming and always willing to help - whether that's with maps, tips, or recommendations for eating out (all of which were excellent by the way). All speak excellent English and have a good knowledge of the city. The hotel itself is full of charm and character - what I'd describe as 'boutique'. Rooms are clean, a good size and we also had access to the terrace where the delightful (and plentiful) breakfast was served - the perfect way to start your day. The attention to detail and level of service really is excellent. For those wanting to surf the net, portable laptops with wi-fi are available on request. All-in-all, great vlaue for money - would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You want well to be taken care of? Visits L'Antic Espai !!!”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineMiami
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic, never will forget it. Whit the attention mainly of the owner Abel and his friend Sergio, you feel just as in house. I remember one night a Mexican gentleman, that he was with its wife in vacations, he feel badly, and the owner and Doctor Abel Estebez atend him after 12:00 pm, without any type of collecion. I think that you can see that action in few places. The location of this Hostal is the best, because who has not listened on theGran Via de les Cortes Catalanes near Plaza de Catalunya, Las Ramblas, the Barrio Gotico, La Sagrada Familia, and numerous Restaurants and nightclubs, all, they are not far for the Hostal L'Antic Espai.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Details”
Reviews.Author: ERaphael
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed at Hostal L'Antic Espai for 4 nights in Room 101. The owners were incredibly welcoming and such terrific hosts. I usually review a hotel and then think, "Oh, I'll try somewhere else next time." Not so with Hostal L'Antic Espai. If I travel to Barcelona again, I have no doubts about where I want to stay: Hostal L'Antic Espai. Really, it was a flawless stay. The location is, in my opinion, perfect. Just a short walk to Plaça de Catalunya. It also only took us about 5 minutes to walk to Palau de la Musica for an evening performance. This is a lovely area and though the hotel is just off a big street (and our balcony faced that street) we weren't bothered by the noise. The sound-proof windows are pretty remarkable. We could hear traffic though and I thought it would disturb my sleep, but I didn't even notice it. Our room was just off the lobby. I was also concerned about the noise factor with that, but - again - my sleep was never disturbed by lobby noise. We could hear people talking, etc. in the evenings, but I slept really well at Hostal L'Antic Espai and the mornings seemed really quiet. Breakfast was also gorgeous! The first morning we had breakfast out in the sitting area and the spread was simply stunning. The following three mornings we took breakfast in our room. You order the night before and then they have yummy breakfast ready for you at whatever time you specify the next morning. This was particularly impressive on our last morning when we had to leave quite early for the airport. Everything we ordered was delivered right on time and was a great start to our long journey home. As was being delivered to the airport...just perfect. I've read where other reviewers have called the mattresses hard. I would say they are firm, certainly. However, not hard. Firm, but there is also a softness to them. They feel like high quality mattresses. And, the pillows are to die for. They were perfect for me. My dad also said he slept very well and noted the amazing pillows before I had a chance to. I wish I had that pillow at home, actually. The hotel is very clean. I've stayed in other clean hotels before. What sets Hostal L'Antic Espai apart are the attention to details. Fresh flowers, detailed care in everything down to the porcelein light switches. You do have to ring to get up to the hotel. I found this to be a comforting bit of security and never had any trouble getting in day or night. Drawbacks? None. My dad and I both loved Hostal L'Antic Espai and thought the owners were really wonderful! They go out of their way to make you feel special. They're also really warm and helpful with recommendations, directions, etc. One last thing. The hotel has wifi. So you can bring your own laptop and easily access the Internet from your room. They have a computer in the lobby that they said we could use; however, they also had a little laptop that they let me borrow (it was always available when I wanted to write home and check on my family). That was such an unexpected bonus and really fantastic. We also loved watching DVDs in our room of an evening - the hotel has a large selection of DVDs that you can borrow for free. Thank you for a lovely stay! We had a wonderful time in Barcelona and cannot recommend your beautiful hotel more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find!!”
Reviews.Author: jax_46Brighton
Reviews.Content: Thank you all previous reviewers for directing us to this charming place...a real find! We spent 2 days here, to celebrate my birthday and were so delighted with the experience. The room (104) was beautiful and it led onto our delightful terrace, an oasis right in the centre of the city! I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an unforgettable find”
Reviews.Author: LornaRidgewood_NJ
Reviews.Content: My friend and I escaped to Barcelona for 5 days and feel that we could not have found a better spot to stay. We were made to feel immediately at home by Abel and Sergio, the proprietors of this delightful spot. When we arrived they carried our bags up the flight of steps and offered us coffee and a refreshment. We sat on a lovely terrace and chatted with Abel. So much fun really. He gave us wonderful suggestions about where to go and where to eat, etc. etc. Our room #101 was small but very charming and acceptable. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The bathroom is also small but very modern and clean. Each room comes with luxurious white terry cloth robes that were an added treat. A large armoire held our clothes and we had every amenity we needed. Those who want a modern hotel with minimalist appeal should probably not come here. However, if you want to feel at home in a cozy, very clean, antique filled space with the best staff possible at a reasonable price you will not go wrong with L'Antic Espai. It's location is also safe and a convenient walk to everything. We will tell all our friends to come here.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooms, delightful ambience and gracious hosts.”
Reviews.Author: spiderbait
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the L'Antic Espai. It offers a unique experience for those who prefer a personal touch, rather than standard hotel service. Easily accessible by public transport and close to the centre of Barcelona, lovely breakfast on the terrace and hosts for whom nothing is too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Charface
Reviews.Content: This was literally the nicest and most fabulous hostal we have ever stayed in - in a very central location (our room - 103 - also had a balcony looking directly over the Gran Via, which really made us feel part of the action). We had read some reviews saying that it felt more like staying in some eccentric uncle's house than a hotel, which is true, except that at no times did it feel stuffy or old-fashioned. The decor was fantastically kitsch, but balanced nicely with all mod-cons. Abel, Sergio and the other staff were incredibly helpful and accomodating - I only wish that we had woken up a bit earlier to take advantage of the breakfasts and socialising! The kind of place that stays with you for a long time - we are already planning to come back to see everyone - especially Morena, the cutest little two-month old puppy I have ever seen! A hostal that lives up to Barcelona's very high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Individual and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tourista9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights-Husband on Business and I was exploring Barcelona. This Hotel is visually Gorgeous with lots of Fabulous antiques and great tiled floors. It's immaculately clean and the people are very friendly and helpful. Sergio had a new Tiny puppy-who was only allowed for a few hours at the hotel-not at breakfast time etc. and he was SO cute!! There's a pretty terrace for breakfast/drinks and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “caring and gentle staff, superb rooms in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: threetravellers
Reviews.Content: Charming service from two gentle and considerate owners. We stayed in room 101, small balcony, central location, safe, very personal service. Attention paid to every detail - our room had dial bacolite phone, fresh tasteful flower arrangement, understated but gorgeous decor (gold and red) . We arrived early before room vacated but staff very very welcoming, gave us map and guide book and recommended places to visit on day 1. Staff able to recommend good places to eat : excellent hosts. This is their home and they care, plus they have good taste. Excellent combination. Easy walking distance to sites plus close to major bus routes to montjuic and sagrada familia and port etc.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JMBcork
Reviews.Content: Located on the first floor, accessed from the side avenue of a busy main street, we would return to L'Antic Espai tomorrow if we could. Quirkily furnished with old and antique furniture and china, the best aspect was the warm welcome and friendliness of the two owners who are genuinely concerned about their guests' well-being. Location was perfect, less than 10 minutes from Placa de Catalunya and the top of Las Ramblas, an easy walk from the historic quarter, and not noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “rare find!”
Reviews.Author: FootsoreTraveller
Reviews.Content: I can only add to the rest of the five-star reviews here. This place doesn't feel like a hotel, or even a B&B, it's more like having an eccentric relative with fabulous taste offering you a room in their vast sumptuous apartments. The location could not be better, a short walk to el Born or the Gothic Quarter, and our low-season rate was an absolute bargain. We had room 103, despite looking over a busy street it was totally quiet, indeed I don't think noise would dare penetrate the velvet drapes! It was the only room they had left and had twin beds, but the beds were just big enough for two, if you're both fairly skinny... Very romantic, you will be left alone if you like or given any attention you want, this is a very personalized experience! If you like your accomodation's character to be a part of your holiday you won't do better, definitely one of the best parts of a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely Place:”
Reviews.Author: patrizzi
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Place…. A lovely Hotel, beautifully furnished, in a very central convenient location which was surprisingly quiet! Our host Abel and Sergio were welcoming, friendly and very helpful- persisting in telephoning to book us a table at The Flamenco Show, and searching a Vegetarian Restaurant that opened on Sundays. Coming to Barcelona for my birthday was special and made even more so by their gift of a tasty ‘’Vino Tinto’’when we arrive back at the end of a long day. So had a lovely time at the Hostel. So thanks you! We love the beautiful little details in the rooms and they were always very friendly to us and their others guest. The hotel is very, very clean… We highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “quirky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: quiensabe
Reviews.Content: A friend who lives nearby recommended this place to my mum. I live in BCN and my mum came to visit. Alhough I have a flat nearby I ended up staying with mum in a twin bed room. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone. Lovely, smiley staff, who asked us how we were and if we needed anything. Not too much though- that was the best bit- we were left to our own devices- it was a very relaxed and therefore relaxing atmosphere. I read one review which stated that although they advertised breakfast on the net, and in the hotel itself in the form of a sign in the bathroom, no one told them face to face- how many times do you need telling?? Nice not to be pestered by hotel staff trying to get more money out of you, surely?! Anyway, a big thanks to all the boys (and there were quite a few of them!) at the Antic Espai, my mum and I had a few lovely nights sleeping amidst such eclectic decor...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, beautiful decor, antique apartment rooms”
Reviews.Author: foodietravel
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and extremely helpful staff. Short walk to the Ramblas, centrally located, excellent location. Good selection of DVDs as well. You must ask the owner for some tips on where to go for the best churros in Barcelona, it was the highlight of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “chandeliers and cava”
Reviews.Author: seasidejane
Reviews.Content: we were looking for something a little unusual for my birthday and we found it here. A few minutes walk from Playa de Catalunya, this grand old first floor apartment has been lovingly turned into a fabulous place to stay. Antique furniture, chandeliers everywhere, lace edged sheets, morning coffee served in a china coffee pot with matching cups and saucers and a complimentary bottle of cava to enjoy on our private glassed in balcony (which also had its own chandelier!). Although bitterly cold outside, Hostal L'Antic Espai was warm and welcoming and the staff couldn't have been nicer. Small shower rooms but modern and very clean, dvd player in our room and a good selection of dvds to choose from. It's boutique hotel style without the price tag. Go, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hostel with a brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: cakers
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hostel that we loved! Staff were really friendly and welcoming, with one of the owners rushing to help us carry our luggage upstairs. We were allocated Suite 107 which had a double bed, compact bathroom, huge wardrobe with lots of hanging space and drawer space, seating area for 2, and access to the shared terrace area, which was charming, despite looking onto a wall. The room had individually controlled heating/air conditioning, and the shaded aspect would be a great advantage in the summer heat. It was clean, and the maid did a wonderful job in freshening up the room each day, with lovely touches such as the way she fanned out the blanket on the bed. We were advised that the maid did not speak English, but when we had a problem communicating a request, she very kindly phoned the owner and got me to speak with him before following up on the request. The following morning she remembered that we preferred tea with breakfast and laid out a beautiful spread on the terrace for us. Staff were really helpful in assisting us in finding our way around, giving a map with directions to get to specific places of interest to us. There was also free internet access using the computer in the hallway which was great for checking in for our flights. The location was fantastic!!! Just a few minutes walk from Placa Catalunya and La Rambla, but on a busy street which is very safe for walking around, either in groups or alone. It didn't take us long at all to find our bearings, and there are metro stops nearby for getting around. Only gripe is that on the final morning we asked for tea in addition to our breakfast (on this occasion not provided by the maid) and were charged €3 for what was essentially 2 cups of hot water and a couple of tea bags! Tea/coffee making facilities in the room, or complimentary tea/coffee would be an improvement. Maybe take your own kettle!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome lil place!”
Reviews.Author: HaKim1024
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was amazing. The people running the place were all very very nice. Especially the man who does the late night shift. They even recommended 2 great places to eat. We stayed in Room 104 and my friend stayed in a single room right next door. Both rooms were clean and had access to the balcony. The last night of our stay...the manager informed us that when we showered the water was somehow leaking into the downstairs so they had us move to Room 105. They were very sorry and kind about having to move us but Room 105 was bigger so it worked out! While both Room 104 and 105 are suitable for 3 people, Room 104 felt a tad small. I would recommend room 105 over 104 in terms of size. Room 105 also has access to the balcony. While the balcony isn't HUGE it is still a very nice size. But be warned...there are about 3 other rooms that have access to the same balcony and so you would have to be careful not to stay out on the balcony too late at night so you don't disturb the other guests. For the most part we had the balcony to ourselves. There is no elevator so lugging your suitcase up the stairs is a pain but the people there were kind enough to help us. I would definitely stay there again. There are lots of shops around and access to the metro is only a block or two away. Las Ramblas isn't far either.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GlennMcG
Reviews.Content: L'Antic Espai is a beautiful small hotel in Barcelona. The location could not be better - close to the Metro, Las Ramblas, Passeig de Gracia, etc. The hotel is well decorated, the rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff is great. Sergio, Abel and their staff take pride in their hotel. They always have someone on staff at the desk, they helped us with restaurant reservations and suggestions on things to do. We wanted a romantic hotel for our honeymoon and we found it at Hostal L'Antic Espai!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sensi100
Reviews.Content: First of all I must say I am positive you will love the owners of this establishment. Abel and Sergio are the most heartwarming people you will find in Barcelona, they are extremely kind and helpful and take care of all your wishes!. The decoration, which is an impressive eclectic collection of antique furniture, personally put together by the very stylish owners was an absolute pleasure to be around. I have never come accross such a quaint and clean hostal which unbelievably has only 2 stars. It is located right in the centre of the city 3 blocks from Passeo de Gracia, the main shopping street. I couldn´t imagine what more you could want. I would highly recommend L¨antic Espai to anyone who wants to have a distinct experience with great quality, reasonable prices and an extremely convenient location. Barcelona is such a wonderful city and I cannot wait to come back and stay in this delightful Hostal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: BettyStevens
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews of the hotel on tripadvisor a girlfriend and I decided to book a four night stay. Before leaving home, we really wondered what we might have been letting ourselves in for but all our fears were unfounded. The hotel is an absolute gem and a real experience, There is not a space that isn't filled with ornaments, pictures, furniture etc, but there was not a speck of dust to be found. The bathrooms are tiny but spotlessly clean, although we did wonder how an overweight person would fit into the shower. A lot of thought has gone in to creating a warm, welcoming and really unusual place to stay. It is very centrally located and in a safe area. On a previous visit to Barcelona I stayed in the Gothic quarter and felt very nervous at night even though I was with my husband. Here we felt quite safe being out after dark. Abel and Sergio were so helpful, they are better than the tourist information office. They gave us maps and directions and recommended wonderful places to eat. I do second a previous review extolling the virtues of the Ciutat Comtal tapas restaurant. The only problem my friend had, was that her room was close to the reception desk and the guy who is on duty at night snores really loudly. I even heard him snoring one night from my room. I did urge her to mention this to Abel and Sergio but she didn't want to make a fuss so it is her own fault ,as I'm sure they would have changed her room All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for something a little different. If we go back to Barcelona we will definitely return to L'Antic Espai and also to Ciutat Comtal. Thank you Abel and Sergio

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jayne_leonard
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel after reading the reviews on this site.....so thought I best put my review on here for future guests! Booked for a visit by myself and my Mum for her birthday. We arrived late Saturday afternoon. Welcomed by a fluent English speaking lady who offered us help with our luggage and then brought us some cold white wine! We went out for dinner that evening, were offered an umbrella and told we could return at any hour, someone would be there to let us in. Slept well on what we both considered clean and comfortable beds....I personally prefer two pillows, but that is being picky! Showered well in a smallish but clean bathroom (but then we ain't two fat ladies, who complain about shower cubicle sizes!) Felipe brought us breakfast which we took on the terrace Sunday morning to the sound of the birds in the cage. On our final day the hotel stored our luggage for us all day which meant we could get our last minute gifts and clothes and tapas without hauling our bags everywhere. The one suggestion I have for improvement would be....please get a kettle to boil your water for tea!! The water heated in the microwave was not hot enough.......I know, typical English moaning about their tea in Spain.....it's just a suggestion! Oh and another thing, which the hotel can do absolutely nothing about....breakfast on Sat/Sun fab, listening to the birds.....breakfast on weekdays, noisy screaming kids from the school at the back!! We loved it though and would return/recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: sunszler
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay after reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed ! The hotel is in a great location, with lots of restuarants and cafes in very close proximity. Felt very safe wandering the streets at nite,Los Ramblas a 5 min. stroll away. The hotel is very quaint, filled with olde worlde charm,lots of antique style fittings and furnishings, yes, the rooms are compact, but found the bed very comfortable, and the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, Staff very helpful, a lovely young man came down to greet us and carried bags upstairs late at nite, Would definitiely return here, very good value for money for the location, But if it is a 5 star hotel with all the bells and whistles you require, this hotel is not for you, Our only complaint was when we were ready to go to the airport! Lovely young lady at reception insisted on calling a cab for us, then she was adamant that she needed to accompany us downstairs to talk to the driver, My partner saw a bank note exchange hands from driver to receptionist??, and when we arrrived at the airport our fare was 10 euros more than our arrival fare?? Would suggest you go downstairs and hail your own cab, Only a minor hiccup but dont like to be taken for a ride, so to speak!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and personal”
Reviews.Author: Possibilus
Reviews.Content: We searched extensively and finally settled on Hostal L'Antic Espai for our trip to Barcelona, and were quite happy there. The location is convenient to the center of the city, and we could walk up the street to Gaudi's Casa Batilo and Casa Mila within minutes. Hotel is a floor in an apartment building and is furnished very traditionally, which is what we were looking for. Martha, the English speaking Colombian manager was very helpful and gracious, and we met owners the last day and had a nice chat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Anglia62
Reviews.Content: 'Tourists' want to take their environment with them like a snail in its shell; 'Travellers' relish the local, the unique, the colorful. Fortunately, my wife, our friend and I are Travellers, or we might have missed this absolutely fantastic over-the top gem of a place. Sergio and Abel obviously love L'Antic Espai: it's obvious, from the eclectic and eccentric decor to their concern that the guest too should feel this is their home. The hotel is a restored townhouse, and is accessed through a 'door in a door', then up the stairs. Location is great - near Las Ramblas, shopping and the best tapas in Barcelona (superb French restaurant around the corner too!). The rooms are tiny (of course) but sumptuously furnished. The beds are very comfortable; a/c & ensuite bathrooms 'like new'. We stayed in two different rooms - just because the best one became available and the boys thought we might like to try it! Overall, it's the decor and the 'style' that you'll remember. This is more an experience of a home than a hotel. Poke, pry, ask questions - you're with enthusiasts! Oh, and if you read that negative review from the man who never came, let us tell you that there is nothing wrong with the business end of things - except it becomes more of a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: coolcat
Reviews.Content: PROS Excellent location! Lovely area from which we walked to the area of Gracia as well as the beach. The area felt safe at night. Close to three metro stations, lots of restaurants etc. It was a treat to live in an apartment building instead of an ordinary hotel. We really liked the tiled floors – they gave the hotel a very warm and homey feeling. Very clean and tidy! The room was well kept during our stay and smelled fresh and clean. Friendly staff! Both those who spoke excellent English, such as Felipe, and the ladies who spoke less English were very nice. It was not a problem at all to be buzzed in 24/7! They also let us leave our bags in the reception area for a few hours on the day of our departure which we appreciated. Lovely-looking terrace with flowers and bird cages. If you travelled with friends and occupied all 4 rooms facing the terrace it would have been absolutely perfect! CONS Although the terrace looks very nice, it just might be a little bit awkward to dress/undress, or take a nap before going out at night, with strangers staring right at you only meters from your bed. Literally! Pictures we had seen mislead us to believe that each room had its own little table with chairs right outside – instead there were two sitting areas and thus, when they were user by other guests, or staff for that matter (upon arrival there was a man working on some picture frames out there, smoking cigarettes), you had absolutely no privacy in your room unless you kept the heavy curtains closed. Although it was permitted, luckily the other guests were not smoking cigarettes! The mattress was quite firm but not too bad, but the pillow was close to a sack of cement. The blanket that we found in the wardrobe and used on top of the bed sheet could use a wash since it was rather full of stains - though if previous guests had folded it and put it back we can see how this could have been overlooked by the maintenance staff. Water pressure was really bad – more like a drizzle than pressure – I had to wash my hair in the sink. The air con worked most of the time, but the last night we had to keep the door open to the terrace that we shared. However, we did not feel very comfortable with this and closed the door again after an hour or so. Doors seemed to be paper thin and since you would be able to hear a whisper in the hallway you can imagine what hollering pre-adolescent boys sounded like shouting and slamming doors. (Loud children are not the hotel's fault of course, but just to give you a picture...) The room was smaller than we expected. Or at least it seemed small due to the placement of the furniture, one double and one single bed. We are average size people and we seemed to constantly be in each others way while moving around the room. It would certainly be very crowded with three people staying together. We stayed here three nights in October, and in short we pretty much agree with everything “brabb” said on Oct 5 about the hotel in his review (which we found honest and really not overly critical.). We know this is not a 5 star hotel, but it was still not quite what we expected based on reviews we had read here on TA.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jasiPhilaPa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this wonderul Hostal. Upon arriving we were greeted with a complimentry glass of Cava by one of the staff. We stayed in room 102 which was on the street side with an enclosed terrace. When the sound proof doors were closed to the terrace we could not hear any street noise.Occasionally you can hear noise in the hall,but this is to be expected when staying in an old building with character. The Hostal is filled with beautiful antiques. Sergio,the owner is very helpful in recommending restaurants ,he sent us to 2 excellent restaurants. We opted not to have breakfast there as there are wonderful French pastry shops down the street. We did order coffee and this was not very good but served eloquently. In the evening we asked if they had a glass of sherry that we could purchase. They had it indeed and brought it to our room served in beautiful cordial glasses. The location is in walking distance of all the major sites. There is no lift and the Hostal is up one flight of stairs. If you need assistance with your bags the staff will help. I would highly recommend this hotel to people who have an appreciation for antiques and old world charm. If you are looking for a generic hotel this is not for you. As far as the staff goes, they are very friendly,you just have to ask them for what you want. Barcelona is a beautiful city and when I return I will stay at Hostal L'Antic Espai

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ZMMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the property for 2 nights September 17-18,2008. We were very pleased. The hotel's location is superb, close to Plaza Catalunya, shopping and restaurants. The attention and advice of the owners was outstanding. The hotel is very affordable and has a computer that can be used free of charge,items that are very difficult to find in Barcelona. Since the hotel caters mostly to foreigners, we spent some time with other guests (from Australia and the US). Our room was small, but very confortable. It even had a balcony. The shower stall was small, but perfectly usable. The hotel does not have elevators (lifts), but one of the owners helped us with our bags. In short: If you are looking for a hotel with an excellent location, superb service and reasonable prices, this is the place for you. If you have trouble climbing stairs (one floor),or if you are traveling with children, this is not the hotel you should stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: KCDK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means a top hotel in Barcelona. It is about half the price of other top hotels, and that is about correct for what you get. Rooms on the busy street are noisy. The reviews are simply too high for what we experienced there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ECKYHongKong
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much and had not experienced any problem when booking the hotel. In fact, I got a discount when I got there. Contact me and I can forward all relevant email correspondence to any interested person. I am an Asian woman who travelled alone. I had been really well looked after by the hotel operator. Felipe told me what I ought to look out for and gave me travel tips from time to time. The service was excellent. The hotel also had a very clean bathroom and the location was truly central. Very close to Passeig de Gracia and Placa de Catalunya. It was also very close to the Julia tours bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, cute, and quirky”
Reviews.Author: amancga
Reviews.Content: L'Antic Espai was a charming stay in awesome Barcelona. The room I had was small but completely sufficient and decorated beautifully. I used their online reservation and was offered a discounted rate which was honoured when I arrived. Location is quite central with the closet metro station about 2 blocks away and Las Ramblas not more than 5-10min as well. You're right on Gran Via with lots of places to eat/drink very nearby. There is also a supermarket just about across the street to stock up on necessities like water, drinks, snacks, etc. I arrived at 10pm from the airport by taxi and in the dark, the hotel sign was a bit hard to spot. What makes it a bit harder is the huge dark door that's locked... you have to use the intercom to buzz in, so don't expect a big bright hotel lobby. Once you're in, you make your way up the grand staircase (motion detection lights were handy). The atmosphere, once inside, is very warm and homey, is the best way to describe. The lady who checked me in was super nice and was the best welcome to Barcelona at 10pm. Even after checking into my room, I was hungry and she gave me a great recommendation on where to find some tapas and wine. Super helpful! The one minor quirk was, although the wi-fi was free, the security password did not work and I ended up surfing on an unsecured line of an unknown source. Not an issue at all for me, and I did not bring up with the staff, but something they might want to fix if they happen to read this.

Reviews.Title: “Beware; Sketchy business!!”
Reviews.Author: hmdAlberta
Reviews.Content: After reading some positive reviews, but keeping in mind the negative reviews about this Hotel’s sketchy business, I took the risk and attempted to make the reservation with the Hotel. I used the Hotel website for reservation. There is no direct booking system. I filled out the form, and requested the room availability. Within seconds, friendly “Sergio” replied my email, offering single room for 60 Euro per night. Wow, the rate was amazing, perhaps too good to be true. Sergio, requested my credit card information, to charge for the first night as a deposit. I did not hesitate and literally in a second I sent the credit card information and received the confirmation. Surely, the next day I receive an email from the less friendly “no name person” informing me that the room that I booked the day before is not available and offered a 90 Euro per night room!!! I sent an email, explaining that made the booking within the seconds I received the offer. However, the “no name person” brought some sketchy excuses to justify their sketchy business. I sent another email to find out about the credit-card transaction and surely, the “no name person” is nowhere to be found!!! I am still trying to find out about what has happened to the credit-card transaction. Please beware, do yourself a favour, pay a little bit more and stay in a safe hotel with more reputable business practice. hmd

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hostal L'Antic Espai”
Reviews.Author: Punjabibanda
Reviews.Content: Me and the lads just got back from an amazing stay in Barcelona. Hotel was great, staff are very helpful, they let you know where to eat, sightsee and go out at night. Location is ideal considering the price, just a 3-5 minute walk off the top of Las Ramblas. Rooms are quite unique given that most hotels have come straight out of an Ikea. Had a really nice terrace next to the room which is a gtreat place to chill. All in all would highly recommend it and would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite and tasteful”
Reviews.Author: Rumpleteazer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at L'Antic Espai and I wish we stayed more! Excellent location, near the busy "Rambla" district and great places to dine, but at the same time in a nice residential area. Very few rooms, each one differs from others in design...wonderful common area decorated in the style of the "belle epoque", with antic furniture, porcelain pictures in frames on the walls, and porcelain figures and vases everywhere..two canarys in a cage in the patio...The rooms also have "antic" design, a good addition to it being an LCD-screen TV with a DVD player attached to it (have you seen many of them in 2-star properties?) Our room also pleasantly surprised us with a large balcony where my friend had her evening cigarette, and an air conditioner which was unnoticeable (no strong blowing from anywhere) but kept the right climate in the room. And, finally, although the room faced a lively street, it was sound proof. We didn't hear any noise at all. Yes, the hotel is located on the 1st floor of a residential building, but we were helped with the luggage on both our arrival and departure so had no problem on that side. Another truth is, that the shower cabin can, in a way, nourish your claustrofobia, but the bathroom itself was of a reasonable size, spotless, and had everything necessary, including a hair dryer. A computer with Internet access available in the common area free of charge added to the overall positive impression. All in all, if you are looking for a faceless standard N-star chain hotel, then look another way. We are going to return.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...”
Reviews.Author: TeachinCa
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my teen daughter for 4 nights. Great location.. beautiful rooms... But, where were the wonderful, helpful, friendly staff that I read about?? I speak Spanish, so I don't think it was a language thing. When we arrived at the hotel, we were buzzed in and someone carried our bags up the flight of stairs, but the gentleman seemed surprised/annoyed that we were there, and didn't offer much in the way of a greeting (I thought that we were at the wrong place!) We were shown to our room and given water, but the gentleman seemed very uncomfortable with us, and quickly left. We were given no information about the neighborhood (e.g., where to eat, location of transportation...), and this odd attitude lasted throughout our stay! The rest of the stay was fine. Great room, great location... but we always felt uncomfortable with the staff. One morning the fire alarm went off at 6:30am, and continued to RING LOUDLY for 1 hour! No apology nor explanation was given.

Reviews.Title: “AS GOOD AS THEY SAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Dirkvdw
Reviews.Content: Two nights here on 16th - 18th November out of Newcastle ... on recommendation from TripAdvisor reviews (of course...) Easy to find thanks to directions on this site Airport bus to Plaza de Catalunya â‚¬3.95 (you can pay on bus .. the ticket machine next to the stop at the airport Terminal 1 didn't take our banknotes, and there's no English help here .. Facing the Corte Ingles store, go left 2.5 blocks to the BIG road Gran Via, and then go right two blocks .. look for the red flag hanging above the doorway .. ring the bell, go through the small door into the entrance, turn the light on the wall to the r!ight and up the stairs to reception where a friendly smile and your keys to your room await you. We usually stay modern, this was like stepping back in time and in high society .. there were antiques everywhere, grand cabinets, tall ceilings, beautiful objects and antiques mixed with hi-tech plasma tv in the small lounge and fascinating things laid out on hall tables. Amazing.We stayed in Romm 101, my sister and her husband in room 104. 101 was cute, small, comfortable, with lovely low slung beds with huge fancy headboards complementing the tall mirrored wardrobe , and the small balcony overlooking La Gran Via (road) .... the traffic was pretty constant apart from Sunday morning, but if you close the shutters, then the door and the curtains, we slept very well indeed, with an occasional background hum or police siren. Bathroom is tiny, modern and clean with a toilet and shower only and there's a small LCD television and CD player on the wall of the bedroom. We found the matress comfortable indeed and both slept very well each evening, though we had eaten like kings close by during the afternoon and the evening with a few few glasses of wine or beer which may have helped. Room 104 is definitely bigger and brighter as it empties onto the communal (shared by four aprtments / rooms of the Hostel) We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Bed made for Colonel Tom Thumb”
Reviews.Author: jintsjason
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the L'Antic Espai for one night after flying from Newark. Very well located and they got my room ready for me by 1PM which I appreciated greatly. I can't remember the room number, but believe me when I tell you that while the room was lovely and the bed was an antique, it was about 5'6" long, and as I'm 5'10" tall, well...not so great. Make sure to ask for a room that has a real full-sized bed. Otherwise a really lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “choice of rooms”
Reviews.Author: arwilliams1117
Reviews.Content: Ditto all the rave reviews about this charming, brilliantly located place run by the friendliest, most helpful bunch of hoteliers. My husband and I (professionals in our 50s) will definitely stay there the next time we're in Barcelona. A few words about room choice, from the back-of-the-door diagram in our room: We stayed in 107, a double-plus-bath with a parlor that opened onto a shared patio via big glass doors. Other rooms around the patio: 104 and 105 (doubles) and 106 ( a single). Rooms off interior air shafts: 108, 109, 110. Rooms overlooking the street (the Gran Via): 101, 102, and 103. Also, ask about directions to walk to Ciudad, Condal, the staff's favorite tapas bar just a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: jjanvil
Reviews.Content: We discovered this gem through Trip Advisor & everything about it was fantastic. Our stay of 9 days was great since the art nouveau buildings(which we loved so much) were so close. The location couldn't be better; the staff was very accommodating & pleasant; etc. We appreciated the owner who is passionate about collecting antiques for the rooms. He worked very hard to restore this wonderful boutique hotel. it was a very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: midlifeSharilee
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for 3 wonderful nights. Abel and Sergio took fabulous care of us, including making a snack for my friend (who is recently pregnant) late one night when she was hungry and it was a bit late to get out for food. This is a wonderful renovation, and you can feel the love, care and effort that has gone into making this hostel and welcoming home after touring the city. We stayed in Room 101, with twin beds, and deemed the beds magic, we slept so well! Although the room is right on the busy street, the windows effectively block all noise. The shower is a bit tight, but great water pressure, and it does what it needs to do. We wanted to return for the two nights we would be back in Barcelona before going home, alas, everything was booked up. No surprise there. I am looking forward to going back, both to Barcelona and to this very special hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff & CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Pandah2
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and were impressed with the cleanliness of the room and friendliness of the staff. We asked for recommendations for Tapas and Catalan restaurants and to avoid tourist traps and were directed to excellent places. The food was the best of our three week Mediterranean vacation! Excellent location near Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya, where you can catch the sightseeing and airport buses. Will stay again and highly recommend this hostel to anyone who enjoys a European style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifikiwi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip at Barcelona. This hotel offers excellent location, room with antique style and helpful staffs. The only complaint I have is the noise. It's a one floor hotel with ten rooms, our room is next to the reception and was noisy at night, especially with the receptionist talking. Another inconvenience is that they do not have a receptionist who speaks English in the morning. Overall is a good value stay and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Hostel L'Antic espai”
Reviews.Author: AmyNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely thrilled with our stay at Hostal L'Antic espai! The accommodations were very comfortable and the staff was terrific. The bathrooms were new and very nice. Once, when I was trying to buy tickets to a concert, one of the staff ran across the street to find me at a kiosk to help me decipher the Catalonian. They were extremely helpful and courteous. The collection of antiques was amazing. And the location was great. I would go back and stay there in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hugsSussex
Reviews.Content: The hostal is ideally situated. The decor of the hostal is charming. We were made to feel very welcome and were given good information of places and restaurants to visit. We look forward to returning to Barcelona soon. We would definately stay at Hostal L'Antic Espai again. We can recommend Room104 which has the use of a large terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Very Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: marshvu
Reviews.Content: All the nice comments we read about L'Antic Espai proved to be true. This is a wonderful ten room hotel in an old restored second floor apartment in a very beautiful section of Barcelona. It exudes warmth and old world charm. From the time we arrived when we were greeted by Abel with a choice of wine or coffee to the time we left, the hospitality couldn't have been better. All rooms in this hotel are furnished with beautiful antiques which Abel and Serge have collected from many countries. Our room opened out onto a lovely patio furnished with tropical plants, finches and parakeets in cages, and old world wrought iron furniture. The staff goes out of its way to see that your stay is comfortable and memorable. Nearby are several good restuarants and access to public transportation. We look forward to returning! Hats off to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous L'Antic Espai”
Reviews.Author: stokesnet
Reviews.Content: I took a group of eight people to stay in the hotel for five nights. The owners were so kind and hospitable. Rooms small and comfortable. All of their recommendations of things to do and places to eat were excellent. They went out of their way to be kind to us. Service was great and to my surprise our room was quiet. Fabulous experience for all of us! js from north carolina

Reviews.Title: “Good location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: NicC
Reviews.Content: We only had one night sadly, but our room was lovely and the hotel was surprising easy to find. Even though we arrived at 11pm, we were offered a welcome drink, which sadly we had to decline as we were in a hurry to go out and have dinner. The location is good - about a 10 minute walk from the Born area and close to the Ramblas etc. Good shopping nearby if you like that sort of thing - including a large zara. Only thing not so good was the lack of breakfast. Confusingly, there was a menu in our room mentioning a terrace and breakfast, but when we left the next morning and asked at reception (I think it was a maid on duty) she just said 'no breakfast'. So we found a hotel cafe nearby. Was a shame to leave on a bit of a downer like that so for that reason I'm not giving it 5 marks.

Reviews.Title: “A truly unique Barcelona experience”
Reviews.Author: ekmngrlz
Reviews.Content: This "hostal" (collection of rooms) is a hidden gem on the second floor of an apartment building centrally located near Placa de la Catalunya and Las Ramblas. If you want a clean, modern, boring hotel with a big lobby, a reception desk and an elevator, then this place is not for you. But if you think you might enjoy the chance to stay as an honored guest in one of 10 rooms in a beautiful antique apartment, it's a unique experience. The owners and staff are friendly, helpful and attentive to every need. The parlor and the individual rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are brand new and the patio which adjoins several of the rooms is lovely. The rooms are surprisingly quiet and peaceful, considering that the apartment building is located on Gran Via de la Cortes Catalan, a major and very noisy avenue in the heart of the city. We stayed here with our three teenage daughters and everybody had a wonderful time. The owner/operators have lovingly renovated and furnished the apartment and it is a thing of beauty, even though the parlor has a very large flat panel TV and a computer for guests' use. All in all, a wonderful experience and a great way to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at L'Antic Espai!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmania
Reviews.Content: Hello, I am a travel agent from Virginia and took a small group of 8 ladies to Barcelona for a 5 night stay at the L'Antic Espai. We had a wonderful stay there. We liked the fact the hotel was not directly on Las Ramblas or the busier streets of Barcelona. Yet, it was close to restaurants, cafes, metro, Plaza Cataluna, and Las ramblas. The bathrooms, particularly the showers, were on the small side as was previously mentioned in the reviews, but we made it work. The bathrooms were efficient, clean and we were so anxious to hit the streets and see this beautiful city that it was absolutely no problem making it work. I recommend booking a room that goes out to the lovely terrace. It was a great place to have a glass of cava or wine in the afternoon or evening. However, the main reason I would recommend this hotel and would personally stay there again when I return to Barcelona is the incredible staff of Hostal L'Antic Espai. Abel, Sergio, Felipe and all the staff made our stay memorable!! They always took the time to make excellent recommendations to us and they were absolutely wonderful and helpful in every way. It was great chatting with them and sharing our daily adventures with them. If you want wireless service for your Internet, huge bathrooms with soaking tubs, a restaurant at the hotel, amenities of a 5 star hotel, this place is not for you. Go to a 4-5 star property. But if you are looking for a unique small charming hotel, with a great location and the best staff I have ever found at a hotel, this place is for you. I had several very discerning travelers that were with me on this trip and they absolutely loved this entire experience. Thanks Abel, Sergio, Felipe and the rest of the staff!!! I miss all of you!!!!! Ciao, Anne Walsh

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Glamahh
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel with four friends in October. We each has our own rooms. Two of us had rooms with access to the lovely patio (106 and 107) and the other three had interior rooms. I would say that the outside rooms were very charming and the patio a delight for all five of us. The interior rooms were extremely small. All agreed that the hotel was very, very clean, well kept and charming. The owners are delightful and we found the staff to be helpful. When we rang the bell, someone came down to take up our bags. There is a climb to the hotel and the building seems to be under renovation. The walk up is quite dim but apparently safe. Once the door to the hotel opens, however, it's like Dorothy's experience when she opened the door and saw Oz. There is a delightful array of antique furniture and knick knacks everywhere. Very homey. Very well done. The location is great. Central and in a nice neighborhood. On our way home each day from roaming about town, we'd stop and buy a few bottles of great Priorat wine, some cheese and bread and sit on the patio until we were ready to head out for a late dinner, usually of tapas. Our hosts would see our bags of goodies and bring us antique glasses to use for our wine. Nice touch. Nice people.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous boutique hotel - with staff to match”
Reviews.Author: NanGarvey
Reviews.Content: We had no idea what to expect when we arrived at Hostal L'Antic Espai. The stairs leading up to the hotel were dark and a bit dingy - in fact, we initially knocked on the wrong door. However, once inside we were delighted to discover a stylish boutique hotel with charm in spades. We enjoyed our stay immensely - but when I returned home to the UK I discovered I'd left one of my accessories behind. The hotel manager and staff were brilliant about sending my belongings back to me - confirming my high opinion of L'Antic Espai and the generosity and kindness of the people who work there. I'll definitely go back - they're brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bryanbiggin
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night break in Barcelona at the end of the Christmas holidays. This hotel was in exactly the right place and made us feel really welcome. It is situated a few minutes walk from the Placa Cataluna where the airport bus stops. From the hotel you can easily walk to the Bari Gotic, La Ramba and the beach area. The hotel itself is very different. Only ten rooms, each is furnished beautifully with fantastic antiques. It is very quiet and the owners are there every day. They are really friendly and Abel took time to explain how they had renovated a derelict floor of the building over a period of a year. Breakfast was available in our room each morning and room service was available round the clock - all at very reasonable prices. We can definitely recommend room102 with its balcony room overlooking the Grand Via, a fine place to have your breakfast. We will certainly be staying there again the next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A home in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Zenarosa
Reviews.Content: I am always late with the reviews I write, but I wanted to add my comments here as we had a lovely stay at this hotel. Firstly, I should warn visitors that they should consider this less a hotel to visit and more a chance to live in part of an apartment in Barcelona. The entrance is via an unassuming door and you climb the stairs to the entrance which is lovely, for being unexpected. Myself and my husband felt like we were living in Barcelona for the weekend rather than staying in a hotel. The staff on reception were always warm and friendly and their English was always far better than our Spanish (I confess that my poor language abilities in Spain, mean I am grateful for finding that they have made the effort so we can communicate, when my contribution is limited to asking for "two beers"! The location was also great, we walked for most of the time, or took the tourist bus, which was very handy for getting around. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, as it was pricey, we tended to wander to a cafe up the street a little. However, we did have a few drinks on the patio, which was lovely. The room (107) was filled with lovely antiques, and as we don't tend to spend much time in the hotel, the size was fine. The small seating area was nice to have and relax when we were in the room, and of course we could always sit on the patio, with the birds. It was a little noisy in the room, but not as bad as we expected as we were on the main road. The only think I would say, is that I could also feel the metro as it passed underneath. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and would do so again happily. It's a lovely, friendly home from home. Don't expect it to be like a Hilton, it's not, and that is why it is so charming.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Place for Me”
Reviews.Author: mmwwmmww
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hostal L'Antic Espai as a second choice after my first pick, Hotel Banys Oriental was booked up during the time I was going to be in Barcelona. I had high expectations of the hotel due to the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor--which are usually on point. I'm sad to report that my experience was not as wonderful as some of the other reviewers. When my boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel, I pressed the button outside the unassuming wooden door, buzzing the front desk. The response was a curt "Hola"--and then silence. I stammered, "Hola. We are here for the hotel?," and we were buzzed in without any other instructions. When we walked inside, we were met with total darkness--the inside foyer was pitch black. Luckily someone else who was familiar with the building was right behind us--and looked at us suspiciously before leaning past us and pushing the button on the right-hand wall that turned on the lights. We were shocked to see we were in the bottom floor of what looked to be an apartment building under renovation--the banister for the stairs was covered with bubble wrap. We didn't know what to do--there were no signs for the hotel anywhere. I thought maybe we had somehow ended up at the offices for the hotel, instead of the hotel itself. After a few moments of deliberation, my boyfriend headed up the stairs to see if he could find someone to help. He came back down and told me that the hotel was on the second floor and that we would have to carry our luggage up the two flights of stairs. Not really a problem since we packed light, but I was surprised that no one had mentioned this as a major turn-off of the hotel. Once up on the second floor we were met by an indifferent porter who seemed to be more interested in returning to her movie (she was watching Harry Potter on the hotel computer--later she was intrigued by Myspace) than with helping us get settled. She did however extend a complementary drink to us, which was nice. Her English was not that good--our communication was a bit like caveman speak. When we got inside our room (107), we were surprised to see how dark it was--almost no natural light was coming in, and even when we turned on the lights, it was pretty darn dark. The indoor sitting room was cute, and access to the patio was nice, but my boyfriend couldn't get over how dark it was inside. The decorations were a bit too stuffy for my taste--with thick velvet curtains, brocaded bed spread, and delicate (and breakable!) vases and candy dishes strewn about. I was reminded of the times when I would visit the lonely old lady down the street from me while growing up--if I only had a few Werther's Originals to suck on, it would have been a scene out of my childhood. The bathroom was VERY clean--sparkling, even, but I was confused by all of the hooks in the bathroom--all of which seemed to have been placed for NBA basketball players--they were all at least 6 1/2 feet from the ground. The electrical plug (with built-in converter) in the bathroom did not work at all, so I had to plug the hairdryer into one of the sockets in the bedroom in order to dry my hair. Kinda inconvenient. I never met the hotel owners--they were nowhere to be found. The male front desk attendant on our second and third nights was quite helpful--his English very good as well. Another frustration was using the hotel's internet WiFi access. My boyfriend was able to connect using his hand held mobile device, but I was unable to connect on my laptop. When we asked the front desk attendant, he asked if I had a Mac (which I did) and told me that it was a known issue that sometimes Macs are able to connect to the network--sometimes not, and that they had no solution on how to fix it. Both my boyfriend and I pressed for a better explanation, and asked if they could get someone from the internet or router company to troubleshoot, but we were pretty much shot down and told that there was nothing that could be done, but that if I wanted to use the hotel computer when no one was using it for work, I could. Of course every time I popped my head out to see if they were using the computer, they always were. Somehow my boyfriend was able to figure out how to get my computer connected (I think he had to default to a different setting), so we were finally able to use the internet w/ my laptop--but I found it very annoying that the hotel does not have instructions for guests with Macs--especially since they know it's a reoccurring issue. For a time we seriously considered moving hotels since we were unhappy with the service, but decided it wasn't worth the trouble to unpack all our stuff and try to find another room. I seriously wished I had been able to book a room at the Banys Oriental--we walked by it and were jealous by it's cool hip vibe and beautiful modern decor. There were some other beautiful, modern hotels (with a ground floor lobbies!!!) on the neighboring blocks--wish we had been in one of those. The location for the hotel is good--in L'Example, just above the Barri Gotica, 10 minute walking distance from major shopping. Barcelona is a small city, so even when we ended a night in El Raval, we were able to walk home in about 20 minutes. All in all, this hotel was not for me. The lacking service and dark rooms were a major minus. On the plus side, our room was large--I liked the additional room and the bathroom was very clean. I would not recommend this hotel for folks looking for a hip experience, nor people who are used to excellent service. Next time I would probably look for more modern accommodations located further south in the city.

Reviews.Title: “small part of paradise”
Reviews.Author: mrsjayne
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights and were treated really special.beautiful furniture and decore. i am going again in march 2008. breakfast was served on beautiful china and oh what an amazing breakfast. we were so well taken care of and i loved every moment. this hotel and the staff are what made barcelona so special. definitely worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Unique rooms and wonderfully friendly owners...”
Reviews.Author: IssyVP
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and whilst the website messed up the dates Sergio was fantastic at replying to my emails and straightening it all out. My parents also stayed here and after being away and staying in hotels/b&bs night after night for 3 weeks, it was such a wonderful stay and we were relieved to be in such a warm, friendly and pretty place.
