We had rooms along the lovely balcony which were fantastic and we thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast out there as well. The ambience is lovely and Abel and Serigio love what they do, which really shows, especially the details in each of the rooms and the way they interact with the guests. Thank you to both Abel and Sergio for a fabulous stay. I will definitely be back to stay again. PS I am a very light sleeper and didn't hear any traffic noise in the rooms along the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in context of price and location”
Reviews.Author: Shanehoustonlittle
Reviews.Content: We contacted the hotel via e-mail and were surprised at how responsive they were. We booked Room 107 and our friends booked Room 105. The hotel is two blocks from two different metro stations covering four different lines. It is at the center of four different neighborhoods of importance to you if you are here for pleasure. Even though we arrived early they let us check in early :) so we could get naps before heading out to see the city Our room opened onto the very large balcony (which is important if you are a smoker). The room contains a double sized bed and two nightstands, a large armoire and a sitting area. The shower is defintely for one person and the bathroom is a little smallish. The staff were always helpful, even when we arrived in the early hours (or very late). I am rating the overall experience as excellent which is rare for me. In the context of the price, the central location and the genuine warmth and authenticity of this establishment, I felt like a local staying at a close friend's apartment. I usually tend towards boutique hotels or 5 star properties but my stay here has broadened my travel preferences. I am going to look for more hotels like this one that fits in the fabric of the surrounding neighborhood. Only downsides; I could sense the metro when it passed underground during the night and the children from the adjacent school tend to be set on full time scream.

Reviews.Title: “an ok stay”
Reviews.Author: joylin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the l'antic for 7 nights in room 102 and we had a pleasant stay but wish we booked some-where not on the main road as the traffic was constant day and night. The first mornig we ordered the American breakfast which was quite disapointing when it came no cheeses no muffins and only one one glass of juice very pricey at 14 euros go for a short walk and ther are plenty of cheaper places. We ate most lunch times in the Plaza Reial at a place called Lez Quinze nity the queues will frighten you but when you eat you food you will see the reason why, best time to go 1-00pm and they have lunch specials. Going back to the L'Antic the rooms are tiny I am only small and the shower cubicle was so small . Saying that it;s very clean and the staff were lovely. P.S. did anyone lose an item of jewellery in room 102 if so could you contact me

Reviews.Title: “my reservations experience with Hostal L'Antic Espai”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy
Reviews.Content: In all fairness to the Hostal L'Antic Espai, I feel the need to respond because of the review by mer772 from Montreal. I booked a room for May 2008 via email. I was incredibly surprised how Sergio or Abel responded so quickly! I had several questions and emailed several times. Each response was detailed, VERY friendly and courteous. After booking via email, I had called the hotel directly (from Brooklyn, NY!) a week later to ask some more questions. Whomever I spoke to was eager to answer my questions and even confirmed my booking (without me asking). I know when calling overseas, you need to take the time difference into account. If no one answers, it's probably because they are busy taking care of their guests. Based on the tripadvisor reviews, I booked this hotel because of the service that the staff gives, along with the location of the property. The experience I had with this hotel so far has been nothing more than pleasant, friendly, & professional

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful antiques, but noise, noise, noise!”
Reviews.Author: karen11g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy walk from Playa de Catalunya and the Passeig de Gracia (a three-line Metro transfer station), so great, convenient location. The staff was helpful and the decor beautiful. But we had a (very small) room off the terrace and it was the noisiest room we've ever been in! There is a day care playground just over the terrace wall, so little children played loudly all day and well into the evening. (Not too big a problem, since we weren't there much during the day, but contstant when we were.) The rooms that face the terrace have only the glass terrace doors for a noise barrier. We had very loud neighbors who partied in their room until 1 AM, then went out and returned noisily at 4 AM. (Asked the person on staff if she could ask them to quiet down at a little after midnight, but it didn't help.) There are also flats not owned by the hotel that face the terrace on higher levels and there was a huge party in one of those rooms the next night until well after 3 AM! Earplugs barely made a dent. Maybe just our bad luck, but we'd definitely choose another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found it”
Reviews.Author: Boline
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hostal L'Antic Espai for three nights before leaving on a cruise and then for one night before we flew out of Spain. We found the staff to be very, very helpful. They suggested restaurants, called taxis and put up graciously with our lack of Spanish. We stayed in room 107 and really enjoyed the balcony for relaxing after long days of walking. It can be noisy when folks talk in the hallway, but this happened so rarely that we didn't mind. It even added a certain homey feel. The hotel could not be better located either. Everything was within easy reach by foot or by metro. We would heartily recommend that folks stay at the hotel if they are looking for a great location, gracious staff and a quirky charm that one cannot find in a standard chain-type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Expectations Were too High”
Reviews.Author: Turlendu
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say I have extensive travel experience in Europe with hotels of all classes. For me, this property served its purpose. It is quite well situated, attractive and clean. The negatives were the noise on Gran Via (not tons of traffic at night, but this is a major thoroughfare, so there are plenty of cars passing by at night) and the cramped quarters. The lobby is a hallway on the second floor so there really isn't a place to hang out. It has no windows and thus no natural light and the entrance is a bit awkward. Our room was acceptable in size given what I've experienced before in London and Paris and nicely appointed. I believe there was an interior sitting space, but it was not really inviting and again had no natural light. It's not though I wanted to spend all my time in the hotel, but I do like just a little space. The owners were helpful, but not as magical as I had assumed from some of the Trip Advisor accounts. Maybe I'm old fashioned, but one of the guys was wearing biker attire which I found a bit too casual and I'm a pretty laid back guy. Barcelona is definitely a place to splurge. Next time I think I will do that. Hotel Neri was one really cool place in the gothic quarter, but a major upgrade in price.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a museum (in a good way!)”
Reviews.Author: malcognito
Reviews.Content: I booked this on the strength of TripAdvisor reviews and I wasn't disappointed. You won't find it on expedia but try a site called easytobook dot com. It can be a little tricky to find first time but look for a red flag over the doorway. If you're coming by train, it's just two blocks from Passege de Gracia mainline station, so don't go all the way to the centre. All the staff are terrific - really helpful and friendly. It's worth paying a little extra for one of the rooms that open out on to the patio: sure, it's tiny but it's great to get your breakfast out there for a treat. Remember to book your feast the night before and you won't be disappointed. Just don't plan to walk too fast for the next few hours...... Bathrooms are small but clean and modern. The lobby and the rooms are all unique and filled with old furniture and antiques. If you wander round the side streets away from the touristy areas, you'll find bars with menus on blackboards, with staff who don't speak a word of English but can serve you a beer and good meal for a fraction of the rip-off places. Much more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreaLeverkusen
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the L´Antic Espai. The location is great, very central (a five minutes-walk to the Placa de Catalunya where the airport-bus stops) and we never were afraid going home in the darkness. We had to ring a bell at the hotel-door because it lies on the first floor. You have to know that there is no lift. We got a very warm welcome and a free drink (wine, beer, water ..) which comes with a small snack (nuts etc.). We booked room 101 which has two beds and a small balcony to the street. The street is a main street but we had a wonderful sleep nevertheless. The rooms are amazing at the L´Antic Espai. It is like staying in another century with its old furniture, but it has all comfort you need (like a LCD-TV, DVD-Player). The mattresses are hard, which my husband liked (me not so much). The floor is a stone-floor with a mosaic and the bathroom has a shower and seems to be newly renovated. Everything is neat and clean and there were even fresh flowers in the room. Breakfast is not included. You can have it on a small terrace outside (we did not ask whether you can have it in your room, too) and you have to order it the evening before. Although we didn´t do that we could have a small breakfast at our first morning. We entered the terrace through another room which was free. There are some rooms connected to the terrace directly. I liked the rooms to the street more because they are more seperated. The reception is occupied 24 hours a day. When you come home into the hotel you always have to ring the bell outside and somebody says holla to you. Although we never knew that from a hotel we liked it very much because nowbody was able to enter the hotel if he hasn´t got a room there. We surely will visit the L´Antic Espai again the next time we stay in Barcelona! Many thanks again to all the nice people at the reception, especially for the Tapa-Bar hint to go to "Ciutat Comtal"...! Andrea, 41, Leverkusen/Germany

Reviews.Title: “loved the antiques at L'Antic”
Reviews.Author: annabelleD
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks in spain, spending our last 2 nights in Barcelona at L'antic Espai. The location is spectacular...3 blocks from the Casa Balti, and 3 blocks from the airport bus stop. On the second floor of a gracious Barcelona townhouse, this hotel is a little gem. The special touches are wonderful; choclate truffles, terry bath robes, crystal water glasses, lovely furnishings, in house video library. Don't be put off by the rather rustic front door. Serge and company make you feel special from the first minute you arrive. I wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: WrldTravlr247
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews, my friends and I decided to stay at the Hostal L'Antic Espai in Barcelona, Spain. There were a few outweighing factors that assisted in making our decision: 1) Recommendations - As I mentioned, the place had received countless positive reviews and the hotel did fit the bill, by exceeding our expectations. 2) Location - The Hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from plenty of shopping stores and is approximately a 10 walking distance from Las Ramblas. There is a Metro stop approximately two blocks away and many historical sites and museums are within walking distance. 3) Price - In comparing prices to neighboring hotels, the price per night (for a triple bed) totalled approximately 144 (USD) 14, whereas other hotels charged as much as 400+ per night. The staff namely Sergio, Felipe, and Abel were extremely helpful and on numerous occasions went out of their way to feel guests feel welcomed. I personally goofed on our reservations a few times, which caused them to make several changes to our reservations and during each correspondence they warmly made my changes. The rooms are fashionably decorated (much like the staff) and offer a warm welcome. The terrace is a good spot to enjoy the weather while reading a book. You will be able to hear children laughing and playing as the Hotel lies near a school, but they cannot be heard once the doors are shut. Some both positive and not so positive remarks: positive: 1) The staff is super friendly and offers their advice when possible 2) Location - Close to restaurants, shopping, and attraction sites 3) Price - We couldn't find a hotel that offered the same rates where service was unparalleled 4) Free Internet (this helps out and if you'd like there are two Internet cafes nearby) negative: 1) the rooms are somewhat smaller than I was used to, but we managed without any complications 2) During the day you may be able to hear the kitchen a bit, but some earplugs (recommended for every travel) will easily solve the problem. Many more positives for the hotel and highly recommended. This was my second time in Barcelona and I have stayed in approximately five different hotels, but this one was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “the wonder of trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: elestoban
Reviews.Content: The wonder of trip advisor - no - not this hotel - but that both the previous reviews can be correct - which they are !!! The hotel is a gem , very different & very quirky but yes if 3 stay in a triple room it will be very very cramped.See previous reviews ref antiques,ornaments etc - they must spend hours dusting everything !! i was travelling with my mate & the doubles looked like doubles not twins , the triple was only about 15 euros more so we booked that & for 2 it was fine, for 3 with cases horrible like camping. the location is good, if u want something out of the ordinary but without spending a fortune give it a go

Reviews.Title: “We agree totally!”
Reviews.Author: D&DWoods
Reviews.Content: It's hard to add anything more to the previous reviews, other than we agree with the positive comments. We took the bus from the airport to Plaza Catalunya. Facing the Corte Ingles store, go left 2 1/2 blocks to the Gran Via, and then go right two blocks. It's easy to get to. For a different hotel experience, this is fantastic. We felt as though we were guests of a well-to-do family from around the turn-of-the-century who owned one of those five-story houses along the Gran Via. We had probably the best room (and the most expensive at 135 euro), #102, because it includes the balcony that projects out over the front entrance. The ceiling has the original stucco and gold-leaf trim with a glass chandelier. The warmth and attentiveness of Sergio and Abel add a lot to one's stay. The hotel is a marvelous showplace for the beautiful art pieces that they collect. This is a peaceful, safe, romantic place to stay in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love the L'Antic Espai”
Reviews.Author: KushLondon
Reviews.Content: Based on all the reviews I was really looking forward to staying here but when we arrived I was very very disapointed. We were 3 people staying in a triple room which was very very cramped, definately not enough space for us to even open three suitcases at the same time! The walls of the room were extremely thin so we could hear every little noise and movement outside the room which was annoying and made sleeping difficult . I heard a few guests complaining to Sergio about this as well. The other thing that was disappointing is that there is no english TV channels which was surprising and not something I could easily get used too. Also on the website they state that they have laundry facilities but this is not really the case. They made us an offer to do one load of laundry (a full load only) for 20 Euros- we wanted to launder 2 pairs of jeans so of course I was not going to pay 20 Euros! Sergio and Able were polite but I didn't find them particularly friendly nor did they go our of their way to provide us with any information or assistance we needed. I found Marianne to be the most helpful. Although it has its charms, for the price (no breakfast included either)I would prefer to stay else where. The two hotels closest to the Antic Espai offered similar pricing with 4 star facilities so I think I will stay there on my next visit for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A very Special Place”
Reviews.Author: Juliespeak
Reviews.Content: What a find! Thank you TravelAdvisor, the best reviews are more than true. On a lovely avenue with old Historic buildings, far enough away from the obnoxious Ramblas but centrally located and easy to get to anything else. The hotel is lovely, filled with unusual fine antiques. Everything is of the highest quality and the service is kind and attentive. Abel and Serge have put their hearts into this business and do everything to make their clients comfortable and feel welcome. Breakfast on the terrace is heavenly. A very romantic spot but lovely too if you are traveling alone as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: montagne
Reviews.Content: Utterly wonderful. We stayed in room 107 and really couldnt have enjoyed it more. Do stay here, a home away from home and nothing is too much trouble for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “my second home”
Reviews.Author: heyenga
Reviews.Content: i already spent various times in hostal l 'antic espai - and each time i am looking forward to come back again. the personal service of abel and sergio is highly appreciated. furthermore i like the rooms - each of them individually decorated with antic furniture and other antic items on a high level. the hostal l'antic espai is something very special - meantime my second home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: crts
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Hostal L'Antic Espai. I was worried because it had the name of Hostal in it rather than Hotel. This seems to be just a rule in Spain because it does not have a lobby on the ground floor! The Hostal L'Antic Espai is is a magical place that has been transformed by Sergio and Abel, the owners. The art work and attention to detail are first class. The rooms are comfortable, with hot showers and DVD players in each room, though with so much to do in Barcelona, you won't need them. The rooms were immaculate and everything is well cared for. The hotel has only been open for a year. If you are looking for a boutique hotel with a fantastic location, this is the place. It is easy to walk to the Las Ramblas and 2 blocks from a metro station for connections anywhere else in Barcelons. Add to this the friendly owners with lots of inside information on the city and you can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A hint of antiquity in modern Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kiwish
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at L'Antic Espai. Everyone was friendly. The rooms were beautiful. The decor is fantastic and has the look and feel of an old fashioned historic hotel and yet the bathrooms are modern and clean and the hotel is certainly well priced for Barcelona which is generally overly expensive as regards accomodation. It is in a fantastic location - really easy to walk to Las Ramblas and it has plenty of great restaurants nearby. We would go there again the next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect entry way to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pathfinder54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a delightful visit to Catalunya. It was made all the more pleasant by our stay at the Hostal L'Antic Espai. The many other 5-star reviews of this charming hostal completely convey my impressions and experience with this place, made special by its owners Sergio and Abel along with their kind and helpful staff. The rooms with a terrace provide a nice refuge before and after a day's trek around the amazing, friendly city of Barcelona. And, do go to the recommended tapas bar just down the street -- Ciudad Condal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and welcoming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evany
Reviews.Content: This is a very special boutique hotel in the heart of Barcelona. The attention to detail is what struck me. Abel, one of the owners, told me that he and Sergio had designed the hotel as the ideal place where they themselves would want to stay - and it shows. Nothing was overlooked in either the appearance or the service. As a woman travelling alone, I found this hotel an ideal place to stay. I highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Special, charming, and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: davel90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Hostal L'Antic Espai and can only confirm the many positive comments already available on Trip Advisor: Warm welcoming atmosphere, hospitable hosts, nothing any trouble. Website photographs accurate. Good location. Abundance of hot water in shower and good pressure. Someone always available at reception to welcome you. Clean and spotless. Comfy beds.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal L' Antic Espai
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 660, principal, ES-08010 Barcelona, Spain
